subject: math_general
question:
a multiple choice test consists of 4 questions , and each question has 5 answer choices . in how many r ways can the test be completed if every question is unanswered ?

Options:
A. 24
B. 120
C. 625
D. 720
E. 1024
answer_text: "5 choices for each of the 4 questions , thus total r of 5 * 5 * 5 * 5 = 5 ^ 4 = 625 ways to answer all of them . answer : C. Here is the formula power(5, 4)

subject: math_general
question:
a 3 - digit positive integer is chosen at random . what is the probability that the product of its digits is even ?

Options:
A. 1 / 2
B. 31 / 36
C. 49 / 54
D. 7 / 8
E. 11 / 12
answer_text: p ( three odd digits ) = 5 / 9 * 5 / 10 * 5 / 10 = 5 / 36 ( first digit can not be 0 , so we have a total of 9 digits , 4 even and 5 odd ) . therefore , p ( at least one even digit ) = 1 - 5 / 36 = 31 / 36 . answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(const_1, power(divide(const_1, const_2), 3))

subject: math_general
question:
if x and y are positive integers and 7 + x + y + xy = 21 , what is the value of x + y ?

Options:
A. 3
B. 5
C. 6
D. 8
E. 9
answer_text: "try each answer choices . for a : 7 + 3 + xy = 21 ; xy = 11 ( impossible , 11 prime number . 1 + 11 does n ' t equal 3 ) for b : 7 + 5 + xy = 21 ; xy = 9 ( no combination of xy = 9 and x + y = 5 ) for c : 7 + 6 + xy = 21 ; xy = 8 ( x + y = 6 ; x = 2 , y = 4 or x = 4 , y = 2 ) for d : 7 + 8 + xy = 21 ; xy = 6 ( no combination of xy = 6 and x + y = 8 ) for e : 7 + 9 + xy = 21 ; xy = 5 ( impossible , 5 prime number . 1 + 5 does n ' t equal 9 ) therefore , answer : C. Here is the formula add(21, const_1)

subject: math_general
question:
the hcf and lcm of two numbers m and n are respectively 6 and 210 . if m + n = 72 , then 1 / m + 1 / n is equal to

Options:
A. 1 / 35
B. 3 / 35
C. 5 / 37
D. 2 / 35
E. none
answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula divide(72, multiply(6, 210))

subject: math_physics
question:
in a kilometer race , a beats b by 48 meters or 12 seconds . what time does a take to complete the race ?

Options:
A. 238 sec
B. 190 sec
C. 667 sec
D. 167 sec
E. 176 sec
answer_text: "time taken by b run 1000 meters = ( 1000 * 12 ) / 48 = 250 sec . time taken by a = 250 - 12 = 238 sec . answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(divide(multiply(const_1, const_1000), divide(48, 12)), 12)

subject: math_gain
question:
in a school of 650 boys , 44 % of muslims , 28 % hindus , 10 % sikhs and the remaining of other communities . how many belonged to the other communities ?

Options:
A. 173
B. 163
C. 153
D. 143
E. 117
answer_text: 44 + 28 + 10 = 82 % 100 – 82 = 18 % 650 * 18 / 100 = 117 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(multiply(650, subtract(const_100, add(add(44, 28), 10))), const_100)

subject: math_physics
question:
a can do a piece of work in 4 hours ; b and c together can do it in 3 hours , while a and c together can do it 2 hours . how long will b alone take to do it ?

Options:
A. 8 hours
B. 10 hours
C. 12 hours
D. 24 hours
E. none of these
answer_text: "solution a ’ s 1 hour ’ s work = 1 / 4 ; ( b + c ) ' s 1 hour ’ s work = 1 / 3 ; ( a + c ) ' s 1 hour ’ s work = 1 / 2 ( a + b + c ) ’ s 1 hour ’ s work = ( 1 / 4 + 1 / 3 ) = 7 / 12 b ’ s 1 hour ’ s work = ( 7 / 12 - 1 / 2 ) = 1 / 12 ∴ b alone will take 12 hours to do the work . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(const_1, subtract(divide(const_1, 3), subtract(divide(const_1, 2), divide(const_1, 4))))

subject: math_general
question:
in a group of 160 people , 90 have an age of more 30 years , and the others have an age of less than 20 years . if a person is selected at random from this group , what is the probability the person ' s age is less than 20 ?

Options:
A. 0.44
B. 0.55
C. 0.65
D. 0.75
E. 0.85
answer_text: "number of people whose age is less than 20 is given by 160 - 90 = 70 probability p that a person selected at random from the group is less than 20 is gieven by 70 / 160 = 0.4375 ~ 0.44 correct answer : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(160, 90), 160)

subject: math_general
question:
an art gallery has only paintings and sculptures . currently , 1 / 3 of the pieces of art are displayed , and 1 / 6 of the pieces on display are sculptures . if 1 / 3 of the pieces not on display are paintings , and 800 sculptures are not on display , how many pieces of art does the gallery have ?

Options:
A. 360
B. 1800
C. 540
D. 640
E. 720
answer_text: "too many words and redundant info there . ( i ) 1 / 3 of the pieces of art are displayed , hence 2 / 3 of the pieces of art are not displayed . ( ii ) 1 / 6 of the pieces on display are sculptures , hence 5 / 6 of the pieces on display are paintings . ( iii ) 1 / 3 of the pieces not on display are paintings , hence 2 / 3 of the pieces not on display are sculptures . 800 sculptures are not on display , so according to ( iii ) 2 / 3 * { not on display } = 800 - - > { not on display } = 1200 . according to ( i ) 2 / 3 * { total } = 1200 - - > { total } = 1800 . answer : B. Here is the formula divide(divide(800, subtract(1, divide(1, 3))), subtract(1, divide(1, 3)))

subject: math_general
question:
if x and y are integers and | x - y | = 10 , what is the minimum possible value of xy ?

Options:
A. - 9
B. - 18
C. - 24
D. - 25
E. - 48
answer_text: "sometimes the answer choices to a given question provide a big ' hint ' as to how you can go about solving it . this prompt can also be solved without any complex math ideas - you just need to do a bit of ' brute force ' math and you ' ll have the answer relatively quickly . we ' re told that x and y are integers and | x - y | = 10 . we ' re asked for the minimum possible value of ( x ) ( y ) . since all of the answer choices are negative , this tells us that one of the two variables must be negative ( and the other must be positive ) , so we should restrict our work to those options . if . . . x = 9 , y = - 1 , then xy = - 9 x = 8 , y = - 2 , then xy = - 16 x = 7 , y = - 3 , then xy = - 21 x = 6 , y = - 4 , then xy = - 24 x = 5 , y = - 5 , then xy = - 25 x = 4 , y = - 6 , then xy = - 24 x = 3 , y = - 7 , then xy = - 21 from this , we can conclude the xy will start to get bigger as x continues to decrease down to 1 , so there ' s no need to do any additional work . final answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(negate(add(const_2, const_3)), subtract(10, add(const_2, const_3)))

subject: math_physics
question:
two trains , one from howrah to patna and the other from patna to howrah , start simultaneously . after they meet , the trains reach their destinations after 25 hours and 16 hours respectively . the ratio of their speeds is ?

Options:
A. 4 : 6
B. 4 : 3
C. 4 : 9
D. 4 : 5
E. 4 : 2
answer_text: "let us name the trains a and b . then , ( a ' s speed ) : ( b ' s speed ) = â ˆ š b : â ˆ š a = â ˆ š 16 : â ˆ š 25 = 4 : 5 . answer : D. Here is the formula divide(sqrt(16), sqrt(25))

subject: math_physics
question:
one copy machine can make 20 copies a minute , and a second copy machine makes 10 copies a minute . if the two copiers work together , how long would it take them to make 900 copies ?

Options:
A. 10 minutes
B. 20 minutes
C. 25 minutes
D. 30 minutes
E. 35 minutes
answer_text: "total work done by both machines in a minute = 20 + 10 = 30 copies total number of copies required = 900 time = 900 / 30 = 30 mins answer : D. Here is the formula divide(power(10, const_3), add(20, 10))

subject: math_gain
question:
at what rate of compound interest per annum will a sum of rs . 1200 become rs . 1348.32 in 2 years ?

Options:
A. 6 %
B. 6.5 %
C. 7 %
D. 7.5 %
E. 8 %
answer_text: explanation : let the rate be r % p . a . then , 1200 x ( 1 + r / 100 ) 2 = 1348.32 = ( 1 + r / 100 ) 2 = 134832 / 120000 = 11236 / 10000 ( 1 + r / 100 ) 2 = ( 106 / 100 ) 2 = > 1 + r / 100 = 106 / 100 r = 6 % answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(sqrt(divide(multiply(1348.32, const_100), divide(1200, const_100))), sqrt(divide(multiply(1200, const_100), divide(1200, const_100))))

subject: math_gain
question:
in the first 10 overs of a cricket game , the run rate was only 6.2 . what should be the run rate in the remaining 40 overs to reach the target of 282 runs ?

Options:
A. 6.25
B. 5.5
C. 6.75
D. 7
E. 8
answer_text: "10 overs - run rate = 6.2 runs scored in first 10 overs = 62 remaining overs 40 total runs to be scored = 282 62 runs already scored 282 - 62 = 220 220 runs to be scored in 40 overs let required runrate be x 40 * x = 220 x = 220 / 40 x = 5.5 the required runrate is 5.5 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(subtract(282, multiply(10, 6.2)), 40)

subject: math_general
question:
given f ( x ) = 3 x – 5 , for what value of x does 2 * [ f ( x ) ] + 2 = f ( 3 x – 6 )

Options:
A. 0
B. 4
C. 5
D. 7
E. 13
answer_text: "answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(add(multiply(2, 5), 2), add(multiply(3, 3), 5)), subtract(multiply(2, 3), multiply(3, const_1)))

subject: math_physics
question:
during a car trip , maria stopped to rest after she traveled 1 / 2 of the total distance to her destination . she stopped again after she traveled 1 / 4 of the distance remaining between her first stop and her destination , and then she drove the remaining 135 miles to her detination . what was the total distance , in miles from maria ' s starting point to her destination ?

Options:
A. 280
B. 320
C. 360
D. 420
E. 480
answer_text: easy 360 is the answer . 3 / 4 ( x / 2 ) = 135 x = 135 * 8 / 3 = 360 . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(135, subtract(1, add(divide(1, 2), multiply(divide(1, 2), divide(1, 4)))))

subject: math_general
question:
5 , 11 , 23 , 41 , 64 , _

Options:
A. 95
B. 96
C. 97
D. 98
E. 99
answer_text: "5 + 6 = 11 11 + 6 * 2 ; 11 + 12 = 23 23 + 6 * 3 ; 23 + 18 = 41 41 + 6 * 4 ; 41 + 24 = 65 65 + 6 * 5 ; 65 + 30 = 95 answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(negate(41), multiply(subtract(11, 23), divide(subtract(11, 23), subtract(5, 11))))

subject: math_general
question:
the smallest number which when diminished by 6 , is divisible 12 , 14 , 16 , 18 and 22 is :

Options:
A. 11099
B. 11094
C. 11091
D. 10323
E. 10483
answer_text: "required number = ( l . c . m . of 12 , 14 , 16 , 18 , 22 ) + 6 = 11088 + 6 = 11094 answer : B. Here is the formula add(multiply(multiply(power(const_3, 6), power(6, const_4)), add(const_3, const_4)), 6)

subject: math_physics
question:
3 pumps , working 8 hours a day , can empty a tank in 2 days . how many hours a day must 15 pumps work to empty the tank in 1 day ?

Options:
A. 3.5
B. 4.8
C. 5.1
D. 5.2
E. 6.3
answer_text: "3 pumps take 16 hrs total ( 8 hrs a day ) if 1 pump will be working then , it will need 16 * 3 = 48 hrs 1 pump need 48 hrs if i contribute 15 pumps then 48 / 15 = 3.5 hrs . answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(multiply(3, 8), 2), 15)

subject: math_physics
question:
a and b go around a circular track of length 600 m on a cycle at speeds of 36 kmph and 54 kmph . after how much time will they meet for the first time at the starting point ?

Options:
A. 120
B. 775
C. 555
D. 288
E. 278
answer_text: "time taken to meet for the first time at the starting point = lcm { length of the track / speed of a , length of the track / speed of b } = lcm { 600 / ( 36 * 5 / 18 ) , 600 / ( 54 * 5 / 18 ) } = lcm ( 60 , 40 ) = 120 sec . answer : A. Here is the formula divide(600, subtract(multiply(54, const_0_2778), multiply(36, const_0_2778)))

subject: math_general
question:
if x and y are integers and 2 x – y = 11 , then 4 x + y can not be

Options:
A. – 5
B. 1
C. 13
D. 17
E. 55
answer_text: "2 x - y = 11 2 x = 11 + y 4 x = 22 + 2 y now we need to check the value of 4 x + 4 = > 22 + 2 y + y = 22 + 3 y hence 22 + 3 y = value ( in the options ) so y = value - 22 / 3 so checking the options only d is unfit answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(negate(add(const_2, const_3)), subtract(2, add(const_2, const_3)))

subject: math_general
question:
the ratio of ducks and frogs in a pond is 37 : 39 respectively . the average number of ducks and frogs in the pond is 132 . what is the number of frogs in the pond ?

Options:
A. 148
B. 134
C. 156
D. 144
E. none
answer_text: "solution : ratio of ducks and frogs in pond , = 37 : 39 . average of ducks and frogs in pond , = 132 . so , total number of ducks and frogs in the pond , = 2 * 132 = 262 . therefore , number of frogs , = ( 262 * 39 ) / 76 = 134 . answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(39, divide(132, divide(add(add(37, 39), const_2), const_2)))

subject: math_physics
question:
calculate the circumference of a circular field whose radius is 7 centimeters .

Options:
A. 11 π cm
B. 15 π cm
C. 1 π cm
D. 4 π cm
E. 14 π cm
answer_text: "circumference c is given by c = 2 π r = 2 π * 7 = 14 π cm answer : E. Here is the formula circumface(7)

subject: math_physics
question:
a certain car can travel 32 kilometers on a liter of fuel . if the fuel tank ’ s contents decrease by 3.9 gallons over a period of 5.7 hours as the car moves at a constant speed , how fast is the car moving , in miles per hour ? ( 1 gallon = 3.8 liters ; 1 mile = 1.6 kilometers )

Options:
A. 52
B. 65
C. 78
D. 91
E. 104
answer_text: "fuel used 3.9 gallons ; convert to liters - - > 3.9 x 3.8 liters time = 5.7 hours 1 mile = 1.6 kilometers ; convert to miles - - > 1 km = 1 / 1.6 mile speed ( km / hour ) = d / t = 32 ( km * ) x 3.9 x 3.8 / 5.7 replace ( km * ) to miles ; multiply by 1 / 1.6 mile speed ( miles / hour ) = 32 x 3.9 x 3.8 / 5.7 x 1.6 = 78 miles / hour ans : a ps : i felt the factors were easy to cancel out , so did n ' t require much rounding off = 32 x 3.9 x 3.8 / 5.7 x 1.6 = 52answer : A.Here is the formula divide(multiply(divide(multiply(32, 3.8), 1.6), 3.9), 5.7)

subject: math_general
question:
a , b , c and d enter into partnership . a subscribes 1 / 3 of the capital b 1 / 4 , c 1 / 5 and d the rest . how much share did c get in a profit of rs . 2430 ?

Options:
A. s . 432
B. s . 486
C. s . 822
D. s . 812
E. s . 810
answer_text: "let the total amount in the partnership be ' x ' . then a ' s share = x / 3 b ' s share = x / 4 c ' s share = x / 5 d ' s share = x - ( x / 3 + x / 4 + x / 5 ) = 13 x / 60 a : b : c : d = x / 3 : x / 4 : x / 5 : 13 x / 60 = 20 : 15 : 12 : 13 a ' s share in the profit of rs . 2430 = 12 ( 2430 / 60 ) = rs . 486 answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(2430, divide(1, 3))

subject: math_other
question:
the ratio of the number of females to males at a party was 1 : 2 but when 7 females and 7 males left , the ratio became 1 : 3 . how many people were at the party originally ?

Options:
A. 28
B. 32
C. 36
D. 42
E. 50
answer_text: the total number of people are x females + 2 x males . 3 * ( x - 7 ) = 2 x - 7 x = 14 there were 3 x = 42 people at the party originally . the answer : D. Here is the formula add(divide(subtract(multiply(multiply(7, 2), 3), multiply(7, 2)), const_2), subtract(multiply(multiply(7, 2), 3), multiply(7, 2)))

question:

question:

C. $ 2383

E. $ 300
answer_text: "a = p ( 1 + r / 100 ) ^ t = 1200 ( 1 + 20 / 100 ) ^ 6 = $ 3583 ci = $ 2383 answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(1200, power(add(const_1, divide(20, const_100)), 6)), 1200)

subject: math_physics
question:
you need to unlock a secret code using following clues , can you ? here you have the clues : clue - 1 : 0 7 9 ( one of the numbers is correct and is placed in its correct position ) clue - 2 : 0 3 2 ( nothing is correct ) clue - 3 : 1 0 8 ( two numbers are correct but not placed at its correct position . ) clue - 4 : 9 2 6 ( one number is correct but not placed at its correct position . ) clue - 5 : 6 7 8 ( one number is correct but not placed at its correct position . )

Options:
A. 819
B. 918
C. 198
D. 189
E. 891
answer_text: 0 7 9 : 9 is placed correctly * 0 3 2 : none of the numbers is in the code * 1 0 8 : 1 and 8 are correct number of code but placed at wrong position * 9 2 6 : number 9 is there but placed at wrong position * 6 7 8 : number 8 is there but placed at wrong position correct answer : A. Here is the formula add(add(multiply(8, const_100), multiply(1, const_10)), 9)

question:

subject: math_general
question:
set s contains exactly 10 numbers and has an average ( arithmetic mean ) of 6.2 . if one of the numbers in set s is increased by 7 , while all other numbers remain the same , what is the new average of set s ?

Options:
A. 6.6
B. 6.7
C. 6.8
D. 6.85
E. 6.9
answer_text: "old set s - total is avg * no of elements = 6.2 * 10 = 62 if one number is increased by 7 then total increased to 62 + 7 = 69 new avg - 69 / 10 = 6.9 . hence answer : E. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(10, 6.2), 7), 10)

subject: math_general
question:
if p ( a ) = 1 / 5 and p ( b ) = 2 / 5 , find p ( a n b ) if a and b are independent events .

Options:
A. 7 / 25
B. 3 / 25
C. 8 / 25
D. 2 / 25
E. 3 / 17
answer_text: "p ( a n b ) = p ( a ) . p ( b ) p ( a n b ) = 1 / 5 . 2 / 5 p ( a n b ) = 2 / 25 .answer : D.Here is the formula multiply(divide(1, 5), divide(2, 5))

subject: math_physics
question:
a train is 320 meter long is running at a speed of 45 km / hour . in what time will it pass a bridge of 140 meter length ?

Options:
A. 11 seconds
B. 38 seconds
C. 40 seconds
D. 88 seconds
E. 36.8 seconds
answer_text: "speed = 45 km / hr = 45 * ( 5 / 18 ) m / sec = 25 / 2 m / sec total distance = 320 + 140 = 460 meter time = distance / speed = 460 * ( 2 / 25 ) = 36.8 seconds answer : E. Here is the formula divide(add(320, 140), divide(multiply(45, const_1000), const_3600))

question:

answer_text: "i also got a . by punching in numers : x . . . 7 ^ 2 = . . . 9 . . . 8 ^ 2 = . . . 4 . . . 9 ^ 2 = . . . 1 .answer : A.Here is the formula power(add(multiply(9, 2), 2), 2)

question:
by the how much is two - fifth of 300 greater than 3 - fifths of 125 ?

answer_text: reqd no . = 2 â  „ 5 ã — 300 - 3 â  „ 5 ã — 125 = 120 - 75 = 45 answer : D. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(divide(const_2, add(const_2, const_3)), 300), multiply(divide(3, add(const_2, const_3)), 125))

question:
a collection of books went on sale , and 2 / 3 of them were sold for $ 3.50 each . if none of the 40 remaining books were sold , what was the total amount received for the books that were sold ?

answer_text: "if 40 books constitute 1 / 3 rd of the total , then 2 / 3 rd of the total = 80 books amount received for sold books = 80 * 3.5 = $ 280 answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(const_2.0, divide(multiply(40, divide(2, 3)), divide(const_1, 3)))

question:

question:
an error 10 % in excess is made while measuring the side of a square . now what is the percentage of error in the calculated area of the square ?

answer_text: "percentage error in calculated area = ( 10 + 10 + ( 10 ã — 10 ) / 100 ) % = 21 % answer : D. Here is the formula divide(multiply(subtract(square_area(add(const_100, 10)), square_area(const_100)), const_100), square_area(const_100))

question:

subject: math_general
question:
in my , xiang sold 15 used cars . for these 15 used cars the range of selling prices was 15000 and the lowest selling price was 4500 . in june , xiang sold 10 cars . for these 10 cars the range of selling was 16000 and the lowest selling price was 5000 . what was the range of selling prices for the 25 used car sold by xiang in may and june ?

Options:
A. 15,600
B. 15,750
C. 16,820
D. 18,100
E. 19,200
answer_text: for 10 cars - 16000 + 5000 = 21,000 for 15 cars - 15000 + 4500 = 19,500 max = 21,000 min 4500 answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(divide(subtract(add(5000, 16000), 4500), const_1000), const_1)

subject: math_general
question:
if 2 a = 3 b and ab ≠ 0 , what is the ratio of a / 3 to b / 2 ?

Options:
A. 27 / 8
B. 8 / 27
C. 1
D. 9 / 4
E. 81 / 64
answer_text: "a nice fast approach is the first find a pair of numbers that satisfy the given equation : 2 a = 3 b here ' s one pair : a = 3 and b = 2 what is the ratio of a / 3 to b / 3 ? in other words , what is the value of ( a / 3 ) / ( b / 2 ) ? plug in values to get : ( a / 3 ) / ( b / 2 ) = ( 3 / 3 ) / ( 2 / 2 ) = 1 / 1 = 1answer : C.Here is the formula divide(multiply(2, 3), multiply(3, 2))

subject: math_general
question:
each digit 1 through 5 is used exactly once to create a 5 - digit integer . if the 3 and the 4 can not be adjacent digits in the integer , how many 5 - digit integers are possible ?

Options:
A. 48
B. 66
C. 72
D. 78
E. 90
answer_text: total number of 5 digit numbers that can be formed = 5 ! = 120 . total number of 5 digit numbers in which 3 and 4 are adjacent = 48 . this can be calculated by taking 3 and 4 as a pair and considering positions where they can appear . number of 5 digit numbers in which 3 and 4 are not adjacent = total number of 5 digit numbers - total number of 5 digit numbers in which 3 and 4 are adjacent . ans : C. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(multiply(multiply(5, 4), 3), const_2), multiply(multiply(multiply(4, 3), const_2), const_2))

subject: math_physics
question:
in a 200 m race , a beats b by 20 m and c by 38 m . in a race of 600 m b will beat c by

Options:
A. 20 m
B. 30 m
C. 25 m
D. 15 m
E. 60 m
answer_text: "it means , when a covers 200 m , b covers only ( 200 - 20 ) = 180 m and c covers only ( 200 - 38 ) = 162 m = > when c covers 162 m , b covers 180 m = > when b covers 600 m , c covers 162 / 180 × 600 = 540 m hence , b beats c by 600 - 540 = 60 metre answer : E. Here is the formula subtract(600, multiply(inverse(multiply(divide(200, subtract(200, 38)), divide(subtract(200, 20), 200))), 600))

subject: math_physics
question:
in what time will a train 120 m long cross an electric pole , it its speed be 121 km / hr ?

Options:
A. 2.5
B. 2.7
C. 2.9
D. 3.6
E. 2.1
answer_text: "speed = 121 * 5 / 18 = 33.6 m / sec time taken = 120 / 33.6 = 3.6 sec . answer : D. Here is the formula divide(120, multiply(121, const_0_2778))

subject: math_general
question:
at a recent small town election for mayor a total of 963 votes were cast for the 4 candidates , the winner exceding his opponents by 53 , 79 and 105 votes , respectively . how many votes were cast for each candidate ?

Options:
A. 134
B. 178
C. 195
D. 166
E. 194
answer_text: answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(divide(add(add(963, 53), add(79, 105)), const_4), 105)

subject: math_gain
question:
a customer went to a shop and paid a total of $ 30 , out of which 90 cents was for sales tax on taxable purchases . if the tax rate was 6 % , then what was the cost of the tax free items ?

Options:
A. $ 12.70
B. $ 13.20
C. $ 14.10
D. $ 15.60
E. $ 16.80
answer_text: "the total cost was $ 30 . the tax was $ 0.90 let the original price of the taxable items = x given that tax rate = 6 % 0.06 x = 0.90 x = $ 15 the cost of the tax free items was $ 30 - $ 15 - $ 0.90 = $ 14.10 the answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(subtract(30, 90), multiply(6, const_2))

subject: math_gain
question:
in a certain pond , 50 fish were caught , tagged , and returned to the pond . a few days later , 50 fish were caught again , of which 5 were found to have been tagged . if the percent of tagged fish in the second catch approximates the percent of tagged fish in the pond , what is the approximate number of fish in the pond ?

Options:
A. 400
B. 500
C. 1,250
D. 2,500
E. 10,000
answer_text: answer : B. Here is the formula divide(50, divide(5, 50))

subject: math_general
question:
tickets numbered 1 to 20 are mixed up and then a ticket is drawn at random . what is the probability taht the ticket drawn has a number which is a multiple of 3 or 5 ?

Options:
A. 1 / 2
B. 2 / 5
C. 8 / 15
D. 9 / 20
E. none
answer_text: "solution here s = ( 1 , 2,3 , 4,5 , . . . , 19,20 ) . let e = event of getting a multiple of 3 or 5 = ( 3 , 6,9 , 12,15 , 18,5 , 10,20 ) p ( e ) = n ( e ) / n ( s ) = 9 / 20 . answer : D. Here is the formula divide(3, const_10)

subject: math_physics
question:
together , 15 type a machines and 7 type b machines can complete a certain job in 4 hours . together 8 type b machines and 15 type c machines can complete the same job in 11 hours . how many q hours would it take one type a machine , one type b machine , and one type c machine working together to complete the job ( assuming constant rates for each machine ) ?

Options:
A. 22 hours
B. 30 hours
C. 44 hours
D. 60 hours
E. it can not be determined from the information above .
answer_text: "say the rates of machines a , b and c are a , b , and c , respectively . together 15 type a machines and 7 type b machines can complete a certain job in 4 hours - - > 15 a + 7 b = 1 / 4 ; together 8 type b machines and 15 type c machines can complete the same job in 11 hours - - > 8 b + 15 c = 1 / 11 . sum the above : 15 a + 15 b + 15 c = 1 / 4 + 1 / 11 = 15 / 44 - - > reduce by 15 : a + b + c = 1 / 44 - - > so , the combined rate of the three machines is 1 / 44 job / hour - - > time is reciprocal of the rate , thus machines a , b and c can do the job q in 44 hours . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(const_1, divide(add(divide(const_1, 4), divide(const_1, 11)), 15))

subject: math_geometry
question:
rectangular floors x and y have equal area . if floor x is 10 feet by 18 feet and floor y is 9 feet wide , what is the length of floor y , in feet ?

Options:
A. ['a ) 13 1 / 2'
B. 'b ) 20'
C. 'c ) 18 3 / 4'
D. 'd ) 21'
E. 'e ) 24']
answer_text: the area of a rectangle is : area = length x width we are given that floor x is 10 feet by 18 feet and that floor y is 9 feet wide . so we can say : length of x = 10 width of x = 18 width of y = 9 length of y = n we also can say : area of floor x = area of floor y ( length of x ) ( width of x ) = ( length of y ) ( width of y ) ( 10 ) ( 18 ) = 9 n ( 10 ) ( 2 ) = n 20 = n answer : B. Here is the formula divide(rectangle_area(10, 18), 9)

subject: math_general
question:
find the product of the localvalue and absolutevalue of 6 in 20618 ?

Options:
A. 6300
B. 1100
C. 1200
D. 1300
E. 3600
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(6, const_1000), 6)

subject: math_gain
question:
a distributor sells a product through an online store , which take a commission of 20 % of the price set by the distributor . the distributor obtains the product from a producer at the price of $ 18 per item . what is the price that the buyer observers online if the distributor wants to maintain a 20 % profit on the cost of the item ?

Options:
A. $ 25
B. $ 26
C. $ 27
D. $ 28
E. $ 29
answer_text: "let x be the price that buyers see online . the distributor wants to receive 1.2 ( original price ) which should be 80 % of x . 1.2 ( 18 ) = 0.8 x x = 1.2 ( 18 ) / 0.8 = 1.5 ( 18 ) = $ 27 the answer : C. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(divide(20, const_100), 18), 18), divide(subtract(const_100, 20), const_100))

subject: math_general
question:
the average weight of a , b and c is 45 kg . if the average weight of a and b be 40 kg and that of b and c be 47 kg , then the weight of b is :

Options:
A. 39 kg
B. 32 kg
C. 33 kg
D. 34 kg
E. none of these
answer_text: "explanation : let a , b , c represent their respective weights . then , we have : a + b + c = ( 45 x 3 ) = 135 … . ( i ) a + b = ( 40 x 2 ) = 80 … . ( ii ) b + c = ( 47 x 2 ) = 94 … . ( iii ) adding ( ii ) and ( iii ) , we get : a + 2 b + c = 174 … . ( iv ) subtracting ( i ) from ( iv ) , we get : b = 39 . b ’ s weight = 39 kg . answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(add(multiply(40, const_2), multiply(47, const_2)), multiply(45, const_3))

subject: math_physics
question:
6 women can do 75 units of work in 8 days by working 5 hrs / day . in how many days can 4 women do 30 units of work by working 8 hrs / day ?

Options:
A. 3 days
B. 4 days
C. 5 days
D. 6 days
E. 7 days
answer_text: 6 x 8 x 5 / 75 = 4 x 8 xa / 30 solve this for a then we get a = 3 days answer : A. Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(multiply(6, 8), 5), 75), divide(multiply(4, 8), 30))

subject: math_physics
question:
the speed of a boat in still water is 20 km / hr and the rate of current is 5 km / hr . the distance travelled downstream in 18 minutes is :

Options:
A. 9.5
B. 5.5
C. 7.5
D. 6.5
E. 5.1
answer_text: "explanation : speed downstream = ( 20 + 5 ) kmph = 25 kmph distance travelled = ( 25 * ( 18 / 60 ) ) km = 7.5 km . answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(divide(18, const_60), add(20, 5))

subject: math_gain
question:
michelle deposited a certain sum of money in a savings account on july 1 st , 2007 . she earns an 14 % interest compounded semiannually . the sum of money in the account on december 31 st , 2009 is approximately what percent of the initial deposit ?

Options:
A. 117 %
B. 120 %
C. 121 %
D. 138 %
E. 145 %
answer_text: "since michelle earns 14 % interest compounded semiannually , then she earns 7 % interest every 6 months . now , the simple interest earned in 5 periods ( 30 months = 5 * 6 months ) would be 7 % * 5 = 35 % . but , since the interest iscompoundedevery 6 months , then there would be interest earned on interest ( very small amount ) thus the actual interest earned would be a little bit more than 35 % , only answer choice d fits . answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(power(add(1, divide(divide(14, const_100), const_2)), add(const_2, const_3)), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
the average of the marks of 30 students in a class is 45 . if the marks of each student are doubled , find the new average ?

Options:
A. 85
B. 77
C. 33
D. 90
E. 75
answer_text: "sum of the marks for the 30 students = 30 * 45 = 1350 . the marks of each student are doubled , the sum also will be doubled . the new sum = 1350 * 2 = 2700 . so , the new average = 2700 / 30 = 90 . answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(45, const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
mr . kramer , the losing candidate in a two - candidate election , received 942,568 votes , which was exactly 25 percent of all votes cast . approximately what percent of the remaining votes would he need to have received in order to have won at least 50 percent of all the votes cast ?

Options:
A. 10 %
B. 12 %
C. 15 %
D. 17 %
E. 33 %
answer_text: "lets assume that candidate got 25 % votes and total votes is 100 . candidate won = 25 remaining = 75 to get 50 % , candidate requires 25 votes from 100 which is 25 % and 25 votes from 75 . 25 / 75 = 33.33 % which is approx 33 % . hence the answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(divide(50, const_100), divide(25, const_100)), subtract(const_1, divide(25, const_100))), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
a certain company expects quarterly earnings of $ 0.80 per share of stock , half of which will be distributed as dividends to shareholders while the rest will be used for research and development . if earnings are greater than expected , shareholders will receive an additional $ 0.04 per share for each additional $ 0.10 of per share earnings . if quarterly earnings are $ 1.10 per share , what will be the dividend paid to a person who owns 100 shares of the company ' s stock ?

Options:
A. $ 92
B. $ 96
C. $ 52
D. $ 120
E. $ 240
answer_text: "eps actual > eps expected . each gets and additional . 12 per share . thus . 52 * 100 - - > $ 52 answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(add(divide(0.80, const_2), multiply(multiply(subtract(1.10, 0.80), const_10), 0.04)), 100)

subject: math_other
question:
the price of precious stone is directly proportional to square of its weight . what will be the loss incurred if a stone weighing 28 gm and costing 28,000 breaks into two pieces whose weights are in the ratio 15 : 13 ?

Options:
A. no loss
B. 10,000
C. 28,000
D. 9,500
E. 14,000
answer_text: x = 28000 / 28 ^ 2 = 35.71 cost of 15 g = 35.71 * 15 ^ 2 = 8035.714 cost of 13 g = 35.71 * 13 ^ 2 = 6035.714 total cost = 14071.428 loss = 28000 - 14071.428 = 13928.5 = 14000 answer : E. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(28, multiply(const_10, const_100)), add(multiply(divide(multiply(28, multiply(const_10, const_100)), multiply(28, 28)), multiply(13, 13)), multiply(divide(multiply(28, multiply(const_10, const_100)), multiply(28, 28)), multiply(15, 15))))

subject: math_general
question:
roy is now 6 years older than julia and half of that amount older than kelly . if in 4 years , roy will be twice as old as julia , then in 4 years what would be roy ’ s age multiplied by kelly ’ s age ?

Options:
A. 72
B. 84
C. 90
D. 96
E. 108
answer_text: r = j + 6 = k + 3 r + 4 = 2 ( j + 4 ) ( j + 6 ) + 4 = 2 j + 8 j = 2 r = 8 k = 5 in 4 years ( r + 4 ) ( k + 4 ) = 12 * 9 = 108 the answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(add(add(6, subtract(6, 4)), 4), add(subtract(add(6, subtract(6, 4)), divide(6, const_2)), 4))

subject: math_physics
question:
what is the least number of squares tiles required to pave the floor of a room 15 m 17 cm long and 9 m 2 cm broad

Options:
A. 814
B. 256
C. 3258
D. 896
E. 745
answer_text: "explanation : length of largest tile = h . c . f . of 1517 cm and 902 cm = 41 cm . area of each tile = ( 41 x 41 ) cm ^ 2 . required number of tiles = ( 1517 x 902 / 41 * 41 ) = 814 . answer : A. Here is the formula divide(rectangle_area(multiply(15, const_100), multiply(17, const_100)), square_area(add(multiply(const_4, const_10), const_1)))

subject: math_other
question:
x starts a business with rs . 45000 . y joins in the business after 4 months with rs . 30000 . what will be the ratio in which they should share the profit at the end of the year ?

Options:
A. 1 : 2
B. 2 : 1
C. 1 : 3
D. 3 : 1
E. 9 : 4
answer_text: "explanation : ratio in which they should share the profit = ratio of the investments multiplied by the time period = 45000 ã — 12 : 30000 ã — 8 = 45 ã — 12 : 30 ã — 8 = 3 ã — 12 : 2 ã — 8 = 9 : 4 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(multiply(45000, const_12), multiply(30000, add(const_4, const_3)))

subject: math_gain
question:
a salesperson received a commission of 3 percent of the sale price for each of the first 100 machines that she sold and 4 percent of the sale price for each machine that she sold after the first 100 . if the sale price of each machine was $ 10,000 and the salesperson received a $ 38,000 commission , how many machines did she sell ?

Options:
A. 90
B. 103
C. 105
D. 115
E. 120
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula add(100, divide(subtract(multiply(multiply(multiply(add(4, 3), multiply(3, const_2)), 100), multiply(add(4, const_1), const_2)), multiply(multiply(multiply(100, 100), divide(3, 100)), 100)), multiply(multiply(100, 100), divide(4, 100))))

subject: math_general
question:
a certain city with a population of 192,000 is to be divided into 11 voting districts , and no district is to have a population that is more than 10 percent greater than the population of any other district what is the minimum possible population that the least populated district could have ?

Options:
A. a ) 10,700
B. b ) 16,000
C. c ) 10,900
D. d ) 11,000
E. e ) 11,100
answer_text: "let x = number of people in smallest district x * 1.1 = number of people in largest district x will be minimised when the number of people in largest district is maximised 10 * x * 1.1 = 11 x = total number of people in other districts so we have 11 x + x = 192 k x = 16,000 answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(const_4, const_2), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
the mean of 50 observations was 36 . it was found later an observation 48 was wrongly taken as 23 . the corrected new means is :

Options:
A. 35.2
B. 36.1
C. 36.5
D. 39.1
E. none of these
answer_text: "solution correct sum = ( 36 × 50 + 48 - 23 ) = 1525 . ∴ correct mean = 1825 / 50 = 36.5 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(36, 50), subtract(subtract(50, const_2), 23)), 50)

subject: math_general
question:
there are 750 male and female participants in a meeting . half the female participants and one - quarterof the male participants are democrats . one - third of all the participants are democrats . how many of the democrats are female ?

Options:
A. 75
B. 100
C. 125
D. 175
E. 225
answer_text: "let m be the number of male participants and f be the number of female articipants in the meeting . thetotal number of participants is given as 750 . hence , we have m + f = 750 now , we have that half the female participants and one - quarter of the male participants are democrats . let d equal the number of the democrats . then we have the equation f / 2 + m / 4 = d now , we have that one - third of the total participants are democrats . hence , we have the equation d = 750 / 3 = 250 solving the three equations yields the solution f = 250 , m = 500 , and d = 250 . the number of female democratic participants equals half the female participants equals 250 / 2 = 125 . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(divide(750, const_3), const_4), 750), const_2)

subject: math_geometry
question:
in 2 triangle , the ratio of the areas is 4 : 3 and that of their heights is 3 : 4 . find the ratio of their bases ?

Options:
A. 10 : 8
B. 11 : 8
C. 16 : 9
D. 17 : 19
E. 17 : 10
answer_text: "given a 1 / a 2 = 4 / 3 , h 1 / h 2 = 3 / 4 also , we know that a 1 / a 2 = ( 1 / 2 × b 1 × h 1 ) / ( 1 / 2 × b 2 × h 2 ) on substituting in above equation , we get b 1 / b 2 = 16 / 9 therefore b 1 : b 2 = 16 : 9answer : C.Here is the formula divide(multiply(2, 2), multiply(4, 4))

subject: math_gain
question:
in what ratio must water be mixed with milk to gain 16 2 / 3 % on selling the mixture at cost price ?

Options:
A. 1 : 9
B. 1 : 1
C. 1 : 2
D. 1 : 6
E. 1 : 5
answer_text: required ratio is cheaper quantity : dearer quantity = ( d - m ) : ( m - c ) answer with explanation : step i ) let c . p of 1 litre of mild be rs . 1 and s . p of 1 litre of mild be rs . 1 gain = 50 / 3 per cent  c . p of 1 litre of mixture =              1 3 50 100 100 x = re . 100 x 3 / 350 x 1 = 6 / 7 ( mean price ) step ( ii ) by the rule of allegation i . c . p of 1 liter of water = 0 ii . c . p of 1 liter of milk = 1 iii . mean price ( p ) = 6 / 7 iv . d – m = 1 – 6 / 7 = 1 / 7 v . m – c = 6 / 7 - 0 = 6 / 7  ratio of water and milk = 1 / 7 : 6 / 7 = 1 : 6 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(add(16, divide(2, 3)), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
9 friends decided to divide the hotel bill evenly . if the bill was $ 124.15 dollars , how much money did they pay if 1 cent is the smallest unit ?

Options:
A. $ 124.11
B. $ 124.12
C. $ 124.13
D. $ 124.14
E. $ 124.15
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(124.15, divide(const_4, const_100))

subject: math_general
question:
on sunday , bill ran 4 more miles than he ran on saturday . julia did not run on saturday , but she ran twice the number of miles on sunday that bill ran on sunday . if bill and julia ran a total of 36 miles on saturday and sunday , how many miles did bill run on sunday ?

Options:
A. 5
B. 6
C. 7
D. 8
E. 10
answer_text: "let bill run x on saturday , so he will run x + 4 on sunday . . julia will run 2 * ( x + 4 ) on sunday . . totai = x + x + 4 + 2 x + 8 = 36 . . 4 x + 12 = 36 . . x = 6 . . ans = x + 4 = 6 + 4 = 10 answer : E. Here is the formula add(divide(subtract(36, add(4, multiply(const_2, 4))), 4), 4)

subject: math_general
question:
in a room with 8 people , 5 people have exactly 1 friend in the room and 4 people have exactly 2 friends in the room ( assuming that friendship is a mutual relationship , i . e . if jane is paul ' s friend , paul is jane ' s friend ) . if two individuals are selected from the room at random , what is the probability that those two individuals are not friends ?

Options:
A. 5 / 21
B. 3 / 7
C. 4 / 7
D. 5 / 7
E. 25 / 28
answer_text: Here is the formula divide(subtract(subtract(subtract(8, 1), 1), 1), subtract(8, 1))

subject: math_physics
question:
the radius of a wheel is 22.4 cm . what is the distance covered by the wheel in making 2000 resolutions ?

Options:
A. 1187 m
B. 1704 m
C. 2816 m
D. 2827 m
E. 2897 m
answer_text: "in one resolution , the distance covered by the wheel is its own circumference . distance covered in 2000 resolutions . = 2000 * 2 * 22 / 7 * 22.4 = 281600 cm = 2816 m answer : C. Here is the formula divide(multiply(multiply(multiply(divide(add(multiply(add(const_3, const_4), const_3), const_1), add(const_3, const_4)), 22.4), const_2), 2000), const_100)

subject: math_geometry
question:
find the smallest number which should be multiplied with 560 to make it a perfect square .

Options:
A. 60
B. 55
C. 45
D. 25
E. 35
answer_text: "560 = 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 7 * 5 required smallest number = 7 * 5 = 35 35 is the smallest number which should be multiplied with 560 to make it a perfect square . answer : E. Here is the formula divide(divide(divide(divide(divide(560, const_3), const_3), const_4), const_4), const_4)

subject: math_physics
question:
earl can stuff advertising circulars into envelopes at the rate of 36 envelopes per minutes and ellen requires a minutes and half to stuff the same number of envelops . working together , how long will it take earl and ellen to stuff 300 envelopes

Options:
A. 6 minutes
B. 5 minutes
C. 7 minutes
D. 3 minutes
E. 4 minutes
answer_text: "earl takes 1 min . for 36 envelopes . ellen takes 3 / 2 mins for the same . so ellen can stuff ( ( 36 ) / ( 3 / 2 ) ) in 1 min . i . e . , 24 envlpes a min . so both of them when work together can stuff 36 + 24 = 60 envelopes in 1 min . for 300 envelopes they will take 300 / 60 mins . i . e . , 5 mins . answer : B. Here is the formula divide(300, add(36, divide(36, divide(const_3, const_2))))

subject: math_general
question:
the sum of first 45 natural numbers is ?

Options:
A. 1030
B. 1034
C. 1035
D. 1037
E. 1040
answer_text: "let sn = ( 1 + 2 + 3 + . . . + 45 ) . this is an a . p . in which a = 1 , d = 1 , n = 45 . sn = n [ 2 a + ( n - 1 ) d ] = 45 x [ 2 x 1 + ( 45 - 1 ) x 1 ] = 45 x 46 = ( 45 x 23 ) 2 2 2 = 45 x ( 20 + 3 ) = 45 x 20 + 45 x 3 = 900 + 135 = 1035 . canswer : .Here is the formula divide(multiply(45, add(45, const_1)), const_2)

subject: math_physics
question:
vehicle x is 22 miles ahead of vehicle y , which is traveling the same direction along the same route as vehicle x . if vehicle x is traveling at an average speed of 36 miles per hour and vehicle y is traveling at an average speed of 45 miles per hour , how long will it take vehicle y to overtake and drive 23 miles ahead of vehicle x ?

Options:
A. 5 hours
B. 7 hours 20 minutes
C. 4 hours
D. 3 hours 45 minutes
E. 2 hours 30 minutes
answer_text: option : A. Here is the formula divide(add(22, 23), subtract(45, 36))

subject: math_general
question:
in the storage room of a certain bakery , the ratio of sugar to flour is 5 to 5 , and the ratio of flour to baking soda is 10 to 1 . if there were 60 more pounds of baking soda in the room , the ratio of flour to baking soda would be 8 to 1 . how many pounds of sugar are stored in the room ?

Options:
A. 600
B. 1200
C. 1500
D. 1600
E. 2400
answer_text: "sugar : flour = 5 : 5 = 10 : 10 ; flour : soda = 10 : 1 = 10 : 1 ; thus we have that sugar : flour : soda = 10 x : 10 x : 1 x . also given that 10 x / ( 1 x + 60 ) = 8 / 1 - - > x = 240 - - > sugar = 10 x = 2400 answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(divide(5, 5), multiply(10, divide(multiply(8, 60), subtract(10, 8))))

subject: math_general
question:
the average weight of 8 person ' s increases by 3 kg when a new person comes in place of one of them weighing 70 kg . what might be the weight of the new person ?

Options:
A. 94 kg
B. 85 kg
C. 90 kg
D. 100 kg
E. 110 kg
answer_text: "total weight increased = ( 8 x 3 ) kg = 24 kg . weight of new person = ( 70 + 24 ) kg = 94 kg . answer : A. Here is the formula add(multiply(8, 3), 70)

subject: math_gain
question:
a worker is paid a regular rate of rs . 10 for completing a survey . the worker completes 50 surveys per week . for any survey involving the use of her cellphone , she is paid at a rate of that is 30 % higher than her regular rate . if she completed 35 surveys involving the use of her cellphone , how much did she get that week ?

Options:
A. 605
B. 505
C. 105
D. 100
E. 200
answer_text: "earning 35 surveys using her cell phone = 13 * 35 = 455 balance 15 surveys = 10 x 15 = 150 total = 455 + 150 = 605 answer : A. Here is the formula add(multiply(10, const_100.0), multiply(35, multiply(10, divide(30, 50))))

subject: math_geometry
question:
the dimensions of a room are 25 feet * 15 feet * 12 feet . what is the cost of white washing the four walls of the room at rs . 10 per square feet if there is one door of dimensions 6 feet * 3 feet and three windows of dimensions 4 feet * 3 feet each ?

Options:
A. s . 9060
B. s . 4520
C. s . 4527
D. s . 4530
E. s . 4521
answer_text: "area of the four walls = 2 h ( l + b ) since there are doors and windows , area of the walls = 2 * 12 ( 15 + 25 ) - ( 6 * 3 ) - 3 ( 4 * 3 ) = 906 sq . ft . total cost = 906 * 10 = rs . 9060 answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(subtract(multiply(multiply(const_2, 12), add(15, 25)), multiply(6, 3)), multiply(3, multiply(4, 3))), 10)

subject: math_physics
question:
a take twice as much time as b or thrice as much time to finish a piece of work . working together , they can finish the work in 7 days . b can do the work alone in ?

Options:
A. 19
B. 12
C. 11
D. 42
E. 114
answer_text: "suppose a , b and c take x , x / 2 and x / 3 respectively to finish the work . then , ( 1 / x + 2 / x + 3 / x ) = 1 / 7 6 / x = 1 / 7 = > x = 42 so , b takes 21 hours to finish the work . answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(add(add(const_1, const_2), const_3), 7)

subject: math_geometry
question:
right triangle abc is to be drawn in the xy - plane so that the right angle is at a and ab is parallel to the y - axis . if the x - and y - coordinates of a , b , and c are to be integers that are consistent with the inequalities - 3 ≤ x ≤ 2 and 4 ≤ y ≤ 9 , then how many different triangles can be drawn that will meet these conditions ?

Options:
A. 54
B. 432
C. 2,160
D. 2,916
E. 148,824
answer_text: "we have the rectangle with dimensions 9 * 3 ( 9 horizontal dots and 3 vertical ) . ab is parallel to y - axis and ac is parallel to x - axis . choose the ( x , y ) coordinates for vertex a : 9 c 1 * 3 c 1 ; choose the x coordinate for vertex c ( as y coordinate is fixed by a ) : 8 c 1 , ( 9 - 1 = 8 as 1 horizontal dot is already occupied by a ) ; choose the y coordinate for vertex b ( as x coordinate is fixed by a ) : 2 c 1 , ( 3 - 1 = 2 as 1 vertical dot is already occupied by a ) . 9 c 1 * 3 c 1 * 8 c 1 * 2 c 1 = 432 . answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(3, subtract(3, const_1)), multiply(9, 3))

subject: math_physics
question:
the ratio between the length and the breadth of a rectangular park is 3 : 2 . if a man cycling along the boundary of the park at the speed of 12 km / hr completes one round in 7 minutes , then the area of the park ( in sq . m ) is

Options:
A. 153200
B. 153400
C. 153600
D. 154000
E. 117600
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula rectangle_area(divide(divide(multiply(multiply(divide(12, multiply(const_10, multiply(const_3, const_2))), 7), const_1000), add(3, 2)), const_2), multiply(divide(divide(multiply(multiply(divide(12, multiply(const_10, multiply(const_3, const_2))), 7), const_1000), add(3, 2)), const_2), 2))

subject: math_general
question:
a man can swim in still water at 4.5 km / h , but takes twice as long to swim upstream than downstream . the speed of the stream is ?

Options:
A. 1.0
B. 1.9
C. 1.6
D. 1.5
E. 1.1
answer_text: "m = 4.5 s = x ds = 4.5 + x us = 4.5 + x 4.5 + x = ( 4.5 - x ) 2 4.5 + x = 9 - 2 x 3 x = 4.5 x = 1.5 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(4.5, const_3)

subject: math_general
question:
0.99998 + 0.11112 = ?

Options:
A. 1
B. 1.0001
C. 1.0021
D. 1.1111
E. 1.111
answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(divide(0.99998, 0.11112), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
there are 2 red chips and 3 blue ones . when arranged in a row , they form a certain color pattern , for example rbrrb . how many color patterns ?

Options:
A. a ) 10
B. b ) 12
C. c ) 24
D. d ) 60
E. e ) 100
answer_text: "using anagram method : 5 _ 4 _ 3 _ 2 _ 1 r _ r _ r _ b _ b so . . 5 ! / number of repeated letters ( 2 ! ) ( 3 ! ) = 10 ans : E. Here is the formula multiply(factorial(2), factorial(3))

subject: math_physics
question:
in a race of 1000 m , a can beat by 100 m , in a race of 800 m , b can beat c by 100 m . by how many meters will a beat c in a race of 700 m ?

Options:
A. 148.75 m
B. 127.5 m .
C. 122.2 m
D. 222.9 m
E. 12289 m
answer_text: "when a runs 1000 m , b runs 900 m and when b runs 800 m , c runs 700 m . when b runs 900 m , distance that c runs = ( 900 * 700 ) / 800 = 6300 / 8 = 787.5 m . in a race of 1000 m , a beats c by ( 1000 - 787.5 ) = 212.5 m to c . in a race of 700 m , the number of meters by which a beats c = ( 700 * 212.5 ) / 1000 = 148.75 m . answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(1000, divide(multiply(subtract(1000, 100), subtract(800, 100)), 800))

subject: math_general
question:
ifaequals the sum of the even integers from 2 to 120 , inclusive , andbequals the sum of the odd integers from 1 to 119 , inclusive , what is the value of a - b ?

Options:
A. 60
B. 10
C. 19
D. 20
E. 21
answer_text: "this is a solution from beatthegmat : even numbers : ( 120 - 2 ) / 2 + 1 = 60 even integers . ( 120 + 2 ) / 2 = 61 is the average of the even set . sum = avg * ( # of elements ) = 61 * 60 = 3660 = a odd numbers : ( 119 - 1 ) / 2 + 1 = 60 odd integers . ( 119 + 1 ) / 2 = 60 is the average of the odd set . sum = avg * ( # of elements ) = 60 * 60 = 3600 = b a - b = 3660 - 3600 = 60 . answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(divide(120, 2), add(divide(120, 2), 1)), multiply(divide(add(119, 1), 2), add(divide(subtract(119, 1), 2), 1)))

subject: math_general
question:
the cost of registration at a professional association meeting was $ 50 per person ; a lunch for registrants only was available for an additional $ 22 per person . if the number of registrants who paid for lunch was 10 more than the number who did not , and if receipts for registration and lunch totaled $ 61720 , how many people paid just for registration at the meeting ?

Options:
A. 700
B. 800
C. 1,300
D. 500
E. 1,800
answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(const_1, const_1)

subject: math_gain
question:
at what price must an article costing rs . 47.50 be marked in order that after deducting 7 % from the list price . it may be sold at a profit of 25 % on the cost price ?

Options:
A. 63.84
B. 62.6
C. 62.1
D. 62.7
E. 62.2
answer_text: "cp = 47.50 sp = 47.50 * ( 125 / 100 ) = 59.375 mp * ( 93 / 100 ) = 59.375 mp = 63.84 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(add(47.50, divide(multiply(47.50, 25), const_100)), const_100), subtract(const_100, 7))

subject: math_general
question:
in may mrs lee ' s earnings were 50 percent of the lee family ' s total income . in june mrs lee earned 20 percent more than in may . if the rest of the family ' s income was the same both months , then , in june , mrs lee ' s earnings were approximately what percent of the lee family ' s total income ?

Options:
A. 55
B. 56
C. 34
D. 78
E. 23
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(add(const_100, 20), add(add(const_100, 20), const_100)), const_100)

subject: math_gain
question:
what is 30 % of 80 ?

Options:
A. 24
B. 66
C. 367
D. 28
E. 267
answer_text: "30 % of 80 = 30 / 100 × 80 = ( 30 × 80 ) / 100 = 2400 / 100 = 24 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(30, add(add(multiply(multiply(add(const_3, const_2), const_2), multiply(multiply(const_3, const_4), const_100)), multiply(multiply(add(const_3, const_4), add(const_3, const_2)), multiply(add(const_3, const_2), const_2))), add(const_3, const_3))), const_100)

subject: math_gain
question:
a particular library has 75 books in a special collection , all of which were in the library at the beginning of the month . these book are occasionally loaned out through an inter - library program . if , by the end of the month , 80 percent of books that were loaned out are returned and there are 69 books in the special collection at that time , how many books of the special collection were loaned out during that month ?

Options:
A. 20
B. 30
C. 35
D. 40
E. 55
answer_text: "there are 6 books less ( 75 - 69 ) which represents 20 % of the loaned books ( 100 - 80 ) so total loaned out books = 30 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(subtract(75, 69), subtract(const_1, divide(80, const_100)))

subject: math_physics
question:
if an object travels 300 feet in 6 seconds , what is the object ' s approximate speed in miles per hour ? ( note : 1 mile = 5280 feet )

Options:
A. 30
B. 31
C. 32
D. 33
E. 34
answer_text: "1 mile = 5280 feet = > 1 feet = 1 / 5280 miles if the object travels 300 feet in 6 sec then it travels 300 / 6 * 60 * 60 feet in 1 hour ( 1 hr = 60 min * 60 sec ) = 3600 * 50 feet in 1 hour = 180000 feet in 1 hr = 180000 / 5280 miles in 1 hour = 18000 / 528 miles / hr ~ 34 miles / hr answer : E. Here is the formula divide(divide(300, 5280), multiply(6, divide(1, const_3600)))

subject: math_general
question:
there are 9 baskets numbered from 1 to 9 and filled with apples . 10 children are asked to pick apples one by one from each basket such that the number of apples picked by each child from each basket is equal to the number marked on the basket . if there were 1000 apples in total and the baskets were filled in such a way that none of the basket became empty in the process , how many apples were left in the end ?

Options:
A. 440
B. 550
C. 660
D. 770
E. 880
answer_text: "each child takes a total of 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6 + 7 + 8 + 9 = 9 * 10 / 2 = 45 apples . the total number of apples taken by 10 children is 10 * 45 = 450 the number of apples left in the end is 1000 - 450 = 550 apples . the answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(1000, multiply(add(add(multiply(add(1, 9), divide(10, const_2)), divide(10, const_2)), 1), 10))

subject: math_other
question:
in a sports club with 80 members , 48 play badminton and 46 play tennis and 7 do not play either . how many members play both badminton and tennis ?

Options:
A. ['a ) 23'
B. 'b ) 21'
C. 'c ) 20'
D. 'd ) 26'
E. 'e ) 27']
answer_text: 48 + 46 = 94 but where as total number is 80 - 7 = 73 therefore answer is 94 - 73 = 21 hence answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(add(add(48, 46), 7), 80)

subject: math_general
question:
in a fuel station the service costs $ 2.10 per vehicle and every liter of fuel costs $ 0.60 . assuming that you fill up 3 mini - vans and 2 trucks , what will be the total cost , if a mini - van ' s tank is 65 liters and a truck ' s tank is 120 % bigger and they are all empty ?

Options:
A. $ 287.50
B. $ 290.40
C. $ 293.30
D. $ 296.20
E. $ 299.10
answer_text: "the service cost of 3 vans and 2 trucks is 5 * 2.10 $ 10.50 the fuel in 3 vans is 3 * 65 = 195 liters the fuel in 2 trucks is 2 * 65 * 2.2 = 286 liters the total fuel ( vans + trucks ) = 481 liters the total fuel cost is 481 * 0.6 = $ 288.60 the total cost is $ 288.60 + $ 10.50 = $ 299.10 the answer : E. Here is the formula add(add(multiply(multiply(add(divide(multiply(120, 65), const_100), 65), 2), 0.60), multiply(multiply(3, 65), 0.60)), multiply(2.10, add(3, 2)))

subject: math_general
question:
what is the ratio of 3 / 7 to the product 3 * ( 7 / 3 ) ?

Options:
A. 3 : 7
B. 1 : 3
C. 3 : 21
D. 1 : 7
E. 3 : 49
answer_text: "3 * ( 7 / 3 ) = 7 so , we need to find the ratio of 3 / 7 : 7 = > 3 : 49 hence , answer : E. Here is the formula divide(3, const_60)

subject: math_physics
question:
a train of length 250 m crosses a bridge of length 150 m in 20 seconds . what is the speed of train ?

Options:
A. 33
B. 27
C. 25
D. 22
E. 72
answer_text: "sol : ( length of train + length of bridge ) = speed of train x time ( 250 + 150 ) = 20 x speed speed = 400 / 20 = 20 m / s = 72 km / h answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(const_3_6, divide(add(250, 150), 20))

subject: math_general
question:
half a number plus 7 is 17 . what is the number ?

Options:
A. 8
B. 9
C. 10
D. 11
E. 20
answer_text: "let x be the number . always replace ` ` is ' ' with an equal sign ( 1 / 2 ) x + 7 = 17 ( 1 / 2 ) x = 17 - 7 ( 1 / 2 ) x = 20 x = 20 correct answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(17, 7), const_2)

subject: math_gain
question:
how much interest will $ 8,000 earn in 9 months at an annual rate of 6 % ?

Options:
A. $ 250
B. $ 350
C. $ 360
D. $ 550
E. $ 650
answer_text: "soln : - 9 months = 3 / 4 of year ; 6 % = 6 / 100 = 3 / 50 ; $ 8,000 ( principal ) * 3 / 50 ( interest rate ) * 3 / 4 ( time ) = $ 360 . answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(power(const_100, const_2), divide(6, const_100)), divide(const_3, 6))

subject: math_other
question:
if the ratio of the sum of the first 6 terms of a g . p . to the sum of the first 3 terms of the g . p . is 343 , what is the common ratio of the g . p ?

Options:
A. 3
B. 1 / 3
C. 2
D. 7
E. 1 / 7
answer_text: "343 = ( a 1 + a 2 + a 3 + a 4 + a 5 + a 6 ) / ( a 1 + a 2 + a 3 ) factorize the same terms 343 = 1 + ( a 4 + a 5 + a 6 ) / ( a 1 + a 2 + a 3 ) write every term with respect to r a 1 = a 1 a 2 = a 1 * r ^ 1 a 3 = a 1 * r ^ 2 . . . . . . . . . 343 = 1 + ( a 1 ( r ^ 3 + r ^ 4 + r ^ 5 ) ) / ( a 1 ( 1 + r ^ 1 + r ^ 2 ) ) 342 = ( r ^ 3 ( 1 + r ^ 1 + r ^ 2 ) ) / ( ( 1 + r ^ 1 + r ^ 2 ) ) 342 = r ^ 3 r = 7answer : D.Here is the formula power(subtract(343, const_1), divide(const_1, 3))

subject: math_gain
question:
bert and rebecca were looking at the price of a condominium . the price of the condominium was 50 % more than bert had in savings , and separately , the same price was also 25 % more than rebecca had in savings . what is the ratio of what bert has in savings to what rebecca has in savings .

Options:
A. 1 : 6
B. 1 : 3
C. 1 : 2
D. 3 : 4
E. 5 : 6
answer_text: "suppose bert had 100 so price becomes 150 , this 150 = 1.25 times r ' s saving . . so r ' s saving becomes 120 so required ratio is 100 : 120 = 5 : 6 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(divide(const_100, add(const_100, 50)), divide(const_100, add(const_100, 25)))

subject: math_gain
question:
a shopkeeper sells 500 metres of cloth for rs . 18000 at a loss of rs . 5 per metre . find his cost price for one metre of cloth ?

Options:
A. 12
B. 27
C. 29
D. 50
E. 41
answer_text: sp per metre = 18000 / 500 = rs . 36 loss per metre = rs . 5 cp per metre = 36 + 5 = rs . 41 . answer : E. Here is the formula add(divide(18000, 500), 5)

subject: math_general
question:
the difference of two numbers is 1565 . on dividing the larger number by the smaller , we get 6 as quotient and the 15 as remainder . what is the smaller number ?

Options:
A. a ) 270
B. b ) 280
C. c ) 290
D. d ) 300
E. e ) 310
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula divide(add(1565, 15), subtract(6, const_1))

subject: math_general
question:
how many even number in the range between 15 to 100 inclusive are not divisible by 3

Options:
A. 29
B. 30
C. 31
D. 33
E. 46
answer_text: "we have to find the number of terms that are divisible by 2 but not by 6 ( as the question asks for the even numbers only which are not divisible by 3 ) for 2 , 16,18 . . . 100 using ap formula , we can say 100 = 16 + ( n - 1 ) * 2 or n = 43 . for 6 , 18 , . . . 96 using ap formula , we can say 96 = 18 + ( n - 1 ) * 6 or n = 14 . hence , only divisible by 2 but not 3 = 43 - 14 = 29 . hence , answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(divide(subtract(subtract(100, 15), const_2), const_2), divide(divide(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(100, const_2), multiply(3, const_4)), 3), 3), 3), const_2))

subject: math_geometry
question:
the area of a circular field is 17.56 hectares . find the cost of fencing it at the rate of rs . 7 per metre approximately

Options:
A. 4457
B. 10400
C. 4235
D. 4547
E. 4675
answer_text: "explanation : area = ( 17.56 x 10000 ) m 2 = 175600 m 2 . π r 2 = 175600 ⇔ ( r ) 2 = ( 175600 x ( 7 / 22 ) ) ⇔ r = 236.37 m . circumference = 2 π r = ( 2 x ( 22 / 7 ) x 236.37 ) m = 1485.78 m . cost of fencing = rs . ( 1485.78 x 7 ) = rs . 10400 . answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(circumface(multiply(sqrt(divide(17.56, const_pi)), const_100)), 7)

subject: math_general
question:
a confectioner decides to sell all of his pastry due to the coming holiday . his pastry goods are equally divided among a group of 50 regular customers . if only 49 customers come to the bakery , each one will receive 6 less pastry goods . how much pastry does the confectioner needs to sell ?

Options:
A. 500 .
B. 412 .
C. 432 .
D. 502 .
E. 522 .
answer_text: "pastry is divided in 50 customers equally . so , total number of pastry must be a multiple of 50 only option : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(multiply(49, 6), subtract(49, 50)), 50)

subject: math_general
question:
if 5400 mn = k ^ 4 , where m , n , and k are positive integers , what is the least possible value of 2 m + n ?

Options:
A. 11
B. 18
C. 20
D. 25
E. 35
answer_text: k ^ 4 = 5400 ∗ mn k ^ 4 = 3 ^ 3.2 ^ 3.5 ^ 2 . mn in order to make rhs a perfect power of 4 , we require it to be multiplied by 3 , 2 & 5 ^ 2 mn = 3 . 2.5 ^ 2 mn = 150 = 10 * 15 ( least possible ) answer = 2 * 10 + 15 = 35 answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(4, power(const_3, const_2))

subject: math_physics
question:
tabby is training for a triathlon . she swims at a speed of 1 mile per hour . she runs at a speed of 7 miles per hour . she wants to figure out her average speed for these two events . what is the correct answer for her ?

Options:
A. 8 mph
B. 5.25 mph
C. 3.5 mph
D. 4 mph
E. 0.5 mph
answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula divide(add(1, 7), const_2)

subject: math_physics
question:
a train of 25 carriages , each of 60 meters length , when an engine also of 60 meters length is running at a speed of 60 kmph . in what time will the train cross a bridge 1.0 km long ?

Options:
A. 2.5
B. 3
C. 5
D. 7
E. 9
answer_text: "d = 25 * 60 + 1000 = 2500 m t = 2500 / 60 * 18 / 5 = 150 sec = 2.5 mins answer : A. Here is the formula add(divide(multiply(add(25, const_1), 60), const_1000), 1.0)

subject: math_gain
question:
jerome anticipated that the webweb . com stock price would fall and sold all his webweb . com stocks for $ 5 per stock . he paid $ 10,000 tax on the revenue . a week later , jerome became convinced that the webweb . com stock price would rise , and he used the money that he had gotten from selling the webweb . com stocks to purchase them again , this time at $ 6 per stock . if jerome ended up having 7000 webweb . com stocks fewer than the number he had before selling them , how many webweb . com stocks did he have originally ?

Options:
A. 10,000
B. 11,600
C. 17,000
D. 14,000
E. 16,400
answer_text: answer : C. Here is the formula add(5, 6)

subject: math_general
question:
find the principle on a certain sum of money at 9 % per annum for 2 2 / 5 years if the amount being rs . 1120 ?

Options:
A. 1000
B. 912.88
C. 927.78
D. 926.82
E. 921.05
answer_text: 1120 = p [ 1 + ( 9 * 12 / 5 ) / 100 ] p = 921.05 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(1120, add(divide(multiply(divide(add(multiply(2, 5), 2), 5), 9), const_100), const_1))

subject: math_general
question:
if 40 % of a number is equal to two - third of another number , what is the ratio of first number to the second number .

Options:
A. 5 : 3
B. 2 : 5
C. 4 : 7
D. 5 : 2
E. none of these
answer_text: "explanation : let the first number is a and second number is b . as per question ( 40 / 100 ) a = ( 2 / 3 ) b a / b = 2 / 3 x 100 / 40 a / b = 5 / 3 = > a : b = 5 : 3 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(divide(const_1, const_4), divide(40, const_100))

subject: math_gain
question:
vijay lent out an amount rs . 10000 into two parts , one at 8 % p . a . and the remaining at 10 % p . a . both on simple interest . at the end of the year he received rs . 890 as total interest . what was the amount he lent out at 8 % pa . a ?

Options:
A. 5529
B. 5500
C. 5520
D. 5521
E. 5192
answer_text: "let the amount lent out at 8 % p . a . be rs . a = > ( a * 8 ) / 100 + [ ( 10000 - a ) * 10 ] / 100 = 890 = > a = rs . 5500 . answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(add(multiply(divide(10, const_100), 10000), divide(8, const_100)), 890), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
a man whose bowling average is 12.4 , takes 5 wickets for 26 runs and there by decreases his average by 0.4 . the number of wickets taken by him before his last match is ?

Options:
A. 82
B. 83
C. 84
D. 85
E. 86
answer_text: "12.4 x + 26 / ( 5 + x ) = 12 12.4 x + 26 = 60 + 12 x x = 34 / 0.4 = 85 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(floor(12.4), 5), 26), subtract(12.4, floor(12.4)))

subject: math_physics
question:
anand finishes a work in 7 days , bittu finishes the same job in 8 days and chandu in 6 days . they take turns to finish the work . anand on the first day , bittu on the second and chandu on the third day and then anand again and so on . on which day will the work get over ?

Options:
A. 3 rd
B. 6 th
C. 9 th
D. 7 th
E. 8 th
answer_text: they completed 146 / 168 work in 6 days working one by one on eacg day . on 7 th day , 22 / 168 work is left which will be completed by anand on 7 th day . answer : D. Here is the formula add(floor(multiply(inverse(add(add(divide(const_1, 7), divide(const_1, 8)), divide(const_1, 6))), const_3)), const_1)

subject: math_physics
question:
if the product of two numbers is 45276 and their h . c . f . is 22 , find their l . c . m .

Options:
A. 2574
B. 2500
C. 2100
D. 2058
E. none of these
answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula divide(45276, 22)

subject: math_general
question:
a person saved $ 10 in buying an item on sale . if he spent $ 500 for the item , approximately how much percent he saved in the transaction ?

Options:
A. 8 %
B. 10 %
C. 2 %
D. 5 %
E. 6 %
answer_text: "actual price = 500 + 10 = $ 510 saving = 10 / 510 * 100 = 100 / 51 = 2 % approximately answer : C. Here is the formula add(floor(multiply(divide(10, add(10, 500)), 500)), const_1)

subject: math_gain
question:
okeydokey paid 5 apples at the apple investment booth for an unopened box of earthworms . artichokey paid 7 apples towards the same lot . the booth pays off earthworms proportional to the apples invested . the box turned out to contain 60 earthworms . how many of them should okeydokey receive ?

Options:
A. 25
B. 27
C. 28
D. 29
E. 30
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(60, 5), add(5, 7))

subject: math_gain
question:
a glass was filled with 10 ounces of water , and 0.01 ounce of the water evaporated each day during a 20 - day period . what percent of the original amount of water evaporated during this period ?

Options:
A. 0.002 %
B. 0.02 %
C. 0.2 %
D. 2 %
E. 20 %
answer_text: "in 20 days 20 * 0.01 = 0.2 ounces of water evaporated , which is 0.2 / 10 ∗ 100 = 2 of the original amount of water . answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(divide(multiply(0.01, 20), 10), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
a certain store sells all maps at one price and all books at another price . on monday the store sold 10 maps and 8 books for a total of $ 22.00 , and on tuesday the store sold 20 maps and 15 books for a total of $ 60.00 . at this store , how much less does a map sell for than a book ?

Options:
A. $ - 5.4
B. $ 0.50
C. $ 0.75
D. $ 1.00
E. $ l . 25
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(60, negate(multiply(15, divide(subtract(multiply(22, const_4), multiply(60, const_2)), subtract(multiply(8, const_4), multiply(15, const_2)))))), 20)

subject: math_general
question:
a 64 gallon solution of salt and water is 10 % salt . how many gallons of water must be added to the solution in order to decrease the salt to 8 % of the volume ?

Options:
A. 8
B. 12
C. 13
D. 14
E. 16
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula divide(multiply(64, subtract(10, 8)), 8)

subject: math_general
question:
a gambler bought $ 5,000 worth of chips at a casino in denominations of $ 20 and $ 100 . that evening , the gambler lost 16 chips , and then cashed in the remainder . if the number of $ 20 chips lost was 2 more or 2 less than the number of $ 100 chips lost , what is the largest amount of money that the gambler could have received back ?

Options:
A. $ 4,040
B. $ 4,120
C. $ 1,960
D. $ 4,920
E. $ 1,400
answer_text: "in order to maximize the amount of money that the gambler kept , we should maximize # of $ 20 chips lost and minimize # of $ 100 chips lost , which means that # of $ 20 chips lost must be 2 more than # of $ 100 chips lost . so , if # of $ 20 chips lost is x then # of $ 100 chips lost should be x - 2 . now , given that total # of chips lost is 16 : x + x - 2 = 16 - - > x = 9 : 9 $ 20 chips were lost and 9 - 2 = 7 $ 100 chips were lost . total worth of chips lost is 9 * 20 + 7 * 100 = $ 880 , so the gambler kept $ 5,000 - $ 880 = $ 4,120 . answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(const_3, const_1000), add(multiply(divide(add(16, 2), 2), 20), multiply(subtract(divide(add(16, 2), 2), 2), 100)))

subject: math_general
question:
in the coordinate plane , line a has a slope of - 2 and an x - intercept of 2 . line b has a slope of 5 and a y - intercept of - 10 . if the two lines intersect at the point ( a , b ) , what is the sum a + b ?

Options:
A. 0
B. 1
C. 2
D. 3
E. 4
answer_text: "the equation of line a is y = - 2 x + 4 the equation of line b is y = 5 x - 10 5 x - 10 = - 2 x + 4 x = 2 y = 0 the point of intersection is ( 2,0 ) and then a + b = 2 . the answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(subtract(10, 5), 2), 2)

answer_text: "12 , 14 , 16 , . . . , 46,48 this is an equally spaced list ; you can use the formula : n = ( largest - smallest ) / ( ' space ' ) + 1 = ( 48 - 12 ) / ( 2 ) + 1 = 36 / 2 + 1 = 18 + 1 = 19 answer : B. Here is the formula add(divide(subtract(50, 10), 2), const_1)

question:

answer_text: let the no . of 10 liter bottles be x , so the no . of 50 l bottles will be x / 5 ( to equate the vol . ) since the total cost will be equal , 2 x = 50 + x / 5 so x = 27.77 or 28 . answer : A. Here is the formula divide(50, subtract(10, divide(const_1, 1)))

subject: math_gain
question:
solution y is 30 percent liquid x and 70 percent water . if 2 kilograms of water evaporate from 6 kilograms of solution y and 2 kilograms of solution y are added to the remaining 4 kilograms of liquid , what percent of this new solution is liquid x ?

C. 37 %
D. 40 %
E. 42 %
answer_text: "in 8 kilograms of solution y there are 0.3 * 6 = 1.8 kilograms of solution x ; after 2 kilograms of water are replaced by 2 kilograms of solution y , to the existing 1.8 kilograms of solution x , 0.3 * 2 = 0.6 kilograms of solution x are added , so in the new solution of 6 kilograms there are 1.8 + 0.6 = 2.4 kilograms of solution x , which is 2.4 / 6 * 100 = 40 % of this new solution . answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(const_100, divide(add(multiply(6, divide(30, const_100)), multiply(2, divide(30, const_100))), add(add(multiply(6, divide(30, const_100)), multiply(2, divide(30, const_100))), add(subtract(multiply(6, divide(70, const_100)), 2), multiply(2, divide(70, const_100))))))

question:

answer_text: explanation : price of 357 apples = rs . 1517.25 price of 1 apple = rs . 1517.25 / 357 price of 49 dozens apples = rs ( 49 × 12 × 1517.25 / 357 ) ≈ rs . 2500 answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(49, const_12), divide(1517.25, 357))

subject: math_gain
question:
in the first 10 overs of a cricket game , the run rate was only 3.8 . what should be the run rate in the remaining 40 overs to reach the target of 282 runs ?

Options:
A. 6.25
B. 6.5
C. 6.75
D. 6.1
E. 8
answer_text: "10 overs - run rate = 3.8 runs scored in first 10 overs = 38 remaining overs 40 total runs to be scored = 282 38 runs already scored 282 - 38 = 244 244 runs to be scored in 40 overs let required runrate be x 40 * x = 244 x = 244 / 40 x = 6.1 the required runrate is 6.1 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(subtract(282, multiply(10, 3.8)), 40)

D. 662
E. 521
answer_text: "cost price = rs . 480 profit = 24 % of 480 = rs . 115 selling price = cost price + profit = 480 + 115 = 595 answer : A. Here is the formula add(480, multiply(480, divide(24, const_100)))

subject: math_general
question:
what is the median of a set of consecutive integers if the sum of nth number from the beginning and nth number from the end is 110 ?

Options:
A. 10
B. 25
C. 55
D. 75
E. 100
answer_text: surprisingly no one answered this easy one . property of a set of consecutive integerz . mean = median = ( first element + last element ) / 2 = ( second element + last but one element ) / 2 = ( third element + third last element ) / 2 etc . etc . so mean = median = 110 / 2 = 55 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(110, const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
roses can be purchased individually for $ 6.30 , one dozen for $ 36 , or two dozen for $ 50 . what is the greatest number of roses that can be purchased for $ 680 ?

B. 162
C. 316
D. 324
E. 325
answer_text: "buy as many $ 50 deals as possible . we can by 650 / 50 = 13 two dozen roses , thus total of 13 * 24 = 312 roses . we are left with 680 - 650 = $ 30 . we can buy 30 / 6.3 = ~ 4 roses for that amount . total = 312 + 4 = 316 . answer : C. Here is the formula add(multiply(floor(divide(680, 50)), multiply(const_12, const_2)), floor(divide(subtract(680, multiply(floor(divide(680, 50)), 50)), 6.30)))

question:
a class consists of 15 biology students and 10 chemistry students . if you pick two students at the same time , what ' s the probability that one is maths and one is chemistry ?

answer_text: p ( 1 st b , 2 nd c ) = 15 / 25 * 10 / 24 = 150 / 600 = 1 / 4 ; p ( 1 st c , 2 nd b ) = 10 / 25 * 15 / 24 = 150 / 600 = 1 / 4 . p = 1 / 4 + 1 / 4 = 1 / 2 . answer : C. Here is the formula add(multiply(divide(15, add(15, 10)), divide(10, subtract(add(15, 10), const_1))), multiply(divide(15, subtract(add(15, 10), const_1)), divide(10, add(15, 10))))

question:
an aeroplane covers a certain distance of 420 kmph in 6 hours . to cover the same distance in 4 2 / 3 hours , it must travel at a speed of

Options:

B. 540
C. 640
D. 740
E. 250
answer_text: "speed of aeroplane = 420 kmph distance travelled in 6 hours = 420 * 6 = 2520 km speed of aeroplane to acver 2520 km in 14 / 3 = 2520 * 3 / 14 = 540 km answer : B. Here is the formula divide(multiply(420, 6), divide(add(multiply(3, 4), 2), 3))

subject: math_probability
question:
jane and thomas are among the 8 people from which a committee of 4 people is to be selected . how many different possible committees of 4 people can be selected from these 8 people if at least one of either jane or thomas is to be selected ?

Options:
A. 28
B. 46
C. 55
D. 63
E. 70
answer_text: "solution : j + t + 6 = total 8 , we need to select at least one of the j and t or both = total 4 out of 8 - 4 out of 6 8 c 4 - 6 c 4 = 55 ans : C. Here is the formula add(add(choose(8, const_1), choose(8, const_1)), choose(const_4, const_1))

subject: math_general
question:
the average mark of the students of a class in a particular exam is 80 . if 8 students whose average mark in that exam is 20 are excluded , the average mark of the remaining will be 90 . find the number of students who wrote the exam .

Options:
A. 15
B. 25
C. 35
D. 45
E. 56
answer_text: "let the number of students who wrote the exam be x . total marks of students = 80 x . total marks of ( x - 8 ) students = 90 ( x - 8 ) 80 x - ( 8 * 20 ) = 90 ( x - 8 ) 560 = 10 x = > x = 56 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(90, 8), multiply(8, 20)), subtract(90, 80))

subject: math_general
question:
what is the smallest integer k for which 64 ^ k > 4 ^ 17 ?

Options:
A. 4
B. 5
C. 6
D. 7
E. 8
answer_text: "64 ^ k > 4 ^ 17 4 ^ ( 3 k ) > 4 ^ 17 3 k > 17 k = 6 the answer : C. Here is the formula add(floor(divide(17, const_3)), const_1)

subject: math_geometry
question:
a rectangular swimming pool is 20 feet by 18 feet . a deck that has uniform width surrounds the pool . the total area of the pool and deck is 624 square feet . what is the width of the deck ?

Options:
A. 2
B. 3
C. 4
D. 5
E. 6
answer_text: "let the width = w total area of the pool and deck = ( 2 w + 20 ) ( 2 w + 18 ) we can test the answer choices along with unit digit method a ) 2 feet . . . . . . . . . . . 24 * 22 has unit digit 8 . . . . . . . . . . eliminate b ) 2.5 feet . . . . . . . . . 25 * 23 has unit digit 5 . . . . . . . . . . eliminate c ) 3 feet . . . . . . . . . . . . 26 * 24 has unit digit 4 . . . . . . . . . . . hold d ) 4 feet . . . . . . . . . . . . 28 * 26 has unit digit 8 . . . . . . . . . . . eliminate e ) 5 feet . . . . . . . . . . . . 30 * 38 has unit digit 0 . . . . . . . . . . . eliminate answer : B. Here is the formula divide(subtract(sqrt(add(power(subtract(18, const_1), const_2), subtract(624, rectangle_area(20, 18)))), subtract(18, const_1)), const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
what is the least integer greater than 0 + 0.5 ?

Options:
A. – 2
B. – 1
C. 0
D. 1
E. 2
answer_text: "this question is just about doing careful arithmetic and remembering what makes a numberbiggerorsmallercompared to another number . first , let ' s take care of the arithmetic : ( 0 ) + ( 0.5 ) = 0.5 on a number line , since we ' re adding + . 5 to a number , the total moves to the right ( so we ' re moving from 0 to 0.5 ) . next , the question asks for the least integer that is greater than 0.5 again , we can use a number line . numbers become greater as you move to the right . the first integer to the right of 0.5 is 1 . final answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(add(0, const_1), const_2)

subject: math_physics
question:
two diagonals of a rhombus are 72 cm and 30 cm respectively . what is its perimeter ?

Options:
A. ['a ) 136 cm'
B. 'b ) 156 cm'
C. 'c ) 144 cm'
D. 'd ) 121 cm'
E. 'e ) 126 cm']
answer_text: all sides of rhombus are congruent let pr = 72 sq = 30 cm po = 0 r = 72 / 1 = 36 cm so = 0 q = 30 / 2 = 15 cm pq = qr = rs = sp = root ( 36 ^ 2 + 15 ^ 2 ) = rppt ( 1296 + 225 ) = root ( 1521 ) = 39 cm perimeter = 4 * 39 = 156 cm answer : B. Here is the formula rhombus_perimeter(sqrt(add(power(divide(72, const_2), const_2), power(divide(30, const_2), const_2))))

subject: math_physics
question:
to fill a tank , 25 buckets of water is required . how many buckets of water will be required to fill the same tank if the capacity of the bucket is reduced to 3 / 10 of its present ?

Options:
A. 61.5
B. 60.5
C. 63.5
D. 83.333
E. 64.5
answer_text: "let capacity of 1 bucket = x capacity of the tank = 25 x new capacity of the bucket = 3 x / 10 hence , number of buckets needed = 25 x / ( 3 x / 10 ) = ( 25 × 10 ) / 3 = 83.33333 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(multiply(25, add(const_4, const_1)), const_2)

subject: math_geometry
question:
one side of a rectangular field is 14 m and one of its diagonal is 17 m . find the area of the field .

Options:
A. 134.4
B. 120
C. 150
D. 180
E. none
answer_text: "solution other side = √ ( 17 ) 2 - ( 14 ) 2 = √ 289 - 196 = √ 93 = 9.6 m . ∴ area = ( 14 x 9.6 ) m 2 = 134.4 m 2 . answer : A. Here is the formula rectangle_area(14, sqrt(subtract(power(17, const_2), power(14, const_2))))

subject: math_physics
question:
a hiker walking at a constant rate of 4 kilometers per hour is passed by a cyclist travelling in the same direction along the same path at a constant rate of 24 kilometers per hour . the cyclist stops and waits for the hiker 5 minutes after passing her while the hiker continues to walk at her constant rate . how many minutes must the cyclist wait until the hiker catches up ?

Options:
A. 10
B. 15
C. 20
D. 25
E. 30
answer_text: "in 5 minutes , the cyclist travels a distance of ( 5 / 60 ) * 24 = 2 km . the time it takes the hiker to complete this distance is 2 / 4 hours = 30 minutes the cyclist needs to wait 30 - 5 = 25 minutes the answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(multiply(24, divide(5, const_60)), multiply(4, divide(5, const_60))), 4), const_60)

subject: math_general
question:
the average weight of 29 students is 28 kg . by the admission of a new student , the average weight is reduced to 27.1 kg . the weight of the new student is

Options:
A. 22 kg
