subject: math_general
question:
a trail mix company keeps costs down by employing the peanuts : cashews : almonds ratio of 10 : 4 : 1 in each bag of up to 75 total nuts . what is the maximum percentage by which the company could decrease its number of peanuts per bag and still have peanuts constitute more than half the total amount of nuts ?

Options:
A. 40 %
B. 48 %
C. 49 %
D. 50 %
E. 58 %
answer_text: peanuts = 50 cashews = 20 almonds = 5 we want to remove as many peanuts as possible while still having peanuts represent more than half of the mixture . . . the number of cashews and almonds will stay the same though , so we have 20 + 5 = 25 of those non - peanuts in total . if we had 25 peanuts and 25 non - peanuts , then that would be 50 % exactly . we want more than 50 % though , so we need to add in 1 more peanut . this gives us . . . peanuts = 26 cashews = 20 almonds = 5 the question asked for the decrease in the number of peanuts as a percentage . we started with 50 peanuts and removed 24 = 24 / 50 = 48 % ; answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(divide(75, add(add(10, 4), 1)), 10)

subject: math_probability
question:
there is a 30 % chance that tigers will not win at all during the whole season . there is a 30 % chance that portugeese will not play at all in the whole season . what is the greatest possible probability that the tigers will win and portugeese will play during the season ?

Options:
A. 55 %
B. 60 %
C. 70 %
D. 72 %
E. 80 %
answer_text: "there is a 30 % chance that tigers will not win at all during the whole season we can infer that there is 70 % chance tigers will win . similarly there is a 30 % chance that portugeese will not play at all in the whole season we can also infer that there is 70 % chance that portugeese will play . answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(const_1, divide(30, multiply(multiply(const_2, const_5), multiply(const_2, const_5)))), subtract(const_1, divide(30, multiply(multiply(const_2, const_5), multiply(const_2, const_5)))))

subject: math_general
question:

Options:
A. 57
B. 60
C. 63
D. 66
E. 69
answer_text: "m + h = 90 h = 90 - m 4 m + 5 h = 390 4 m + 5 * ( 90 - m ) = 390 m = 60 the answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(90, subtract(390, multiply(90, 4)))

subject: math_physics
question:
the sum of three consecutive even numbers is 60 . find the middle number of the three ?

Options:
A. 14
B. 60
C. 18
D. 70
E. 45
answer_text: "three consecutive even numbers ( 2 p - 2 ) , 2 p , ( 2 p + 2 ) . ( 2 p - 2 ) + 2 p + ( 2 p + 2 ) = 60 6 p = 60 = > p = 10 . the middle number is : 10 p = 60 . answer : B. Here is the formula add(add(power(add(add(divide(subtract(subtract(60, const_10), const_2), const_4), const_2), const_2), const_2), power(add(add(add(divide(subtract(subtract(60, const_10), const_2), const_4), const_2), const_2), const_2), const_2)), add(power(divide(subtract(subtract(60, const_10), const_2), const_4), const_2), power(add(divide(subtract(subtract(60, const_10), const_2), const_4), const_2), const_2)))

question:
a number when divided by 133 leaves 16 as a remainder . what will be the remainder if the number is divided by 50 ?

Options:
A. 51
B. 56
C. 49
D. 17
E. 7
answer_text: "133 + 16 = 149 dividing 149 evenly into whole numbers is 2 and leaves 49 remaining . the correct answer : C. Here is the formula reminder(add(133, 16), 50)

subject: math_gain
question:
the length of a rectangular floor is more than its breadth by 200 % . if rs . 240 is required to paint the floor at the rate of rs . 3 per sq m , then what would be the length of the floor ?

Options:
A. 65
B. 44
C. 18
D. 15.49
E. 14
answer_text: "let the length and the breadth of the floor be l m and b m respectively . l = b + 200 % of b = l + 2 b = 3 b area of the floor = 240 / 3 = 80 sq m l b = 80 i . e . , l * l / 3 = 240 l 2 = 240 = > l = 15.49 answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(sqrt(divide(divide(240, 3), const_3)), const_3)

subject: math_physics
question:
a train 100 m long crosses a platform 125 m long in 15 sec ; find the speed of the train ?

A. 91.2 kmph

C. 45.9 kmph
D. 61.2 kmph
E. 71.2 kmph
answer_text: "d = 100 + 155 = 255 t = 15 s = 255 / 15 * 18 / 5 = 61.2 kmph answer : D. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(15, multiply(125, const_0_2778)), 100)

subject: math_general
question:
john has 10 pairs of matched socks . if he loses 3 individual socks , what is the greatest number of pairs of matched socks he can have left ?

A. 7
B. 8
C. 5
D. 4
E. 3
answer_text: "because we have to maximize the pair of matched socks , we will remove 1 pairs ( 2 socks ) out of 10 pairs 1 sock from the 2 th pair . thus the no of matching socks pair remaining = 10 - 2 = 8 answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(10, const_3)

subject: math_physics
question:
a train 250 m long is running with a speed of 68 kmph . in what time will it pass a man who is running at 8 kmph in the same direction in which the train is going ?

Options:
A. 6 sec .
B. 7 sec .
C. 9 sec .
D. 15 sec .
E. none
answer_text: "solution speed of the train relative to man = ( 68 - 8 ) = 60 kmph = 60 x 5 / 18 = 50 / 3 m / sec . time taken by it to cover 250 m at ( 50 / 3 ) m / sec = ( 250 x 3 / 50 ) sec = 15 sec . answer : D. Here is the formula divide(250, multiply(add(68, 8), const_0_2778))

subject: math_other
question:

D. 17 days
E. 18 days
answer_text: "400 - - - 31 400 - - - 5 125 - - - ? 400 * 5 = 125 * x = > x = 16 days . answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(subtract(31, 26), 400), 275)

answer_text: "the number of exhaustive outcomes is 36 . let e be the event of getting an even number on both dies is 9 / 36 = 1 / 4 p ( e ) = 1 / 4 . aanswer : .Here is the formula divide(const_6, multiply(const_6, const_6))

subject: math_general
question:
an alloy of copper and zinc contains copper and zinc in the ratio 8 : 2 . another alloy of copper and zinc contains copper and zinc in the ratio 4 : 6 . in what ratio should the two alloys be mixed so that the resultant alloy contains equal proportions of copper and zinc ?

Options:
A. 5 : 1
B. 4 : 1
C. 3 : 1
D. 6 : 1
E. 8 : 1
answer_text: "let alloy _ 1 be x units , and let alloy _ 2 be y units . so , fraction of copper in alloy _ 1 = 8 x / 10 , and fraction of zinc in alloy _ 1 = 2 x / 10 similarly , fraction of copper in alloy _ 2 = 4 y / 10 , and fraction of zinc in alloy _ 2 = 6 y / 10 . mixing them , we get copper = 8 x / 10 + 4 y / 10 ; zinc = 2 x / 10 + 6 y / 10 so , 8 x + 4 y = 2 x + 6 y - > 6 x = 2 y - > x / y = 6 / 2 = 3 / 1 so , they must be mixed in the ratio 3 : 1 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(divide(8, add(4, 6)), divide(4, 6)), subtract(divide(4, 6), divide(4, add(4, 6))))

subject: math_general
question:
the average monthly income of p and q is rs . 5050 . the average monthly income of q and r is rs . 6250 and the average monthly income of p and r is rs . 5200 . the monthly income of p + q + r is :

Options:
A. 16100
B. 15700
C. 17500
D. 16000
E. 16500
answer_text: "explanation : let p , q and r represent their respective monthly incomes . then , we have : p + q = ( 5050 x 2 ) = 10100 . . . . ( i ) q + r = ( 6250 x 2 ) = 12500 . . . . ( ii ) p + r = ( 5200 x 2 ) = 10400 . . . . ( iii ) adding ( i ) , ( ii ) and ( iii ) , we get : 2 ( p + q + r ) = 33000 or p + q + r = 16500 . . . . ( iv ) ( p + q + r ) ' s monthly income = rs . 16500 . answer : E. Here is the formula subtract(add(5050, 5200), 6250)

subject: math_general
question:

subject: math_general
question:
the annual birth and death rate in a country per 1000 are 39.4 and 19.4 respectively . the number of years r in which the population would be doubled assuming there is no emigration or immigration is

Options:
A. 20
B. r = 25
C. r = 30
D. r = 35
E. 40
answer_text: "suppose the population of the country in current year is 1000 . so annual increase is 1000 + 39.4 - 19.4 = 1020 hence every year there is an increase of 2 % . 2000 = 1000 ( 1 + ( 2 / 100 ) ) ^ n n = 35 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(subtract(const_100, multiply(const_10, const_3)), multiply(divide(subtract(39.4, 19.4), 1000), const_100))

question:

question:
what is the probability of getting exactly 2 heads in a single throw of four fair coins ?

Options:

C. 3 / 8
D. 3 / 16

answer_text: "one possible case is hhtt . p ( hhtt ) = 1 / 2 * 1 / 2 * 1 / 2 * 1 / 2 = 1 / 16 there are 4 c 2 = 6 possible cases . p ( 2 heads ) = 6 * 1 / 16 = 3 / 8 the answer : C. Here is the formula divide(const_2, choose(add(const_3, const_3), const_3))

subject: math_physics
question:
the speed of a car increases by 2 kms after every one hour . if the distance travelling in the first one hour was 45 kms . what was the total distance traveled in 12 hours ?

Options:
A. 252 kms
B. 152 kms
C. 672 kms
D. 752 kms
E. 152 kms
answer_text: explanation : total distance travelled in 12 hours = ( 45 + 47 + 49 + . . . . . upto 12 terms ) this is an a . p with first term , a = 45 , number of terms , n = 12 , d = 2 . required distance = 12 / 2 [ 2 x 45 + { 12 - 1 ) x 2 ] = 6 ( 112 ) = 672 kms . answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(add(multiply(2, 45), multiply(subtract(12, const_1), 2)), divide(12, 2))

subject: math_general
question:
n denotes the number obtained when n is rounded to the nearest tenth . for example 4.31 = 4.3 0.089 - 1.135 =

Options:
A. 1.05
B. 1.04
C. - 1.05
D. - 1.0
E. - 0.1
answer_text: here let the first quantity be a = > a rounded to nearest tenths = > 0.1 similarly let the second quantity be b = > b rounded to nearest tenths = > 1.1 = > a - b = 0.1 - 1.1 = - 1 hence a - b = - 1 answer : D. Here is the formula subtract(0.089, 1.135)

subject: math_general
question:

answer_text: answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(80, subtract(60, 50))

subject: math_other
question:
initially , the men and women in a room were in the ratio of 4 : 5 . then , 2 men entered the room and 3 women left the room . then , the number of women doubled . now there are 14 men in the room . how many w women are currently in the room ?

Options:
A. 12
B. 14
C. 15
D. 24
E. 36
answer_text: "the number of women doubled means that they have become 24 from 12 . . and we have to tell the current strength so 24 is the answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(2, subtract(divide(multiply(5, subtract(14, 2)), 4), 3))

question:

question:
a certain protective additive increases from 30 days to 45 days the time between required maintenance checks on an industrial vehicle . by what percent is the time between maintenance checks increased by using the additive ?

Options:

D. 66 2 / 3 %
E. 75 %
answer_text: general formula for percent increase or decrease , ( percent change ) : percent = change / original ∗ 100 so , the time between maintenance checks increased by 45 − 30 / 30 ∗ 100 = 50 answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(45, 30), 30), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
an optometrist charges $ 150 per pair for soft contact lenses and $ 85 per pair for hard contact lenses . last week she sold 5 more pairs of soft lenses than hard lenses . if her total sales for pairs of contact lenses last week were $ 1,220 , what was the total number of pairs of contact lenses that she sold ?

D. 17

answer_text: "( x + 5 ) * 150 + x * 85 = 1220 = > x = 2 total lens = 2 + ( 2 + 5 ) = 9 answer : A. Here is the formula add(multiply(divide(subtract(add(add(add(multiply(const_4, const_100), multiply(5, const_10)), 5), const_1000), multiply(150, 5)), add(150, 85)), const_2), 5)

subject: math_physics
question:
a bus trip of 660 miles would have taken 1 hour less if the average speed v for the trip had been greater by 5 miles per hour . what was the average speed v , in miles per hour , for the trip ?

Options:
A. 40
B. 45
C. 50
D. 55
E. 60
answer_text: "the time is the distance / speed . the time difference is 1 hour . 660 / v - 660 / ( v + 5 ) = 1 660 ( v + 5 ) - 660 v = ( v ) ( v + 5 ) 3300 = ( v ) ( v + 5 ) 55 * 60 = ( v ) ( v + 5 ) v = 55 mph the answer : D. Here is the formula divide(subtract(sqrt(add(multiply(multiply(660, 5), const_4), power(5, const_2))), 5), const_2)

subject: math_physics
question:
a man can row downstream at 35 kmph and upstream at 25 kmph . find the speed of the man in still water and the speed of stream respectively ?

Options:
A. 35
B. 3
C. 25
D. 5
E. 35
answer_text: "let the speed of the man in still water and speed of stream be x kmph and y kmph respectively . given x + y = 35 - - - ( 1 ) and x - y = 25 - - - ( 2 ) from ( 1 ) & ( 2 ) 2 x = 60 = > x = 30 , y = 5 . answer : E. Here is the formula divide(divide(add(35, 25), const_2), const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
in an examination , 300 students appeared . out of these students ; 30 % got first division , 54 % got second division and the remaining just passed . assuming that no student failed ; find the number of students who just passed .

Options:
A. 33
B. 37
C. 54
D. 99
E. 48
answer_text: the number of students with first division = 30 % of 300 = 30 / 100 × 300 = 9000 / 100 = 90 and , the number of students with second division = 54 % of 300 = 54 / 100 × 300 = 16200 / 100 = 162 therefore , the number of students who just passed = 300 – ( 90 + 162 ) = 48 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(multiply(300, subtract(const_100, add(30, 54))), const_100)

subject: math_probability
question:
if two dice are thrown together , the probability of getting an even number on one die and an odd number on the other is ?

Options:
A. 1 / 9
B. 1 / 2
C. 1 / 1
D. 1 / 5
E. 1 / 8
answer_text: "the number of exhaustive outcomes is 36 . let e be the event of getting an even number on one die and an odd number on the other . let the event of getting either both even or both odd then = 18 / 36 = 1 / 2 p ( e ) = 1 - 1 / 2 = 1 / 2 . answer : B. Here is the formula divide(const_6, multiply(const_6, const_6))

subject: math_general
question:

D. 4 rs
E. 3 rs
answer_text: "5 m = xw = 8 b 5 m + xw + 8 b - - - - - 45 rs . 5 m + 5 m + 5 m - - - - - 45 rs . 15 m - - - - - - 45 rs . = > 1 m = 3 rs . answer : E. Here is the formula divide(45, multiply(const_3, 5))

question:

question:

answer_text: Here is the formula multiply(multiply(divide(const_1, multiply(const_2, const_3)), divide(const_1, multiply(const_2, const_3))), multiply(const_2, const_3))

subject: math_physics
question:
let a be the event that a randomly selected two digit number is divisible by 3 and let b be the event that a randomly selected two digit number is divisible by 10 . what is p ( a and b ) ?

B. 1 / 15
C. 1 / 5
D. 1 / 3
E. 1 / 2
answer_text: "p ( a and b ) = 1 / 3 * 1 / 10 = 1 / 30 the answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(3, const_1), multiply(subtract(3, const_1), 3)), divide(multiply(subtract(3, const_1), const_2), multiply(subtract(3, const_1), 3)))

question:
if x is 12 percent greater than 80 , then x =

answer_text: "12 % of 80 = ( 80 * 0.12 ) = 9.6 12 % greater than 80 = 80 + 9.6 = 89.6 answer : A. Here is the formula add(80, multiply(divide(12, const_100), 80))

subject: math_physics
question:
a and b complete a work in 6 days . a alone can do it in 8 days . if both together can do the work in how many days ?

Options:
A. 3.75 days
B. 3.43 days
C. 2.99 days
D. 2.98 days
E. 2.44 days
answer_text: "1 / 6 + 1 / 8 = 7 / 24 24 / 7 = 3.43 days answer : B. Here is the formula inverse(add(inverse(6), inverse(8)))

subject: math_general
question:
the avg weight of a , b & c is 84 kg . if d joins the group , the avg weight of the group becomes 80 kg . if another man e who weights is 8 kg more than d replaces a , then the avgof b , c , d & e becomes 79 kg . what is the weight of a ?

Options:
A. 25
B. 35
C. 75
D. 80
E. 90
answer_text: "a + b + c = 3 * 84 = 252 a + b + c + d = 4 * 80 = 320 - - - - ( i ) so , d = 68 & e = 68 + 8 = 76 b + c + d + e = 79 * 4 = 316 - - - ( ii ) from eq . ( i ) & ( ii ) a - e = 320 â € “ 316 = 4 a = e + 4 = 76 + 4 = 80answer : D.Here is the formula subtract(multiply(80, const_4), subtract(multiply(79, const_4), add(const_3.0, subtract(multiply(80, const_4), multiply(84, 8)))))

subject: math_other
question:
130 kg of an alloy a is mixed with 160 kg of alloy b . if alloy a has lead and tin in the ratio 2 : 3 and alloy b has tin and copper in the ratio 3 : 4 , then the amount of tin in the new alloy is ?

Options:
A. 140.6 kg
B. 145.3 kg
C. 146.5 kg
D. 110.8 kg
E. 114 kg
answer_text: "quantity of tin in 130 kg of a = 130 * 3 / 5 = 78 kg quantity of tin in 160 kg of b = 160 * 3 / 7 = 68.5 kg quantity of tin in the new alloy = 78 + 68.5 = 146.5 kg answer : C. Here is the formula add(multiply(divide(130, add(2, 3)), 3), multiply(divide(160, add(3, 4)), 3))

subject: math_gain
question:
if each side of a square is increased by 325 % in length , find the percentage change in its area ?

Options:
A. 54 %
B. 957 %
C. 956.25 %
D. 958.25 %
E. 959.50 %
answer_text: "let each side of the square be a , then area = a x a new side = 325 a / 100 = 13 a / 4 new area = ( 13 a x 13 a ) / ( 4 x 4 ) = ( 25 a ² / 16 ) increased area = = ( 169 a ² / 16 ) - a ² increase % = [ ( 153 a ² / 16 ) x ( 1 / a ² ) x 100 ] % = 956.25 % answer : C. Here is the formula square_area(add(const_1, divide(325, const_100)))

subject: math_gain
question:
martin bought 10 concert tickets , some at the full price of $ 2.00 per ticket , and some at a discounted price of $ 1.60 per ticket . if he spent a total of $ 18.80 , how many discounted tickets did he buy ?

C. 5
D. 6
E. 7
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(10, 2.00), multiply(1.60, 10))

subject: math_physics
question:
a can do a piece of work in 10 days and b can do it in 15 days and c can do it 20 days . they started the work together and a leaves after 5 days and b leaves after 3 days from the beginning . how long will work lost ?

Options:
A. 2
B. 4
C. 5
D. 6
E. 7
answer_text: "5 / 10 + 3 / 15 + x / 20 = 1 x = 18 / 3 = 6 answer : D. Here is the formula add(divide(subtract(const_1, add(multiply(subtract(3, 5), add(inverse(15), inverse(20))), multiply(add(inverse(20), add(inverse(10), inverse(15))), 5))), inverse(15)), const_4.0)

subject: math_general
question:
at the end of year x , automobile installment credit accounted for 35 % of all outstanding consumer installment credit . at that time automobile finance companies extended $ 40 billion of credit , or 1 / 3 of the automobile installment credit . how many billion dollars of consumer installment credit was outstanding at that time ?

Options:
A. 120
B. 300
C. 401.36
D. 350.15
E. 342.86
answer_text: "system of equations a = ( 35 / 100 ) c ( 1 / 3 ) a = 40 - - > a = 120 substitution 120 = ( 35 / 100 ) c c = ( 100 / 35 ) 120 answer - 120 / 35 * 100 the correct answer : E. Here is the formula divide(multiply(40, 3), divide(35, const_100))

subject: math_other
question:

A. a ) 27
B. b ) 98
C. c ) 34
D. d ) 35
E. e ) 62
answer_text: "( 3 x - 9 ) : ( 5 x - 9 ) = 2 : 3 x = 9 = > 3 x = 27 answer : A. Here is the formula add(multiply(3, divide(9, multiply(3, 5))), multiply(5, divide(9, multiply(3, 5))))

subject: math_physics
question:
the length of the bridge , which a train 130 metres long and travelling at 54 km / hr can cross in 30 seconds , is :

Options:
A. 200 m
B. 225 m
C. 320 m
D. 250 m
E. 240 m
answer_text: "speed = [ 54 x 5 / 18 ] m / sec = [ 15 / 1 ] m / sec time = 30 sec let the length of bridge be x metres . then , ( 130 + x ) / 30 = 15 = > ( 130 + x ) = 450 = > x = 450 - 130 = 320 m answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(divide(multiply(54, speed(const_1000, const_1)), speed(const_3600, const_1)), 30), 130)

subject: math_general
question:
two kinds of vodka are mixed in the ratio 1 : 2 and 2 : 1 and they are sold fetching the profit 10 % and 40 % respectively . if the vodkas are mixed in equal ratio and the individual profit percent on them are increased by 4 / 3 and 5 / 3 times respectively , then the mixture will fetch the profit of

Options:
A. 18 %
B. 20 %
C. 21 %
D. 40 %

answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula add(divide(multiply(10, 4), 2), add(10, 5))

subject: math_general
question:
the sum of the ages of 5 children born at the intervals of 3 year each is 50 year . what is the age of the youngest child ?

Options:
A. 4 year
B. 8 year
C. 10 year
D. none of these
E. 9 year
answer_text: "solution let the ages of the children be x , ( x + 3 ) , ( x + 6 ) , ( x + 9 ) and ( x + 12 ) year . then , x + ( x + 3 ) + ( x + 6 ) + ( x + 9 ) + ( x + 12 ) = 50 ⇔ 5 x = 20 ⇔ x = 4 . ∴ age of the youngest child = x = 4 years . answer : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(divide(50, divide(5, 3)), multiply(subtract(5, const_1), 3)), 3)

subject: math_other
question:
sara bought both german chocolate and swiss chocolate for some cakes she was baking . the swiss chocolate cost $ 2.5 per pound , and german chocolate cost $ 1.5 per pound . if the total the she spent on chocolate was $ 30 and both types of chocolate were purchased in whole number of pounds , how many total pounds of chocolate she purchased ?

A. 7
B. 18
C. 10
D. 12
E. 11
answer_text: "if there were all the expensive ones 2.5 . . . . there would be 30 / 2.5 or 12 of them but since 1.5 $ ones are also there , answer : B. Here is the formula divide(30, divide(add(2.5, 1.5), const_2))

subject: math_general
question:

question:

question:

subject: math_general
question:
solve the equation 2 – x = 2 b – 2 ax , where a and b are real parameters . find for which values of a the equation has for solution a natural number , if b = 7

Options:
A. 0
B. 1
C. 2
D. 3
E. 4
answer_text: solution : we write the given equation like this ( 2 a - 1 ) x = 2 ( b - 1 ) the following cases are possible : if 2 a - 1 ≠ 0 , i . e . a ≠ 1 / 2 , the equation has single solution x = 2 ( b - 1 ) / ( 2 a - 1 ) if a = 1 / 2 and b = 1 , the equation gets the kind 0 . x = 0 and every x is solution if a = 1 / 2 and b ≠ 1 , we get 0 . x = 2 ( b - 1 ) , where 2 ( b - 1 ) ≠ 0 in this case the equation has no solution . if b = 7 and a ≠ 1 / 2 the single solution is x = 2 ( 7 - 1 ) / ( 2 a - 1 ) = 12 / ( 2 a - 1 ) if a is whole number , then 2 a - 1 is also whole number and the solution x = 12 / ( 2 a - 1 ) is natural number when 2 a - 1 is positive divisor of 12 . to have a as whole number , the divisor of 12 mu be odd . but the only whole positive odd numbers divisible by 12 are 1 and 3 . therefore 2 a - 1 = 3 < = > a = 2 or 2 a - 1 = 1 < = > a = 1 a = 2 or 2 a - 1 = 1 < = > a = 1 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(add(const_1, const_1), 2)

subject: math_general
question:
in a caravan , in addition to 50 hens there are 45 goats and 8 camels with some keepers . if the total number of feet be 224 more than the number of heads , find the number of keepers .

Options:
A. 25
B. 20
C. 15
D. 13
E. 14
answer_text: let the number of keepers be x then , total number of heads = ( 50 + 45 + 8 + x ) = ( 103 + x ) . total number of feet = ( 45 + 8 ) x 4 + ( 50 + x ) x 2 = ( 312 + 2 x ) . ( 312 + 2 x ) - ( 103 + x ) = 224 = = > x = 15 . hence , number of keepers = 15 . answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(224, subtract(add(add(multiply(50, const_2), multiply(45, const_4)), multiply(8, const_4)), add(add(50, 45), 8)))

question:

answer_text: "t = 160 / 32 = 5 h t = 5 - 3 = 2 time ratio = 5 : 2 = 5 : 2 speed ratio = 2 : 5 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(divide(160, divide(160, 32)), divide(160, subtract(divide(160, 32), const_3)))

subject: math_geometry
question:
what will be the percentage increase in the area of the cube ' s surface if each of the cube ' s edges grows by 40 % ?

A. 95 %
B. 90 %
C. 85 %
D. 96 %

answer_text: "the question is very easy . my logic is the following : a surface = 6 * a ^ 2 after 40 % increase a surface = 6 * ( ( 1.4 a ) ^ 2 ) = 6 * 1.96 * a ^ 2 the increase in the surface area = ( 6 * 1.96 * a ^ 2 - 6 * a ^ 2 ) / 6 * a ^ 2 = ( 6 * a ^ 2 ( 1.96 - 1 ) ) / ( 6 * a ^ 2 ) = 1.96 - 1 = 0.96 = 96 % answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(power(add(const_1, divide(40, const_100)), const_2), const_1), const_100)

question:
in a village there are 150 men and 90 women in present time . if in next year population will be p = ( a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 ) ^ 1 / 2 , and in every year men are reduces 10 % . what is population of after 2 year .

Here is the formula power(add(power(multiply(subtract(1, divide(1, 10)), 150), const_2), power(subtract(power(add(power(150, const_2), power(90, const_2)), divide(1, 2)), multiply(subtract(1, divide(1, 10)), 150)), const_2)), divide(1, 2))

subject: math_general
question:
| x + 3 | – | 4 - x | = | 9 + x | how many solutions will this equation have ?

Options:
A. 0
B. 1
C. 2
D. 3
E. 4
answer_text: "you have | x + 3 | - | 4 - x | = | 8 + x | first , look at the three values independently of their absolute value sign , in other words : | x + 3 | - | 4 - x | = | 8 + x | ( x + 3 ) - ( 4 - x ) = ( 8 + x ) now , you ' re looking at x < - 8 , so x is a number less than - 8 . let ' s pretend x = - 10 here to make things a bit easier to understand . when x = - 10 i . ) ( x + 3 ) ( - 10 + 3 ) ( - 7 ) ii . ) ( 4 - x ) ( 4 - [ - 10 ] ) ( double negative , so it becomes positive ) ( 4 + 10 ) ( 14 ) iii . ) ( 8 + x ) ( 8 + - 10 ) ( - 2 ) in other words , when x < - 8 , ( x + 3 ) and ( 8 + x ) are negative . to solve problems like this , we need to check for the sign change . here is how i do it step by step . i . ) | x + 3 | - | 4 - x | = | 8 + x | ii . ) ignore absolute value signs ( for now ) and find the values of x which make ( x + 3 ) , ( 4 - x ) and ( 8 + x ) = to zero as follows : ( x + 3 ) x = - 3 ( - 3 + 3 ) = 0 ( 4 - x ) x = 4 ( 4 - 4 ) = 0 ( 8 + x ) x = - 8 ( 8 + - 8 ) = 1answer : B.Here is the formula divide(multiply(add(4, 3), const_2), 9)

Here is the formula sqrt(divide(460460, subtract(const_1, divide(15, const_100))))

subject: math_general
question:
what is the value of n if the sum of the consecutive odd intergers r from 1 to n equals 169 ?

Options:
A. 47
B. 25
C. 37
D. 33
E. 29
answer_text: "before you tackle this question you must first understand that the question is comprised of two key parts , 1 st is finding out how manytermsis in that sequence and 2 nd whatactual number valuethat term is . in an arithmetic progression , in this case consecutive odd integers 1 , 3 , 5 , . . . . , there are two set of rules . rule # 1 ( arithmetic sequence ) : xn = a + d ( n - 1 ) identifies what the actual # in the sequence would be . each number in the sequence has a term such as 1 ( is the first term ) , 3 ( is the second term ) and so on . so if i were to ask you to find out what the 10 th term is of that sequence you would use that formula to find that value . a = 1 ( first term ) d = 2 ( the common difference ) remember in the sequence 1 , 3 , 5 , 7 the common difference is always 2 * on a side note we use n - 1 because we do n ' t have d in the first term , therefore if we were solving for the first term we would get 0 as n - 1 and 0 times d would give us 0 , leaving only the first term . this works regardless what your first term is in any sequence . but remember the question askswhat is thevalueof n if the sum of the consecutive odd integers from 1 to n equals 169 ? which means we first need a consecutive sequence that sums up to 169 and than find what the value of the n is , in this case it would be the last number in that sequence . in order to find that we first need to knowhow many terms ( how many of the n there is ) in order to be able to plug n in this formula given we know what the sum is . for that to happen we need to use rule # 2 . rule # 2 ( summing an arithmetic series ) : 169 = n / 2 ( 2 a + ( n - 1 ) d ) . given the question gives us what the sum is ( 169 in this case ) we would simply use this formula to solve for n . once we solve for n ( 13 in this case ) we can simply plug n into the first formula ( rule 1 ) and find the value . it feels very confusing and difficult at first , but once you identify the steps all you need to do is plug and play . we have the sum ( 169 ) of a sequence , the number of terms in that sequence is ( unknown ) . rule # 2 tells us how many numbers there are in that sequence and rule # 1 gives us what that last term isanswer : .Here is the formula add(subtract(multiply(sqrt(169), const_2), multiply(const_2, 1)), 1)

subject: math_physics
question:
when a stone is dropped from a building 200 m high , its speed is proportional to the time elapsed after dropping . the distance traveled is proportional to the square of the time elapsed . after 1 second the speed of the train was 10 m / sec and it was 190 m above the ground . when its speed is 25 m / sec , what would be its distance from the ground ?

Options:
A. 140 m
B. 137.5 m
C. 125.75 m
D. 142.5 m
E. 152.5 m
answer_text: v = x * t and s = y * t ^ 2 10 = x * 1 , hence x = 10 units ( 200 - 190 ) = y * 1 * 1 y = 10 when speed = 25 m / sec , time elapsed = 25 / 10 = 2.5 sec distance travelled by stone = 10 * ( 2.5 ) ^ 2 = 62.5 mts so distance of stone above ground = 200 - 62.5 = 137.5 mtrs answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(200, multiply(power(divide(25, subtract(200, 190)), const_2), 10))

subject: math_general
question:
in a bag of small balls 1 / 4 are green , 1 / 8 are blue , 1 / 12 are yellow and the remaining 26 white . how many balls are blue ?

Options:
A. 6
B. 5
C. 4
D. 3
E. 8
answer_text: let us first find the fraction of green , blue and yellow balls 1 / 4 + 1 / 8 + 1 / 12 = 6 / 24 + 3 / 24 + 2 / 24 , common denominator = 11 / 24 , add numerators the fraction of white balls is given by 24 / 24 - 11 / 24 = 13 / 24 so the fraction 13 / 24 corresponds to 26 balls . if x is the total number of balls then ( 13 / 24 ) of x = 26 balls or ( 13 / 24 ) ? x = 26 x = 26 ? ( 24 / 13 ) = 48 , total number of balls the fraction of blue balls is 1 / 8 of x . the number of blue balls is given by ( 1 / 8 ) of 48 = 6 balls . correct answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(26, subtract(const_1, add(add(divide(1, 4), divide(1, 8)), divide(1, 12)))), divide(1, 8))

subject: math_physics
question:
a crow leaves its nest , and flies back and forth from its nest to a nearby ditch to gather worms . the distance between the nest and the ditch is 250 meters . in one and a half hours , the crow manages to bring worms to its nest 15 times . what is the speed of the crow in kilometers per hour ?

A. 1
B. 3
C. 4
D. 5
E. 6
answer_text: "the distance between the nest and the ditch is 250 meters . 15 times mean = a crow leaves its nest , and flies back ( going and coming back ) i . e . 2 times we get total 30 rounds . so the distance is 30 * 250 = 7500 . d = st 7500 / 1.5 = t , i think we can take 7500 meters as 7.5 km , then only we get t = 5 . ( 1000 meters = 1 km ) danswer : .Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(250, multiply(15, const_2)), const_1000), divide(15, const_10))

subject: math_general
question:

D. 200
E. 250
answer_text: "15 % is 5 % - points higher than 10 % but 15 % - points lower than 30 % . thus there should be 3 parts of solution x for 1 part of solution y . we should add 100 ml of solution y . the answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(15, 10), subtract(30, 15)), 300)

subject: math_gain
question:
on a saturday night , each of the rooms at a certain motel was rented for either $ 40 or $ 60 . if 10 of the rooms that were rented for $ 60 had instead been rented for $ 40 , then the total rent the motel charged for that night would have been reduced by 40 percent . what was the total rent the motel actually charged for that night ?

D. $ 1,600

answer_text: "let total rent the motel charge for all rooms = x if 10 rooms that were rented for 60 $ had instead been rented for 40 $ , then total difference in prices = 20 $ * 10 = 200 $ total rent the motel charged would have been reduced by 40 % . 4 x = 200 = > x = 500 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(10, subtract(60, 40)), divide(40, const_100))

subject: math_physics
question:
how much time will a train of length 380 m moving at a speed of 72 kmph take to cross another train of length 540 m , moving at 36 kmph in the same direction ?

answer_text: "the distance to be covered = sum of their lengths = 380 + 540 = 920 m . relative speed = 72 - 36 = 36 kmph = 36 * 5 / 18 = 10 mps . time required = d / s = 920 / 10 = 92 sec . answer : D. Here is the formula divide(add(380, 540), multiply(subtract(72, 36), const_0_2778))

subject: math_gain
question:

answer_text: "the area of the circle is increased by 800 % , thus the area is increased 9 times . the area of a circle it proportional to the square of the radius ( area = π r ^ 2 ) , therefore the radius must increase 3 times ( diameter increase 3 times = area increase 9 times ) , which is increase by 200 % . answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(const_100, divide(const_2, const_2))

subject: math_gain
question:
adam borrowed some money at the rate of 6 % p . a . for the first two years , at the rate of 9 % p . a . for the next 3 years , and at the rate of 14 % p . a . for the period beyond 5 years . 1 £ he pays a total interest of rs . 11400 at the end of 9 years how much money did he borrow ?

Options:
A. rs . 8000
B. rs . 09000
C. rs . 11000
D. rs . 10000
E. rs . 12000
answer_text: let the sum borrowed be x . then , ( x * 2 * 6 ) / 100 + ( x * 9 * 3 ) / 100 + ( x * 14 * 4 ) / 100 = 11400 ( 3 x / 25 + 27 x / 100 + 14 x / 25 ) = 11400 95 x / 100 = 11400 x = ( 11400 * 100 ) / 95 = 12000 . hence , sum borrowed = rs . 12000 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(11400, const_100), add(multiply(14, subtract(9, 5)), add(multiply(6, const_2), multiply(9, 3)))), const_1000)

subject: math_physics
question:
if a motorist had driven 1 hour longer on a certain day and at an average rate of 5 miles per hour faster , he would have covered 50 more miles than he actually did . how many more miles would he have covered than he actually did if he had driven 2 hours longer and at an average rate of 10 miles per hour faster on that day ?

A. 100
B. 120
C. 140
D. 150
E. 160
answer_text: "case 1 : let rate = r , time = t , and distance = d so d = rt case 2 : ( d + 50 ) = ( r + 5 ) ( t + 1 ) case 3 : ( d + x ) = ( r + 10 ) ( t + 2 ) x = 100 ans : A. Here is the formula add(multiply(subtract(50, 5), 2), multiply(2, 10))

subject: math_general
question:
in the x - y plane , there are 4 points ( 0,0 ) , ( 0,4 ) , ( 8,4 ) , and ( 8,0 ) . if these 4 points makes a rectangle , what is the probability that x + y < 4 ?

Options:
A. 1 / 2
B. 1 / 3
C. 2 / 3
D. 1 / 4
E. 2 / 5
answer_text: "the line y = - x + 4 intersects the rectangle and these three points of intersection ( 0,0 ) , ( 0,4 ) and ( 4,0 ) form a triangle . the points below the line y = - x + 4 satisfy x + y < 4 . the area of this triangle is ( 1 / 2 ) ( 4 ) ( 4 ) = 8 the area of the rectangle is 32 . p ( x + y < 4 ) = 8 / 32 = 1 / 4 the answer : D. Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(4, 4), const_2), multiply(4, add(const_1, 4)))

subject: math_general
question:
harold and millicent are getting married and need to combine their already - full libraries . if harold , who has 1 / 2 as many books as millicent , brings 1 / 3 of his books to their new home , then millicent will have enough room to bring 1 / 5 of her books to their new home . what fraction of millicent ' s old library capacity is the new home ' s library capacity ?

D. 11 / 30
E. 5 / 6
answer_text: "because we see h willbring 1 / 3 of his booksto the new home - - > try to pick a number that isdivisible by 3 . before : assume h = 30 books h = 1 / 2 m - - > m = 60 books after : h ' = 1 / 3 h = 10 books m ' = 1 / 5 m = 12 books total = 22 books m ' = 22 = 11 / 30 * 60 ratio : 11 / 30 ans : D. Here is the formula subtract(1, multiply(divide(1, 3), divide(1, 2)))

question:
let the number which when multiplied by 16 is increased by 375 .

subject: math_physics
question:
a can finish a work in 60 days , b in 9 days and c in 2 days , b and c start the work but are forced to leave after 3 days . the remaining work was done by a in ?

Options:
A. 10 days
B. 25 days
C. 6 days
D. 7 days
E. 8 days
answer_text: "b + c 1 day work = 1 / 9 + 1 / 12 = 7 / 36 work done by b and c in 3 days = 7 / 36 * 3 = 7 / 12 remaining work = 1 - 7 / 12 = 5 / 12 1 / 60 work is done by a in 1 day 5 / 12 work is done by a in 60 * 5 / 12 = 25 days answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(divide(const_1, add(divide(const_1, 9), divide(const_1, 2))), 3)

subject: math_general
question:
jill has 14 gallons of water stored in quart , half - gallon , and one gallon jars . she has equal numbers of each size jar holding the liquid . what is the total number of water filled jars ?

Options:
A. 3
B. 6
C. 9
D. 12
E. 24
answer_text: let the number of each size of jar = wthen 1 / 4 w + 1 / 2 w + w = 14 1 3 / 4 w = 14 w = 8 the total number of jars = 3 w = 24 answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(divide(14, add(const_1, add(const_0_25, divide(const_1, const_2)))), const_3)

subject: math_general
question:
a cricket player whose bowling average was 21.5 runs per wicket , takes 5 wicket for 52 runs in a match . due to this his average decreases by 0.5 . what will be the number of wickets taken by him till the last match ?

Options:
A. 64
B. 72
C. 111
D. 721
E. 108
answer_text: "average = total runs / total wickets total runs after last match = 21.5 w + 52 total wickets after last match = w + 5 ( 21.5 w + 52 ) / ( w + 5 ) = 21.5 - 0.5 = 21 w = 106 so total wickets aftr last match = w + 5 = 111 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(subtract(21.5, 0.5), 5), 52), 0.5)

subject: math_physics
question:
8 men , working 8 hours a day can complete a work in 18 days . how many hours a day must 12 men work to complete the same work in 12 days ?

Options:
A. 6
B. 7
C. 8
D. 9
E. 10
answer_text: "the number of hours required to complete the work is 8 * 8 * 18 = 1152 12 × 12 × ( x ) = 1152 x = 8 the answer : C. Here is the formula divide(multiply(multiply(8, 8), 18), multiply(12, 12))

subject: math_general
question:
1 , 8 , 27 , 64 , 125 , 216 , ( . . . . )

Options:
A. 354
B. 343
C. 245
D. 392
E. 400
answer_text: "the pattern is 1 ^ 3 , 2 ^ 3 , 3 ^ 3 , 4 ^ 3 , 5 ^ 3 , 6 ^ 3 , etc hence , next number is 7 ^ 3 = 343 answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(negate(64), multiply(subtract(8, 27), divide(subtract(8, 27), subtract(1, 8))))

subject: math_physics
question:
if 3 men or 4 women can do a piece of work in 16 days , in how many days can 12 men and 8 women do the same piece of work ?

Options:
A. 8 / 3
B. 6
C. 5
D. 4
E. 3
answer_text: "3 men can finish a work in 16 days , so in 1 day 3 men finish 1 / 16 th of work and in 1 day 1 men can finish , 1 / 48 th of work . similarly , in 1 day 1 women can finish 1 / 64 th of work . 12 men in 1 day can finish , 12 / 48 = 1 / 4 , 8 women in 1 day can finish = 8 / 64 = 1 / 8 1 / 4 + 1 / 8 = 3 / 8 . hence number of days to complete is 8 / 3 days . answer : A. Here is the formula inverse(add(divide(12, multiply(3, 16)), divide(8, multiply(4, 16))))

subject: math_physics
question:
two trains are running in opposite directions in the same speed . the length of each train is 120 meter . if they cross each other in 24 seconds , the speed of each train ( in km / hr ) is

Options:
A. 18
B. 36
C. 28
D. 20
E. 24
answer_text: "explanation : distance covered = 120 + 120 = 240 m time = 24 s let the speed of each train = v . then relative speed = v + v = 2 v 2 v = distance / time = 240 / 24 = 10 m / s speed of each train = v = 10 / 2 = 5 m / s = 5 × 36 / 10 km / hr = 18 km / hr answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(const_3_6, divide(divide(add(120, 120), 24), const_2))

subject: math_general
question:
john has $ 1,600 at the beginning of his trip , after spending money , he still has exactly $ 600 less than he spent on the trip . how much money does john still have ?

Options:
A. $ 200
B. $ 400
C. $ 600
D. $ 800
E. $ 500
answer_text: suppose total money spent = x not spend ( money he still has ) = x - 600 x + x - 600 = 1600 x = 1100 money not spend = 1100 - 600 = 500 answer : E. Here is the formula subtract(add(multiply(const_100, const_10), 600), divide(add(600, add(multiply(const_100, const_10), 600)), const_2))

subject: math_general
question:
a , b and c started a business by investing rs . 800 / - , rs . 1000 / - and rs . 1200 / - respectively for two years . total profit is rs . 1000 / - . find the c ' s share ?

Options:
A. rs . 600
B. rs . 500
C. rs . 400
D. rs . 800
E. rs . 900
answer_text: solution : a : b : c = ( 800 * 2 ) : ( 1000 * 2 ) : ( 12000 * 2 ) = 4 : 5 : 6 . so c ' s share = rs . ( 1000 * 6 / 15 ) = rs . 400 . answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(1200, divide(1000, add(add(800, 1000), 1200)))

subject: math_physics
question:
the speed of a car is 85 km in the first hour and 45 km in the second hour . what is the average speed of the car ?

Options:
A. 72 kmph
B. 65 kmph
C. 30 kmph
D. 80 kmph
E. 82 kmph
answer_text: s = ( 85 + 45 ) / 2 = 65 kmph answer : B. Here is the formula divide(add(85, 45), const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
find the number which multiplied by 15 is increased by 196 .

Options:
A. 14
B. 20
C. 26
D. 28
E. 27
answer_text: "let the number be x . then , 15 x - x = 196 x = 14 answer : A. Here is the formula add(15, subtract(196, reminder(15, 196)))

subject: math_general
question:
the positive value of x that satisfies the equation ( 3 + 2 x ) ^ 5 = ( 1 + 3 x ) ^ 4 is between bunuel , can you please explain this one ?

Options:
A. 0 and 0.5
B. 0.5 and 1
C. 1 and 1.5
D. 1.5 and 2
E. 2 and 2.5
answer_text: trial and error would probably be the easiest way to solve this problem . when x is large enough positive number , then because of the exponents ( 5 > 4 ) , lhs will be more than rhs ( as you increase the positive value of x the distance between the values of lhs and rhs will increase ) . try x = 1 - - > lhs = 3 ^ 5 = 81 * 3 = 243 and rhs = 4 ^ 4 = 64 * 4 = 256 , so ( 1 + 2 x ) ^ 5 < ( 1 + 3 x ) ^ 4 . as you can see lhs is still slightly less than than rhs . so , the value of x for which ( 1 + 2 x ) ^ 5 = ( 1 + 3 x ) ^ 4 is slightly more than 1 . answer : D. Here is the formula add(1, divide(1, 2))

subject: math_other
question:
the h . c . f . of two numbers is 20 and the other two factors of their l . c . m . are 11 and 15 . the larger of the two numbers is :

Options:
A. 276
B. 300
C. 299
D. 322
E. 345
answer_text: "the numbers are ( 20 x 11 ) and ( 20 x 15 ) . larger number = ( 20 x 15 ) = 300 . answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(20, 15)

subject: math_other
question:
two numbers are in the ratio of 1 : 2 . if 6 be added to both , their ratio changes to 3 : 5 . the greater number is

Options:
A. 20
B. 24
C. 28
D. 32
E. 36
answer_text: "let the ratio be x : y , given x / y = 1 / 2 , ( x + 6 ) / ( y + 6 ) = 3 / 5 = > x = 12 and y = 24 answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(1, 6)

subject: math_geometry
question:
carmen made a sculpture from small pieces of wood . the sculpture is 2 feet 10 inches tall . carmen places her sculpture on a base that is 10 inches tall . how tall are the sculpture andbase together ?

Options:
A. 3.1 feet
B. 3.66 feet
C. 3.3 feet
D. 3.4 feet
E. 3.5 feet
answer_text: "we know 1 feet = 12 inch then 2 feet = 24 inch 24 + 10 = 34 then 34 + 10 = 40 44 / 12 = 3.66 feet answer : B. Here is the formula divide(add(add(multiply(add(2, 10), 2), 10), 10), add(2, 10))

subject: math_geometry
question:
points a , b , and , c have xy - coordinates ( 2,0 ) , ( 8,12 ) , and ( 14,0 ) , respectively . points x , y , and z have xy - coordinates ( 6,0 ) , ( 8,4 ) , and ( 10,0 ) , respectively . what fraction w of the area of triangle abc is the area of triangle xyz ?

Options:
A. 1 / 9
B. 1 / 8
C. 1 / 6
D. 1 / 5
E. 1 / 3
answer_text: "if you notice , both triangles abc and xyz have a side on x axis . we can take these sides as bases for each triangle , therefore area of abc is 1 / 2 * 12 * 12 ( height of abc is the y coordinate of the third point ( 8,12 ) ) similarly area of xyz is 1 / 2 * 4 * 4 dividing area of xyz with that of abc gives w = 1 / 9 .answer : A.Here is the formula divide(divide(power(const_4, const_2), const_2), divide(power(add(const_10, const_2), const_2), const_2))

subject: math_gain
question:
the cash difference between the selling prices of an article at a profit of 4 % and 2 % is rs . 3 . the ratio of the two selling prices is ?

Options:
A. 52 : 51
B. 52 : 53
C. 52 : 50
D. 22 : 56
E. 52 : 51
answer_text: "let c . p . of the article be rs . x . then , required ratio = 104 % of x / 102 % of x = 104 / 102 = 52 / 51 = 52 : 51 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(add(const_100, 4), add(const_100, 2))

subject: math_other
question:
two whole numbers whose sum is 100 can not be in the ratio

Options:
A. 2 : 23
