subject: math_general
question:
what least number must be added to 696 , so that the sum is completely divisible by 20 ?

Options:
A. 2
B. 4
C. 3
D. 5
E. 6
answer_text: "if we divide 696 by 20 remainder is 16 20 - 16 = 4 answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(add(multiply(const_4, const_10), const_2), 20), 696)

subject: math_general
question:
line q has the equation 5 y – 3 x = 30 . if line s is perpendicular to q , has an integer for its y - intercept , and intersects q in the second quadrant , then how many possible line s ’ s exist ? ( note : intersections on one of the axes do not count . )

Options:
A. 22
B. 33
C. 36
D. 41
E. 58
answer_text: "5 y - 3 x = 30 and so y = 3 x / 5 + 6 when x = 0 , then y = 6 . when y = 0 , then x = - 10 the slope is 3 / 5 , so the slope of line s is - 5 / 3 . through the point ( - 10 , 0 ) , 0 = - 5 ( - 10 ) / 3 + c the y - intercept is c = - 50 / 3 < - 16 . thus the perpendicular line s can have y - intercepts from - 16 up to 5 . the number of possible lines is 16 + 5 + 1 = 22 the answer : A. Here is the formula add(subtract(divide(30, 5), const_2), add(divide(30, 3), divide(30, 5)))

subject: math_general
question:
in a certain warehouse , 30 percent of the packages weigh less than 75 pounds , and a total of 48 packages weigh less than 25 pounds . if 80 percent of the packages weigh at least 25 pounds , how many of the packages weigh at least 25 pounds but less than 75 pounds ?

Options:
A. 8
B. 64
C. 24
D. 102
E. 144
answer_text: answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(divide(multiply(multiply(divide(48, subtract(const_100, 80)), const_100), 30), const_100), 48)

subject: math_general
question:
a student took 5 papers in an examination , where the full marks were the same for each paper . his marks in these papers were in the proportion of 6 : 7 : 8 : 9 : 10 . in all papers together , the candidate obtained 60 % of the total marks then , the number of papers in which he got more than 50 % marks is

Options:
A. 1
B. 3
C. 4
D. 5
E. 7
answer_text: solution : let the marks obtained in five subjects be 6 x , 7 x , 8 x , 9 x and 10 x . total marks obtained = 40 x max . marks of the five subjects = 40 x / 0.6 [ 40 x is 60 % of total marks ] max . marks in each subject = 40 x / 0.6 * 5 = 13.33 x hence , % of each subject = 6 x * 100 / 13.33 = 45.01 % or , 7 x * 100 / 13.33 = 52.51 in same way other percentage are 60.01 % , 67.52 % , 75.01 % . hence , number of subjects in which he gets more than 50 % marks = 4 . answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(5, const_1)

subject: math_general
question:
subtracting 5 % of a from a is equivalent to multiplying a by how much ?

Options:
A. 0.95
B. 9.4
C. 0.094
D. 94
E. none
answer_text: "answer let a - 5 % of a = ab . ⇒ ( 95 x a ) / 100 = ab ∴ b = 0.95 correct option : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(const_100, 5), const_100)

subject: math_probability
question:
a bag consists of 20 marbles , of which 5 are blue , 7 are red , and the remainder are white . if lisa is to select a marble from the bag at random , what is the probability that the marble will be red or white ?

Options:
A. 3 / 4
B. 2 / 4
C. 1 / 4
D. 1 / 8
E. 1 / 16
answer_text: "bag consists of 20 marbles , of which 5 are blue , 7 are red remainder are white . so , white = 20 - 5 - 7 = 8 . probability that the marble will be red or white = probability that the marble will be red + probability that the marble will be white probability that the marble will be red or white = 7 / 20 + 8 / 20 = 15 / 20 = 3 / 4 hence , answer : A. Here is the formula divide(add(subtract(20, add(5, 7)), 7), 20)

subject: math_gain
question:
a trader bought a car at 20 % discount on its original price . he sold it at a 60 % increase on the price he bought it . what percent of profit did he make on the original price ?

Options:
A. 28 %
B. 72 %
C. 12 %
D. 82 %
E. 16 %
answer_text: "original price = 100 cp = 80 s = 80 * ( 160 / 100 ) = 128 100 - 128 = 28 % answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(divide(divide(multiply(subtract(const_100, 20), add(const_100, 60)), const_100), const_100), const_1), const_100)

subject: math_physics
question:
an aeroplane covers a certain distance at a speed of 150 kmph in 2 hours . to cover the same distance in 1 2 / 3 hours , it must travel at a speed of :

Options:
A. 1300 kmph
B. 160 kmph
C. 180 kmph
D. 1080 kmph
E. none
answer_text: "explanation : distance = ( 150 x 2 ) = 300 km . speed = distance / time speed = 300 / ( 5 / 3 ) km / hr . [ we can write 1 2 / 3 hours as 5 / 3 hours ] required speed = 300 x 3 / 5 km / hr = 180 km / hr . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(150, 2), add(const_1, divide(const_2, const_3))), const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
what is the units digit of 17 ^ 83 × 13 ^ 82 × 11 ^ 67 ?

Options:
A. 4
B. 5
C. 6
D. 7
E. 8
answer_text: "to find : the units digit of 17 ^ 83 × 13 ^ 82 × 11 ^ 87 let ' s reduce the clutter and simplify the product ( 7 ^ 83 ) ( 3 ^ 82 ) ( 1 ^ 87 ) 7 has a cyclicity of 4 : the last digit of any positive power of 7 repeats itself after every 4 th power so 7 ^ 5 has the same last digit as 7 ^ 1 , 7 ^ 9 , 7 ^ 13 thus , 7 ^ 83 has the same last digit as 7 ^ 3 , 7 ^ 7 , 7 ^ 11 i . e . 3 3 has a cyclicity of 4 : exactly the same routine as above thus , 3 ^ 82 has the same last digit as 3 ^ 2 , 3 ^ 6 , 3 ^ 10 i . e . 9 any power of 1 will result in 1 as the last digit so , product of our last digits = 3 x 9 x 1 = 27 . . . . last digit is 4 correct option : A. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(factorial(17), factorial(83)), multiply(factorial(17), factorial(82))), 17)

subject: math_physics
question:
how many seconds will a 550 m long train take to cross a man walking with a speed of 3 km / hr in the direction of the moving train if the speed of the train is 63 km / hr ?

Options:
A. 12 sec
B. 30 sec
C. 33 sec
D. 16 sec
E. 18 sec
answer_text: "speed of train relative to man = 63 - 3 = 60 km / hr . = 60 * 5 / 18 = 50 / 3 m / sec . time taken to pass the man = 550 * 3 / 50 = 33 sec . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(550, multiply(subtract(63, 3), const_0_2778))

subject: math_general
question:
jansi went out for shopping . she had in her handbag approximately rs . 15 / - in one rupee notes and 20 p . coins . when she returned she had as many one rupee notes as she originally had and as many 20 p . coins as she originally had one rupee notes . she actually came back with about one - third of what she had started out with . how much did she spend and exactly how much did she have with her when she started out ?

Options:
A. 9.6
B. 10.6
C. 11.0
D. 9.4
E. 8.1
answer_text: option : A. Here is the formula subtract(add(multiply(floor(divide(15, divide(subtract(multiply(const_3, const_100), 20), subtract(const_100, multiply(const_3, 20))))), divide(subtract(multiply(const_3, const_100), 20), subtract(const_100, multiply(const_3, 20)))), divide(multiply(floor(divide(15, divide(subtract(multiply(const_3, const_100), 20), subtract(const_100, multiply(const_3, 20))))), 20), const_100)), multiply(add(multiply(floor(divide(15, divide(subtract(multiply(const_3, const_100), 20), subtract(const_100, multiply(const_3, 20))))), divide(subtract(multiply(const_3, const_100), 20), subtract(const_100, multiply(const_3, 20)))), divide(multiply(floor(divide(15, divide(subtract(multiply(const_3, const_100), 20), subtract(const_100, multiply(const_3, 20))))), 20), const_100)), divide(const_1, const_3)))

subject: math_other
question:
at a certain organisation , the number of male members went up by 15 % in the year 2001 from year 2000 , and the number of females members went down by 6 % in the same time period . if the total membership at the organisation went up by 1.2 % from the year 2000 to 2001 , what was the ratio of male members to female members in the year 2000 ?

Options:
A. 1 : 2
B. 1 : 3
C. 2 : 3
D. 3 : 2
E. 2 : 1
answer_text: "men increase by 15 % = = > 1.15 m = males in 2001 women decrease by 6 % = = > 0.94 f = women in 2001 total employees increase by 1.2 % = = > 1.012 * ( m + f ) = total number of employees in 2001 obviously ( males in 2001 ) + ( females in 2001 ) = total number of employees in 2001 1.15 m + 0.94 f = 1.012 * ( m + f ) 1.15 m + 0.94 f = 1.012 m + 1.012 f 1.15 m - 1.012 m = 1.012 f - 0.94 f 0.138 m = 0.072 f m / f = ( 0.072 ) / ( 0.138 ) = 72 / 138 = 1 / 2 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(add(const_1, divide(1.2, const_100)), const_1000), multiply(subtract(const_1, divide(6, const_100)), const_1000)), subtract(multiply(add(const_1, divide(15, const_100)), const_1000), multiply(add(const_1, divide(1.2, const_100)), const_1000)))

subject: math_general
question:
in a party every person shakes hands with every other person . if there were a total of 120 handshakes in the party then what is the number of persons present in the party ?

Options:
A. 15
B. 16
C. 17
D. 18
E. 19
answer_text: "explanation : let the number of persons be n ∴ total handshakes = nc 2 = 120 n ( n - 1 ) / 2 = 120 ∴ n = 16 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(add(sqrt(add(multiply(multiply(120, const_2), const_4), const_1)), const_1), const_2)

subject: math_geometry
question:
a square mirror has exactly half the area of the rectangular wall on which it is hung . if each side of the mirror is 21 inches and the width of the wall is 28 inches , what is the length of the wall , in inches ?

Options:
A. 21.5
B. 31.5
C. 41.5
D. 61.5
E. 71.5
answer_text: "since the mirror is 42 inches in all sides , it must be a square . area of a square is a = a ^ 2 ; 21 ^ 2 = 441 . area of rectangle is double of that 2 * 441 = 882 . now a = lw and we need find w so a / l = w ; 882 / 28 = 31.5 answer ! answer : B. Here is the formula divide(multiply(const_2, square_area(21)), 28)

subject: math_general
question:
when positive integer x is divided by positive integer y , the remainder is 6 . if x / y = 96.15 , what is the value of y ?

Options:
A. 96
B. 75
C. 40
D. 25
E. 12
answer_text: "by the definition of a remainder , the remainder here is equal to 6 / y . the remainder in decimal form is given as . 15 therefore , 6 / y = . 15 solve for y and get 40 .answer : C.Here is the formula divide(6, subtract(96.15, floor(96.15)))

subject: math_general
question:
if the product of the integers w , x , y and z is 840 , and if 1 < w < x < y < z , what is the value of w + z ?

Options:
A. 10
B. 11
C. 16
D. 18
E. 21
answer_text: "840 = 4 * 5 * 6 * 7 so w = 4 , x = 5 , y = 6 , z = 7 w + z = 4 + 7 = 11 answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(subtract(divide(divide(840, const_2), const_2), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1), const_1)

subject: math_general
question:
a sum of money is to be distributed among a , b , c , d in the proportion of 5 : 2 : 4 : 3 . if c gets 1000 more than d , what is b ’ s share ?

Options:
A. 500
B. 1500
C. 2000
D. 1400
E. none of these
answer_text: "let the shares of a , b , c and d be 5 x , 2 x , 4 x , 3 x respectively . then , 4 x – 3 x = 1000 ⇒ x = 1000 ∴ b ’ s share = 2 x = 2000 answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(subtract(4, 3), 1000), 3)

subject: math_general
question:
in a certain apartment building , there are one - bedroom and two - bedroom apartments . the rental prices of the apartment depend on a number of factors , but on average , two - bedroom apartments have higher rental prices than do one - bedroom apartments . let r be the average rental price for all apartments in the building . if r is $ 5,600 higher than the average rental price for all one - bedroom apartments , and if the average rental price for all two - bedroom apartments is $ 10,400 higher that r , then what percentage of apartments in the building are two - bedroom apartments ?

Options:
A. 26 %
B. 35 %
C. 39 %
D. 42 %
E. 52 %
answer_text: answer : B. Here is the formula divide(multiply(5,600, const_100), add(add(multiply(const_2, const_1000), const_100), 5,600))

subject: math_general
question:
if each participant of a chess tournament plays exactly one game with each of the remaining participants , then 276 games will be played during the tournament . find the number of participants .

Options:
A. 20
B. 22
C. 24
D. 26
E. 28
answer_text: "let p be the number of participants . pc 2 = 276 ( p ) ( p - 1 ) = 552 = 24 * 23 p = 24 the answer : C. Here is the formula divide(add(sqrt(add(multiply(multiply(276, const_2), const_4), const_1)), const_1), const_2)

subject: math_other
question:
x starts a business with rs . 45000 . y joins in the business after 3 months with rs . 30000 . what will be the ratio in which they should share the profit at the end of the year ?

Options:
A. 1 : 2
B. 2 : 1
C. 1 : 3
D. 3 : 1
E. 1 : 1
answer_text: "explanation : ratio in which they should share the profit = ratio of the investments multiplied by the time period = 45000 × 12 : 30000 × 9 = 45 × 12 : 30 × 9 = 3 × 12 : 2 × 9 = 2 : 1 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(multiply(45000, const_12), multiply(30000, add(const_4, const_3)))

subject: math_general
question:
3 friends had dinner at a restaurant . when the bill was received , akshitha paid 3 / 4 as much as veena paid and veena paid 1 / 2 as much as lasya paid . what fraction of the bill did veena pay ?

Options:
A. 4 / 15
B. 3 / 12
C. 3 / 11
D. 3 / 10
E. 3 / 14
answer_text: let veena paid x , so akshitha paid 3 x / 4 , and lasya paid 2 x , so total bill paid is given by x + ( 3 x / 4 ) + 2 x = 1 , we get i . e . x = 4 / 15 answer : A. Here is the formula divide(4, add(add(3, 4), multiply(4, 2)))

subject: math_general
question:
a number x is 5 times another number y . the percentage that y is less than x is

Options:
A. 12.5 %
B. 87.5 %
C. 80 %
D. 11 %
E. 1 %
answer_text: "say y = 1 and x = 5 . then y = 1 is less than x = 5 by ( 5 - 1 ) / 5 * 100 = 4 / 5 * 100 = 80 % . answer : C. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(5, const_1), 5), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
marketing executives for a certain chewing gum company projected a 40 percent increase in revenue this year over that of last year , but revenue this year actually decreased by 30 % . what percent of the projected revenue was the actual revenue ?

Options:
A. 50 %
B. 58 %
C. 62.5 %
D. 64 %
E. 75 %
answer_text: last year revenue = 100 ( assume ) ; this year revenue = 70 ; projected revenue = 140 . actual / projected * 100 = 70 / 140 * 100 = 50 % . answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(const_100, 30), add(40, const_100)), const_100)

subject: math_physics
question:
how many bricks , each measuring 25 cm x 11.25 cm x 6 cm , will be needed to build a wall of 9 m x 6 m x 22.5 cm ?

Options:
A. 6400
B. 6410
C. 6440
D. 7200
E. 6800
answer_text: "number of bricks = volume of wall / volume of bricks = 900 x 600 x 22.5 / 25 x 11.25 x 6 = = 7200 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(multiply(multiply(multiply(9, const_100), multiply(6, const_100)), 22.5), multiply(multiply(25, 11.25), 6))

subject: math_general
question:
at a certain restaurant , the average ( arithmetic mean ) number of customers served for the past x days was 65 . if the restaurant serves 120 customers today , raising the average to 90 customers per day , what is the value of x ?

Options:
A. 1
B. 5
C. 9
D. 15
E. 30
answer_text: withoutusing the formula , we can see that today the restaurant served 30 customers above the average . the total amount above the average must equal total amount below the average . this additional 30 customers must offset the “ deficit ” below the average of 90 created on the x days the restaurant served only 60 customers per day . 30 / 30 = 1 day . choice ( a ) . withthe formula , we can set up the following : 90 = ( 60 x + 120 ) / ( x + 1 ) 90 x + 90 = 60 x + 120 30 x = 30 x = 1 answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(divide(subtract(120, 90), subtract(90, 65)), divide(subtract(120, const_100), const_100))

subject: math_physics
question:
stacy has a 63 page history paper due in 7 days . how many pages per day would she have to write to finish on time ?

Options:
A. 9
B. 8
C. 10
D. 8.5
E. 6
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula divide(63, 7)

subject: math_general
question:
the ages of patrick and michael are in the ratio of 3 : 5 and that of michael and monica are in the ratio of 3 : 5 . if the sum of their ages is 148 , what is the difference between the ages of patrick and monica ?

Options:
A. 27
B. 48
C. 45
D. 72
E. 18
answer_text: "ages of p and mi = 3 x + 5 x ages of mi and mo = 3 x : 5 x rationalizing their ages . ratio of their ages will be 9 x : 15 x : 25 x sum = 47 x = 148 x = 3 difference if ages of pa and mo = 25 x - 9 x = 16 x = 16 * 3 = 48 answer : B. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(multiply(5, 5), divide(148, add(add(multiply(3, 3), multiply(3, 5)), multiply(5, 5)))), multiply(multiply(3, 3), divide(148, add(add(multiply(3, 3), multiply(3, 5)), multiply(5, 5)))))

subject: math_general
question:
you collect baseball cards . suppose you start out with 15 . maria takes half of one more than the number of baseball cards you have . since you ' re nice , you give peter 1 baseball card . since his father makes baseball cards , paul decides to triple your baseball cards . how many baseball cards do you have at the end ?

Options:
A. 17
B. 18
C. 19
D. 20
E. 21
answer_text: solution start with 15 baseball cards . maria takes half of one more than the number of baseball cards you have . so maria takes half of 15 + 1 which is 8 , so you ' re left with 15 - 8 = 7 . peter takes 1 baseball card from you : 7 - 1 = 6 baseball cards . paul triples the number of baseball cards you have : 6 × 3 = 18 baseball cards . so you have 18 at the end . correct answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(subtract(subtract(15, const_4), const_4), 1), const_3)

subject: math_gain
question:
if the cost price of 18 articles is same as the selling price of 25 articles . find the gain or loss percentage ?

Options:
A. 30 % gain
B. 28 % loss
C. 40 % gain
D. 40 % loss
E. 50 % loss
answer_text: "explanation : 18 cp = 25 sp cost price cp = 25 selling price sp = 18 formula = ( sp - cp ) / cp * 100 = ( 18 - 25 ) / 25 * 100 = 28 % loss answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(const_100, divide(subtract(const_100, divide(multiply(const_100, 25), 18)), divide(multiply(const_100, 25), 18)))

subject: math_gain
question:
evaluate 28 % of 450 + 45 % of 280

Options:
A. 232
B. 242
C. 252
D. 262
E. 272
answer_text: answer : C. Here is the formula divide(28, divide(450, 28))

subject: math_general
question:
xavier , yvonne , and zelda each try independently to solve a problem . if their individual probabilities for success are 1 / 4 , 2 / 3 and 5 / 8 , respectively , what is the probability that xavier and yvonne , but not zelda , will solve the problem ?

Options:
A. 1 / 16
B. 7 / 8
C. 9 / 64
D. 5 / 64
E. 3 / 64
answer_text: p ( xavier will solve ) = 1 / 4 p ( yvonne will solve ) = 2 / 3 p ( zelda will not solve ) = 1 - 5 / 8 = 3 / 8 . now , we need to multiply all this ps to find an answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(divide(1, 4), divide(2, 3)), subtract(const_1, divide(5, 8)))

subject: math_general
question:
in a certain lottery , the probability that a number between 1 and 15 , inclusive , is drawn is 1 / 3 . if the probability that a number 1 or larger is drawn is 2 / 3 , what is the probability that a number less than or equal to 15 is drawn ?

Options:
A. 2 / 3
B. 1 / 3
C. 1 / 4
D. 1 / 6
E. 2 / 5
answer_text: you can simply use sets concept in this question . the formula total = n ( a ) + n ( b ) - n ( a and b ) is applicable here too . set 1 : number 1 or larger set 2 : number 15 or smaller 1 = p ( set 1 ) + p ( set 2 ) - p ( set 1 and set 2 ) ( combined probability is 1 because every number will be either 12 or moreor 20 or less or both ) 2 / 3 + p ( set 2 ) - 1 / 3 = 1 p ( set 2 ) = 2 / 3 answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(add(1, divide(1, 3)), divide(2, 3))

subject: math_physics
question:
the distance from city a to city b is 120 miles . while driving from city a to city b , cara drives at a constant speed of 30 miles per hour . dan leaves city a 120 minutes after cara . what is the minimum constant speed in miles per hour that dan must exceed in order to arrive in city b before cara ?

Options:
A. 42
B. 44
C. 60
D. 48
E. 50
answer_text: "the time it takes cara to drive to city b is 120 / 30 = 4 hours . dan needs to take less than 2 hours for the trip . dan needs to exceed a constant speed of 120 / 2 = 60 miles per hour . the answer : C. Here is the formula divide(120, subtract(divide(120, 30), divide(120, 120)))

subject: math_physics
question:
a student travels from his house to school at 12 km / hr and reaches school 2 hours late . the next day he travels 20 km / hr and reaches school 1 hour early . what is the distance between his house and the school ?

Options:
A. 90
B. 100
C. 110
D. 120
E. 130
answer_text: "let x be the distance from his house to the school . x / 12 = x / 20 + 3 5 x = 3 x + 180 2 x = 180 x = 90 km the answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(12, 20), divide(subtract(20, 12), add(2, 2)))

subject: math_general
question:
if x is less than y by 25 % then y exceed x by :

Options:
A. 33.33 %
B. 25 %
C. 75 %
D. 66.66 %
E. none of these
answer_text: "using formula ( x / ( 100 - x ) * 100 ) where x is percentage decrease ( here it is 25 % ) = > 25 ( 100 - 25 ) * 100 = 33.33 % answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(divide(const_100, subtract(const_100, 25)), const_1), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
a pharmaceutical company received $ 8 million in royalties on the first $ 20 million in sales of the generic equivalent of one of its products and then $ 9 million in royalties on the next $ 108 million in sales . by approximately what percent did the ratio of royalties to sales decrease from the first $ 20 million in sales to the next $ 108 million in sales ?

Options:
A. 8 %
B. 15 %
C. 45 %
D. 52 %
E. 79 %
answer_text: "solution : this is a percent decrease problem . we will use the formula : percent change = ( new – old ) / old x 100 to calculate the final answer . we first set up the ratios of royalties to sales . the first ratio will be for the first 20 million in sales , and the second ratio will be for the next 108 million in sales . because all of the sales are in millions , we do not have to express all the trailing zeros in our ratios . first 20 million royalties / sales = 8 / 20 next 108 million royalties / sales = 9 / 108 = 1 / 12 because each ratio is not an easy number to use , we can simplify each one by multiplying each by the lcm of the two denominators , which is 60 . keep in mind that we are able to do this only because our answer choices are expressed in percents . first 20 million royalties / sales = ( 8 / 20 ) x 60 = 24 next 108 million royalties / sales = 9 / 108 = ( 1 / 12 ) x 60 = 5 we can plug 24 and 5 into our percent change formula : ( new – old ) / old x 100 [ ( 5 – 24 ) / 24 ] x 100 - 475 / 6 x 100 at this point we can stop and consider the answer choices . since we know that 475 / 6 is just a bit less than ½ , we know that - 475 / 6 x 100 is about a 79 % decrease . answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(multiply(divide(8, 20), const_100), multiply(divide(9, 108), const_100)), multiply(divide(8, 20), const_100)), const_100)

subject: math_geometry
question:
a square with sides of 15 units each . what would be the area of the square . consider a square as a combination of two right angled triangles .

Options:
A. ['a ) 100'
B. 'b ) 256'
C. 'c ) 225'
D. 'd ) 81'
E. 'e ) 144']
answer_text: a square can be considered as a set of two right angled triangles joined from the hypotenuse . since the sides are 10 units each . the height and base of both the triangles is 10 each . area of a right angled triangle is 1 / 2 * base * height area of both the triangles is 2 * 1 / 2 * base * height . since both triangles are similar . = base * height = 15 * 15 = 225 ans : C. Here is the formula multiply(triangle_area(15, 15), const_2)

subject: math_physics
question:
a man is standing on a railway bridge which is 180 m long . he finds that a train crosses the bridge in 20 seconds but himself in 8 seconds . find the length of the train and its speed

Options:
A. 50 km
B. 52 km
C. 54 km
D. 56 km
E. 58 km
answer_text: "explanation : let the length of the train be x meters , then , the train covers x meters in 8 seconds and ( x + 180 ) meters in 20 sec x / 8 = ( x + 180 ) / 20 ⇔ 20 x = 8 ( x + 180 ) < = > x = 120 length of the train = 120 m . speed of the train = ( 120 / 8 ) m / sec = m / sec = ( 15 × 18 / 5 ) kmph = 54 km answer : C. Here is the formula speed(divide(divide(180, 20), subtract(inverse(8), inverse(20))), 8)

subject: math_general
question:
how many digits are required to number a book containing 240 pages ?

Options:
A. 756
B. 612
C. 492
D. 372
E. 250
answer_text: 9 pages from 1 to 9 will require 9 digits . 90 pages from 10 to 99 will require 90 * 2 = 180 digits . 240 - ( 90 + 9 ) = 141 pages will require 141 * 3 = 423 digits . the total number of digits is 9 + 180 + 423 = 612 . the answer : B. Here is the formula add(add(subtract(const_10, const_1), multiply(multiply(subtract(const_10, const_1), const_10), const_2)), multiply(add(subtract(240, const_100), const_1), const_3))

subject: math_general
question:
out of 40 applicants to a law school , 15 majored in political science , 20 had a grade point average higher than 3.0 , and 10 did not major in political science and had a gpa equal to or lower than 3.0 . how many e applicants majored in political science and had a gpa higher than 3.0 ?

Options:
A. 5
B. 10
C. 15
D. 25
E. 35
answer_text: "total applicants = 40 political science = 15 and non political science = 40 - 15 = 25 gpa > 3.0 = 20 and gpa < = 3.0 = 20 10 non political science students had gpa < = 3.0 - - > 15 non political science students had gpa > 3.0 gpa > 3.0 in political science = total - ( gpa > 3.0 in non political science ) e = 20 - 15 = 5 answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(20, subtract(40, add(10, 15)))

subject: math_physics
question:
george does 3 / 5 th of a piece of work in 9 days . he then calls in paul and they finish the work in 4 days . how long would paul take to do the work by himself ?

Options:
A. 10
B. 20
C. 30
D. 40
E. 50
answer_text: "9 day 3 / 5 1 day 1 / 15 remaing 1 - 3 / 5 = 2 / 5 both can do 2 / 5 work in 4 day one day work of both = 1 / 10 therfor paul would take 1 / 10 - 1 / 15 = 1 / 30 or 30 days answer : C. Here is the formula inverse(divide(subtract(subtract(const_1, divide(3, 5)), multiply(4, divide(const_1, multiply(5, 3)))), 4))

subject: math_general
question:
in august , a cricket team that played 120 matches won 24 % of the games it played . after a continuous winning streak , this team raised its average to 52 % . how many matches did the team win to attain this average ?

Options:
A. 40
B. 52
C. 68
D. 70
E. 98
answer_text: let the no of matches played more = x so , ( 120 + x ) * 52 / 100 = 28.8 + x by solving we get x = 70 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(divide(52, const_100), 120), multiply(divide(24, const_100), 120)), subtract(const_1, divide(52, const_100)))

subject: math_physics
question:
in a survey of 340 employees , 104 of them are uninsured , 54 work part time , and 12.5 percent of employees who are uninsured work part time . if a person is to be randomly selected from those surveyed , what is the probability that the person will neither work part time nor be uninsured ?

Options:
A. 7 / 12
B. 8 / 41
C. 39 / 68
D. 1 / 8
E. 41 / 91
answer_text: - - - - - - - - - ui - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - nui - - - - - - - total pt - - - - ( 12.5 / 100 ) * 104 = 13 - - - - - - - - - - - - - 54 npt - - - 104 - 13 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - x - - - - - - - - 286 total - - 104 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 340 we have to find not part time and not uninsured . in other words not part time and insured = x / 340 = ( 286 - 104 + 13 ) / 340 = 39 / 68 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(340, add(subtract(54, divide(multiply(12.5, 104), multiply(const_1, const_100))), 104)), 340)

subject: math_general
question:
a ( 3 , w ^ 3 ) is the ( x , y ) coordinate of point located on the parabola y = x ^ 2 - 1 . what is the value of w ?

Options:
A. 2 .
B. 4 .
C. 5 .
D. 6 .
E. 9 .
answer_text: y = x ^ 2 - 1 w ^ 3 = 3 ^ 2 - 1 w ^ 3 = 8 w = 2 answer : A. Here is the formula power(subtract(power(3, 2), 1), divide(1, 3))

subject: math_general
question:
in x game of billiards , x can give y 20 points in 60 and he can give z 30 points in 60 . how many points can y give z in x game of 120 ?

Options:
A. 30
B. 20
C. 25
D. 40
E. 50
answer_text: x scores 60 while y score 40 and z scores 30 . the number of points that z scores when y scores 120 = ( 120 * 30 ) / 40 = 90 . in x game of 100 points , y gives ( 120 - 90 ) = 30 points to c .answer : A.Here is the formula subtract(multiply(subtract(60, 20), const_3), multiply(subtract(60, 30), const_3))

subject: math_general
question:
a house wife saved $ 2.50 in buying an item on sale . if she spent $ 25 for the item , approximately how much percent she saved in the transaction ?

Options:
A. 8 %
B. 9 %
C. 10 %
D. 11 %
E. 12 %
answer_text: actual price = 25 + 2.50 = $ 27.50 saving = 2.50 / 27.50 * 100 = 100 / 11 = 9 % approximately answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(divide(2.5, add(25, 2.5)), const_100)

subject: math_gain
question:
after successive discounts of 20 % , 10 % and 5 % a certain good is sold for rs . 6700 . find the actual price of the good .

Options:
A. s . 6000
B. s . 9000
C. s . 10800
D. s . 9795
E. s . 9980
answer_text: let actual price was 100 . after three successive discount this will become , 100 = = 20 % discount = > 80 = = 10 % discount = > 72 = = 5 % discount = 68.4 now compare , 68.4 = 6700 1 = 6700 / 68.4 100 = ( 6700 * 100 ) / 68.4 = rs . 9795 . answer : D. Here is the formula divide(multiply(6700, const_100), subtract(subtract(subtract(const_100, 20), divide(multiply(subtract(const_100, 20), 10), const_100)), divide(multiply(subtract(subtract(const_100, 20), divide(multiply(subtract(const_100, 20), 10), const_100)), 5), const_100)))

subject: math_physics
question:
a not - so - good clockmaker has four clocks on display in the window . clock # 1 loses 25 minutes every hour . clock # 2 gains 15 minutes every hour relative to clock # 1 ( i . e . , as clock # 1 moves from 12 : 00 to 1 : 00 , clock # 2 moves from 12 : 00 to 1 : 15 ) . clock # 3 loses 20 minutes every hour relative to clock # 2 . finally , clock # 4 gains 20 minutes every hour relative to clock # 3 . if the clockmaker resets all four clocks to the correct time at 12 noon , what time will clock # 4 display after 6 actual hours ( when it is actually 6 : 00 pm that same day ) ?

Options:
A. 5 : 00
B. 5 : 34
C. 5 : 42
D. 6 : 00
E. 6 : 24
answer_text: "c 1 loses 15 minutes every hour . so after 60 minutes have passed , c 1 displays that 60 - 15 = 45 minutes have passed . c 2 gains 15 minutes for every 60 minutes displayed on c 1 . thus , the time displayed on c 2 is 75 / 60 = 5 / 4 the time displayed on c 1 . so after 60 minutes have passed , c 2 displays the passing of ( 5 / 4 * 45 ) minutes . c 3 loses 20 minutes for every 60 minutes displayed on c 2 . thus , the time displayed on c 3 is 40 / 60 = 2 / 3 the time displayed on c 2 . so after 60 minutes have passed , c 3 displays the passing of ( 2 / 3 * 5 / 4 * 45 ) minutes . c 4 gains 20 minutes for every 60 minutes displayed on c 3 . thus , the time displayed on c 4 is 80 / 60 = 4 / 3 the time displayed on clock 3 . so after 60 minutes have passed , c 4 displays the passing of 4 / 3 * 2 / 3 * 5 / 4 * 45 = 50 minutes . c 4 loses 10 minutes every hour . in 6 hours , c 4 will lose 6 * 10 = 60 minutes = 1 hour . since the correct time after 6 hours will be 6 pm , c 4 will show a time of 6 - 1 = 5 : 42 pm . the correct answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(6, const_10), multiply(multiply(multiply(divide(add(const_60, 15), const_60), divide(subtract(const_60, 20), const_60)), divide(add(const_60, 20), const_60)), subtract(const_60, 25)))

subject: math_general
question:
in a factory , an average of 60 tv ' s are produced per day for the fist 25 days of the months . a few workers fell ill for the next 5 days reducing the daily avg for the month to 58 sets / day . the average production per day for day last 5 days is ?

Options:
A. 20
B. 36
C. 48
D. 50
E. 59
answer_text: production during these 5 days = total production in a month - production in first 25 days . = 30 x 58 - 25 x 60 = 240 ∴ average for last 5 days = 240 / 5 = 48answer : C.Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(add(25, 5), 58), multiply(25, 60)), 5)

subject: math_general
question:
a collection of books went on sale , and 2 / 3 of them were sold for $ 4.25 each . if none of the 30 remaining books were sold , what was the total amount received for the books that were sold ?

Options:
A. $ 260
B. $ 255
C. $ 285
D. $ 290
E. $ 275
answer_text: "if 30 books constitute 1 / 3 rd of the total , then 2 / 3 rd of the total = 60 books amount received for sold books = 60 * 4.25 = $ 255 answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(const_2.0, divide(multiply(30, divide(2, 3)), divide(const_1, 3)))

subject: math_other
question:
the ratio between the present ages of a and b is 5 : 3 respectively . the ratio between a ' s age 4 years ago and b ' s age 4 years hence is 1 : 1 . what is the ratio between a ' s age 4 years hence and b ' s age 4 years ago ?

Options:
A. 3 : 9
B. 3 : 6
C. 3 : 1
D. 3 : 4
E. 3 : 2
answer_text: "let the present ages of a and b be 5 x and 3 x years respectively . then , ( 5 x - 4 ) / ( 3 x + 4 ) = 1 / 1 2 x = 8 = > x = 4 required ratio = ( 5 x + 4 ) : ( 3 x - 4 ) = 24 : 8 = 3 : 1 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(5, divide(add(5, 5), subtract(5, 3))), 5), subtract(multiply(3, divide(add(5, 5), subtract(5, 3))), 5))

subject: math_general
question:
when jessica withdrew $ 200 from her bank account , her account balance decreased by 2 / 5 . if she deposits an amount equal to 2 / 3 of the remaining balance , what will be the final balance in her bank account ?

Options:
A. 300
B. 375
C. 400
D. 500
E. 575
answer_text: "as per the question 200 = 2 a / 5 thus - a which is the total amount = 500 the amount thus left = 300 she then deposited 2 / 3 of 300 = 200 total amount in her account = 500 answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(divide(200, subtract(2, divide(const_3, 5))), 200), add(2, divide(2, const_4.0)))

subject: math_general
question:
in n is a positive integer less than 200 , and 14 n / 60 is an integer , then n has how many different positive prime factors s ?

Options:
A. 2
B. 3
C. 5
D. 6
E. 8
answer_text: "i like to put the numbers in prime factors so it is easier and faster to visualize . 14 * n / 60 if we write the factors of 14 - - > 2 , 7 , and the factors of 60 - - > 2 , 2 , 3 , 5 , we have ( 2 * 7 * n ) / ( 2 ^ 2 * 3 * 5 ) simplifying 7 * n / ( 2 * 3 * 5 ) the only way the equation above has an integer value is if n has at least the factors 2 , 3 and 5 , so we can simplify again and we have the number 7 . the number could be 2 * 3 * 5 , or 2 * 3 * 5 * 2 , or 2 * 3 * 5 * . . . . . however to be less than 200 we can not add any prime number . 2 * 3 * 5 = 120 if we added the next prime factor 7 , we would have s = 2 * 3 * 5 * 7 = 840 thus , answer : B. Here is the formula add(divide(add(const_1, const_4), divide(divide(divide(60, const_2), const_2), const_3)), const_2)

subject: math_geometry
question:
an equilateral triangle t 2 is formed by joining the mid points of the sides of another equilateral triangle t 1 . a third equilateral triangle t 3 is formed by joining the mid - points of t 2 and this process is continued indefinitely . if each side of t 1 is 40 cm , find the sum of the perimeters of all the triangles .

Options:
A. ['a ) 180 cm'
B. 'b ) 220 cm'
C. 'c ) 240 cm'
D. 'd ) 270 cm'
E. 'e ) 300 cm']
answer_text: we have 40 for first triangle , when we join mid - points of first triangle we get the second equilateral traingle then the length of second one is 20 and continues . so we have 40 , 20,10 , . . . we have ratio = 1 / 2 , and it is gp type . sum of infinite triangle is a / 1 - r = 40 / 1 - ( 1 / 2 ) = 80 equilateral triangle perimeter is 3 a = 3 * 80 = 240 . so option : C. Here is the formula add(triangle_perimeter(40, 40, 40), triangle_perimeter(40, 40, 40))

subject: math_physics
question:
two pipes a and b can fill a tank in 10 hours and 20 hours respectively . if both the pipes are opened simultaneously , how much time will be taken to fill the tank ?

Options:
A. 10 / 3
B. 20 / 3
C. 15 / 7
D. 11 / 17
E. 1 / 4
answer_text: "part filled by a in 1 hour = 1 / 10 part filled by b in 1 hour = 1 / 20 part filled by ( a + b ) in 1 hour = 1 / 10 + 1 / 20 = 3 / 20 both the pipes together fill the tank in 20 / 3 hours answer : B. Here is the formula divide(const_1, add(divide(const_1, 10), divide(const_1, 20)))

subject: math_general
question:
the number obtained by interchanging the digits of a two - digit number is less than the original number by 36 . the sum of the digits of the number is 8 . what is the original number ?

Options:
A. 71
B. 62
C. 53
D. 35
E. 45
answer_text: explanation : let the number be 10 x + y . ∴ x + y = 8 . . . . . ( i ) 10 x + y - ( 10 y + x ) = 36 ∴ 9 ( x - y ) = 3 ∴ x - y = 4 . . . . . . . ( ii ) from equation ( i ) and ( ii ) : x = 6 , y = 2 ∴ number = 62 answer : B. Here is the formula add(multiply(subtract(8, divide(36, add(const_10, 8))), const_10), divide(36, add(const_10, 8)))

subject: math_gain
question:
in one alloy there is 10 % chromium while in another alloy it is 6 % . 15 kg of the first alloy was melted together with 35 kg of the second one to form a third alloy . find the percentage of chromium in the new alloy .

Options:
A. 7.2 %
B. 9 %
C. 9.2 %
D. 8.6 %
E. 8.4 %
answer_text: "the amount of chromium in the new 15 + 35 = 50 kg alloy is 0.10 * 15 + 0.06 * 35 = 3.6 kg , so the percentage is 3.6 / 50 * 100 = 7.2 % . answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(add(divide(multiply(10, 15), const_100), divide(multiply(6, 35), const_100)), add(15, 35)), const_100)

subject: math_physics
question:
the food in a camp lasts for 10 men for 20 days . if 30 more men join , how many days will the food last ?

Options:
A. 8 days
B. 4 days
C. 5 days
D. 10 days
E. 17 days
answer_text: "one man can consume the same food in 10 * 20 = 200 days . 30 more men join , the total number of men = 40 the number of days the food will last = 200 / 40 = 5 days . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(multiply(10, 20), add(10, 30))

subject: math_geometry
question:
surface area of a sphere is 2464 cm 2 . if its radius is doubled , then the surface area of the new sphere will be

Options:
A. ['a ) 4920 cm 2'
B. 'b ) 4727 cm 2'
C. 'c ) 9856 cm 2'
D. 'd ) 19712 cm 2'
E. 'e ) none']
answer_text: sol . let the original radius be r . then , original surface area = 4 π r 2 = 2464 cm 2 ( given ) . new radius = 2 r . ∴ new surface area = 4 π ( 2 r ) 2 = 4 x 4 π r 2 = ( 4 x 2464 ) cm 2 = 9856 cm 2 answer : C. Here is the formula surface_sphere(multiply(sqrt(divide(2464, multiply(const_4, const_pi))), const_2))

subject: math_physics
question:
how long does a train 100 m long travelling at 60 kmph takes to cross a bridge of 80 m in length ?

Options:
A. 15.8 sec
B. 14.9 sec
C. 12.4 sec
D. 10.8 sec
E. 11.8 sec
answer_text: Here is the formula divide(add(100, 80), multiply(60, const_0_2778))

subject: math_general
question:
- 74 x 29 + 265 = ?

Options:
A. 2436
B. - 1881
C. - 2801
D. - 2071
E. none of them
answer_text: "given exp . = - 74 x ( 30 - 1 ) + 265 = - ( 74 x 30 ) + 74 + 265 = - 2220 + 339 = - 1881 answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(const_1, const_2), subtract(multiply(74, 29), 265))

subject: math_general
question:
the population of 6 villages is 803 , 9001100 , 1023945 and 980 . what is the population of the seventh village if the average population of the 7 villages is 1000 ?

Options:
A. 1134
B. 1238
C. 1348
D. 1500
E. 1249
answer_text: population of seventh village = 7 * 1000 - ( 803 + 900 + 1100 + 1023 + 945 + 980 ) = 1249 answer : E. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(1000, 7), add(add(const_10, const_10), subtract(subtract(multiply(980, 6), multiply(7, 7)), const_100)))

subject: math_general
question:
if 625 ^ ( - x ) + 25 ^ ( - 2 x ) + 5 ^ ( - 4 x ) = 14 , what is the value of x ?

Options:
A. - 4
B. - 1 / 4
C. 0
D. 1 / 4
E. 4
answer_text: "we ' re told that 625 ^ ( - x ) + 25 ^ ( - 2 x ) + 5 ^ ( - 4 x ) = 15 . we ' re asked for the value of x . since each of the calculated terms must be positive ( regardless of what the exponent is ) , we can use thebasesto our advantage . . . . . with answer a , we ' d have 625 ^ 4 , which is much bigger than 15 ( and we ' d be adding to that big number ) . eliminate a . with answer e , we ' d have 625 ^ ( - 4 ) , which would create a tiny fraction ( and we ' d add some other fractions to it , so the total would be much too small ) . eliminate e . with answer d , we ' d have 625 ^ ( - 1 / 4 ) , which will also be a fraction ( just not as tiny as the one in answer e ) , but the total would still be too small . eliminate d . with answer c , anything to the ' 0 power ' is 1 , so we ' d have 1 + 1 + 1 = 3 . this is not 15 . eliminate c .answer : D.Here is the formula divide(const_1, 4)

subject: math_physics
question:
the radius of the wheel of a bus is 70 cms and the speed of the bus is 66 km / h , then the r . p . m . ( revolutions per minutes ) of the wheel is

Options:
A. 200
B. 250
C. 300
D. 330
E. none of these
answer_text: "radius of the wheel of bus = 70 cm . then , circumference of wheel = 2 π r = 140 π = 440 cm distance covered by bus in 1 minute = 66 ⁄ 60 × 1000 × 100 cms distance covered by one revolution of wheel = circumference of wheel = 440 cm ∴ revolutions per minute = 6600000 / 60 × 440 = 250 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(const_100, multiply(const_1000, 66)), multiply(const_60, const_1)), multiply(multiply(const_2, 70), add(const_3, divide(add(const_2, multiply(const_3, const_4)), power(add(const_2, multiply(const_4, const_2)), const_2)))))

subject: math_physics
question:
harry started a 4 - mile hike with a full 6 - cup canteen of water and finished the hike in 2 hours with 1 cup of water remaining in the canteen . if the canteen leaked at the rate of 1 cup per hour and harry drank 1 cups of water during the last mile , how many cups did he drink per mile during the first 3 miles of the hike ?

Options:
A. 1 / 3
B. 2 / 3
C. 3 / 4
D. 5 / 4
E. 4 / 3
answer_text: no of cups leaked during the trip = 2 cups . no of cups harry drank = 3 cups . no of cups harry drank during the first 3 miles = 2 . drink / mile = 2 / 3 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(subtract(subtract(subtract(6, 2), 1), 1), 3)

subject: math_general
question:
in a room filled with 7 people , 2 people have exactly 1 sibling in the room and 5 people have exactly 2 siblings in the room . if two individuals are selected from the room at random , what is the probability that those two individuals are not siblings ?

Options:
A. 5 / 21
B. 3 / 7
C. 4 / 7
D. 5 / 7
E. 16 / 21
answer_text: "there are suppose a b c d e f g members in the room 4 people who have exactly one sibling . . . . a b c d . . . . ( a is bs ∘ sssibl ∈ g ∘ ssand ∘ ssviceversa ) ∘ ss ( c ∘ ssis ∘ ssds ∘ sssibl ∈ g ∘ ssand ∘ ssviceversa ) ∘ ss ( c ∘ ssis ∘ ssdssibl ∈ gandviceversa ) ( cisds sibling and viceversa ) ( c is ds sibling and viceversa ) . . . now remaning efg are 5 people who have exactly 2 siblings . . . . ( e has f and g as his / her sibling and so on . . ) there are now 3 different set of siblings ( a and b ) ( c and d ) ; ( efg ) now first selecting 2 people out of 7 is 7 c 2 = 21 first sibling pair - - - - ( a and b ) - - selecting 2 people - - 2 c 2 = 1 second sibling pair ( c and d ) - - selecting 2 people - - 2 c 2 = 1 third sibling pair ( e f g ) - - selecting 2 out of 5 - - 5 c 2 = 10 total = 1 + 1 + 10 = 12 but , a / c to formula p ( success ) - 1 - p ( fail ) here , p ( failure ) is selecting 2 people who are siblings = 12 / 21 ( 21 is 7 c 2 ) = 1 - 12 / 21 = 9 / 21 = 3 / 7 ans : B. Here is the formula add(multiply(divide(2, 7), divide(subtract(7, 2), subtract(7, 1))), multiply(divide(2, 7), divide(subtract(7, 2), subtract(7, 1))))

subject: math_physics
question:
two taps a and b can fill a cistern in 12 minutes and 18 minutes respectively . they are turned on at the same time . if the tap a is turned off after 4 minutes , how long will tap b take to fill the rest of the cistern ?

Options:
A. 8 min .
B. 9 min .
C. 10 min .
D. 7 min .
E. none of these
answer_text: in one min , ( a + b ) fill the cistern = 1 ⁄ 12 + 1 ⁄ 18 = 5 ⁄ 36 th in 4 min , ( a + b ) fill the cistern = 5 ⁄ 36 × 4 = 5 ⁄ 9 th rest part = 1 - 5 ⁄ 9 = 4 ⁄ 9 th ∵ 1 ⁄ 18 th part is filled by b in one min . ∴ 4 ⁄ 9 th part is filled by b in 18 × 4 ⁄ 9 = 8 min answer : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(const_1, multiply(add(divide(const_1, 12), divide(const_1, 18)), 4)), divide(const_1, 18))

subject: math_general
question:
how many digits are in ( 8 × 10 ^ 18 ) ( 10 × 10 ^ 10 ) ?

Options:
A. 24
B. 25
C. 26
D. 27
E. 30
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula add(10, add(const_3, const_4))

subject: math_physics
question:
jack and christina are standing 240 feet apart on a level surface . their dog , lindy , is standing next to christina . at the same time , they all begin moving toward each other . jack walks in a straight line toward christina at a constant speed of 3 feet per second and christina walks in a straight line toward jack at a constant speed of 3 feet per second . lindy runs at a constant speed of 10 feet per second from christina to jack , back to christina , back to jack , and so forth . what is the total distance , in feet , that lindy has traveled when the three meet at one place ?

Options:
A. 340
B. 360
C. 380
D. 400
E. 420
answer_text: "the relative speed of jack and christina is 3 + 3 = 6 feet per second . the distance between them is 210 feet , hence they will meet in ( time ) = ( distance ) / ( relative speed ) = 240 / 6 = 40 seconds . for all this time lindy was running back and forth , so it covered ( distance ) = ( speed ) * ( time ) = 10 * 40 = 400 feet . answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(divide(240, add(3, 3)), 10)

subject: math_physics
question:
the speed of a boat in still water is 60 kmph and the speed of the current is 17 kmph . find the speed downstream and upstream ?

Options:
A. 77,43 kmph
B. 80,80 kmph
C. 80,42 kmph
D. 80,40 kmph
E. 83,40 kmph
answer_text: speed downstream = 60 + 17 = 77 kmph speed upstream = 60 - 17 = 43 kmph . answer : A. Here is the formula add(60, 17)

subject: math_general
question:
a solution of 70 litres contains oil and water in the ratio 9 : x . if 6 litres of water is added to the solution , the ratio becomes 6 : 4 , find the value of x ?

Options:
A. 6
B. 8.5
C. 9
D. 6.5
E. 5
answer_text: exp . total new quantity = original sol + water = 70 + 6 = 76 new ratio = 6 : 4 , new quantity of oil = 6 / 10 * 76 = 45.6 lit , new quantity of water = 4 / 10 * 76 = 30.4 lit water present initially = ( 30.4 - 6 ) = 24.4 lit ratio = 45.6 / 24.4 = 9 / x there for x = 4.81 approx 5 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(9, divide(subtract(70, subtract(multiply(4, divide(add(70, 6), add(6, 4))), 6)), subtract(multiply(4, divide(add(70, 6), add(6, 4))), 6)))

subject: math_gain
question:
if an article is sold at 18 % profit instead of 11 % profit , then the profit would be $ 56 more . what is the cost price ?

Options:
A. $ 600
B. $ 800
C. $ 1000
D. $ 1200
E. $ 1400
answer_text: "7 % * cost price = $ 56 1 % * cost price = $ 56 / 7 = $ 8 the cost price is $ 800 . the answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(divide(56, 11), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
if a , b , c , d , e and f are integers and ( ab + cdef ) < 0 , then what is the maximum number d of integers that can be negative ?

Options:
A. 2
B. 3
C. 4
D. 5
E. 6
answer_text: "minimuum should be 1 maximum should be 4 : 1 out of a or b to make the multiplication negative 3 out of c , d , e or f to make the multiplication negative . negative + negative < 0 answer : c maximum will be 5 . . you dont require both the multiplicatin to be negative for entire equation to be negative . . . any one a or b can be negative to make ab negative and it can still be more ( away from 0 ) than the multiplication of 4 other - ve numbers . . . actually by writing minimum required as 1 out of 6 , you are actually meaning 5 out of 6 also possible as you will see d = 5 or 1 will give you same equation . . ans : D. Here is the formula add(divide(const_10, const_2), 0)

subject: math_gain
question:
a jar full of whisky contains 40 % alcohol . a part of this whisky is replaced by another containg 17 % alcohol and now the percentage of alcohol was found to be 26 % . what quantity of whisky is replaced ?

Options:
A. 1 / 3
B. 2 / 3
C. 2 / 5
D. 3 / 5
E. 4 / 5
answer_text: "let us assume the total original amount of whiskey = 10 ml - - - > 4 ml alcohol and 6 ml non - alcohol . let x ml be the amount removed - - - > total alcohol left = 4 - 0.4 x new quantity of whiskey added = x ml out of which 0.19 is the alcohol . thus , the final quantity of alcohol = 4 - 0.4 x + 0.19 x - - - - > ( 4 - 0.21 x ) / 10 = 0.26 - - - > x = 20 / 3 ml . per the question , you need to find the x ml removed as a ratio of the initial volume - - - > ( 20 / 3 ) / 10 = 2 / 5 . hence , c is the correct answeranswer : .Here is the formula divide(subtract(40, 26), subtract(40, 17))

subject: math_geometry
question:
the length of the rectangular field is double its width . inside the field there is square shaped pond 6 m long . if the area of the pond is 1 / 8 of the area of the field . what is the length of the field ?

Options:
A. 24
B. 32
C. 75
D. 28
E. 11
answer_text: "a / 8 = 6 * 6 = > a = 6 * 6 * 8 x * 2 x = 6 * 6 * 8 x = 12 = > 2 x = 24 answer : A. Here is the formula sqrt(divide(multiply(square_area(6), 8), inverse(const_2)))

subject: math_geometry
question:
the area of a triangle is with base 2 m and height 3 m ?

Options:
A. 11
B. 10
C. 787
D. 3
E. 12
answer_text: "1 / 2 * 2 * 3 = 3 m 2 answer : D. Here is the formula triangle_area(2, 3)

subject: math_general
question:
if the price of a certain computer increased 30 percent from c dollars to 351 dollars , then 2 c =

Options:
A. 540
B. 570
C. 619
D. 649
E. 700
answer_text: "before price increase price = c after 30 % price increase price = c + ( 30 / 100 ) * c = 1.3 c = 351 ( given ) i . e . c = 351 / 1.3 = $ 270 i . e . 2 c = 2 * 270 = 540 answer : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(351, divide(add(const_100, 30), const_100)), 2)

subject: math_gain
question:
the purchase price of an article is $ 48 . in order to include 5 % of cost for overhead and to provide $ 12 of net profit , the markup should be

Options:
A. 15 %
B. 25 %
C. 30 %
D. 40 %
E. 45 %
answer_text: "cost price of article = 48 $ % of overhead cost = 5 net profit = 12 $ we need to calculate % markup net profit as % of cost price = ( 12 / 48 ) * 100 = 25 % total markup should be = 25 + 5 = 30 % answer : C. Here is the formula add(multiply(divide(12, 48), const_100), 5)

subject: math_gain
question:
a store reduced the price of all items in the store by 12 % on the first day and by another 10 % on the second day . the price of items on the second day was what percent of the price before the first reduction took place ?

Options:
A. 80.0
B. 79.2
C. 81.0
D. 81.1
E. 81.9
answer_text: "consider price of the all items as $ 100 after a initial reduction of 12 % price becomes = 0.88 * 100 = $ 88 after the final reduction of 10 % price becomes = 0.9 * 88 = $ 79.2 price of all items on second day is 79.2 % of price on first day correct answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(multiply(divide(subtract(const_100, 12), const_100), divide(subtract(const_100, 10), const_100)), const_100)

subject: math_physics
question:
darcy lives 1.5 miles from work . she can walk to work at a constant rate of 3 miles per hour , or she can ride the train to work at a constant rate of 20 miles per hour . if she rides the train , there is an additional x minutes spent walking to the nearest train station , waiting for the train , and walking from the final train station to her work . if it takes darcy a total of 10 more minutes to commute to work by walking than it takes her to commute to work by riding the train , what is the value of x ?

Options:
A. 10.5
B. 15
C. 15.5
D. 30
E. 60
answer_text: "the time it takes darcy to walk to work is ( 1.5 / 3 ) * 60 = 30 minutes the time it takes darcy to take the train is ( 1.5 / 20 ) * 60 + x = 4.5 + x minutes it takes 15 minutes longer to walk , so 30 = 4.5 + x + 10 x = 15.5 minutes answer : C. Here is the formula subtract(subtract(divide(const_60, const_2), 10), divide(const_60, divide(20, 1.5)))

subject: math_general
question:
when the smallest of 3 consecutive odd integers is added to 4 times the largest , it produces a result 732 more than 4 times the middle integer . find the numbers ?

Options:
A. 732
B. 678
C. 698
D. 710
E. 729
answer_text: answer : A. Here is the formula divide(subtract(add(732, multiply(4, const_2)), multiply(4, const_4)), subtract(add(const_1, 4), 4))

subject: math_physics
question:
in a particular city there are 100 homes numbered from 1 , 23 , . . , 100 . the city was build by a builder from chennai . there was 4 to 5 shops in the town which was build by a builder from mumbai . the 2 nd builder can build in 1 ½ times as compared to time by 1 st builder . the 2 nd builder builds in 15 days , then how many 2 ' s are used by the builder from chennai in numbering the 100 homes ?

Options:
A. 17
B. 18
C. 19
D. 20
E. 21
answer_text: in the last line it should be given the builder from chennai in numbering the 100 homes ? then ans is 20 answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(15, 5), 2)

subject: math_physics
question:
p and q can complete a work in 40 days and 24 days respectively . p alone started the work and q joined him after 8 days till the completion of the work . how long did the work last ?

Options:
A. 5 days
B. 10 days
C. 14 days
D. 20 days
E. 26 days
answer_text: "explanation : work done by p in 1 day = 1 / 40 work done by q in 1 day = 1 / 24 work done by p in 8 days = 8 ã — ( 1 / 40 ) = 1 / 5 remaining work = 1 â € “ 1 / 5 = 4 / 5 work done by p and q in 1 day = 1 / 40 + 1 / 24 = 1 / 15 number of days p and q take to complete the remaining work = ( 4 / 5 ) / ( 1 / 15 ) = 12 total days = 8 + 12 = 20 answer : D. Here is the formula add(8, divide(subtract(const_1, divide(8, 40)), add(inverse(40), inverse(24))))

subject: math_physics
question:
joe needs to paint all the airplane hangars at the airport , so he buys 360 gallons of paint to do the job . during the first week , he uses 1 / 4 of all the paint . during the second week , he uses 1 / 2 of the remaining paint . how many gallons of paint has joe used ?

Options:
A. 18
B. 225
C. 175
D. 216
E. 250
answer_text: answer : B. Here is the formula add(multiply(divide(360, 4), 1), divide(subtract(360, multiply(divide(360, 4), 1)), 2))

subject: math_general
question:
a computer manufacturer produces a certain electronic component at a cost of $ 80 per component . shipping costs for delivering the components are $ 5 per unit . further , the manufacturer has costs of $ 16500 a month related to the electronic component regardless of how many it produces . if the manufacturer produces and sells 150 components a month , what is the lowest price it can sell them for such that the costs do n ' t exceed the revenues ?

Options:
A. $ 28
B. $ 82
C. $ 110
D. $ 138
E. $ 195
answer_text: by the question , the equation would be 150 p - 85 * 150 - 16500 = 0 p being the price we want to find and equation resulting zero means revenue and costs are equal so we can get the minimum price of the component . solving the equation , we get p = $ 195 . answer : E. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(add(80, 5), 150), 16500), 150)

subject: math_general
question:
set s consists of integers { 7 , 8 , 10 , 12 , 13 } . if integer n is included in the set , the average ( arithmetic mean ) of set s will increase by 10 % . what is the value of integer n ?

Options:
A. 10
B. 12
C. 16
D. 22
E. 24
answer_text: "the average of the numbers in set s is 10 . if we increase the mean by 10 % , the new mean is 11 . thus , on average , 5 numbers increase by 1 . therefore n = 11 + 5 = 16 the answer : C. Here is the formula add(add(10, 12), 12)

subject: math_general
question:
the average runs scored by a batsman in 30 matches is 50 . in the next 15 matches the batsman scored an average of 26 runs . find his average in all the 45 matches ?

Options:
A. 31
B. 42
C. 29
D. 97
E. 27
answer_text: total score of the batsman in 30 matches = 1500 . total score of the batsman in the next 15 matches = 390 . total score of the batsman in the 30 matches = 1890 . average score of the batsman = 1890 / 45 = 42 . answer : B. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(50, 30), multiply(26, 15)), add(30, 15))

subject: math_gain
question:
the owner of a furniture shop charges his customer 60 % more than the cost price . if a customer paid rs . 2000 for a computer table , then what was the cost price of the computer table ?

Options:
A. 2789
B. 2772
C. 1250
D. 6725
E. 2099
answer_text: "cp = sp * ( 100 / ( 100 + profit % ) ) = 1250 ( 100 / 160 ) = rs . 1250 . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(2000, add(const_1, divide(60, const_100)))

subject: math_other
question:
a shipment of 240 smartphones contains 84 that are defective . if a customer buys two smartphones at random from the shipment , what is the approximate probability that both phones are defective ?

Options:
A. 1 / 250
B. 9 / 74
C. 1 / 11
D. 1 / 9
E. 1 / 3
answer_text: "probability of chosing one defective phone from a lot of 240 which ontains 84 defective phones is = ( 84 / 240 ) probability of chosing one defective phone from a lot of 239 ( we already picked one ) which ontains 83 ( we already picked one ) defective phones is = ( 83 / 239 ) combined probability of series of events = product of the probabilities = ( 84 / 240 ) * ( 83 / 239 ) 84 / 240 is close to ( 7 / 20 ) and ( 83 / 239 ) = ( 25 / 72 ) so answer is ( 7 / 20 ) * ( 25 / 72 ) ( 9 / 74 ) so , answer : B. Here is the formula divide(multiply(84, subtract(84, const_1)), multiply(240, subtract(240, const_1)))

subject: math_general
question:
set a { 3 , 3,3 , 4,5 , 5,5 } has a standard deviation of 1 . what will the standard deviation be if every number in the set is multiplied by 8 ?

Options:
A. a ) 1
B. b ) 2
C. c ) 4
D. d ) 8
E. e ) 16
answer_text: "points to remember - 1 . if oneadd / subtractthe same amont from every term in a set , sd does n ' t change . 2 . if onemultiply / divideevery term by the same number in a set , sd changes by same number . hence the answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(8, 1)

subject: math_physics
question:
the length of a room is 5.5 m and width is 3.75 m . what is the cost of paying the floor by slabs at the rate of $ 600 per sq . metre .

Options:
A. $ 12375
B. $ 13575
C. $ 16575
D. $ 14575
E. $ 18575
answer_text: "a area = 5.5 × 3.75 sq . metre . cost for 1 sq . metre . = $ 600 hence , total cost = 5.5 × 3.75 × 600 = $ 12375answer : A.Here is the formula multiply(600, multiply(5.5, 3.75))

subject: math_general
question:
if n = 10 ^ 100 and n ^ n = 10 k what is the value of k ?

Options:
A. 200
B. 10 ^ 100
C. 10 ^ 102
D. 100 ^ 100
E. 1000 ^ 10
answer_text: "there is a simple logic to this question . ( a ^ m ) ^ n = a ^ mn so , ( 10 ^ 100 ) ^ ( 10 ^ 100 ) = 10 ^ ( 100 * ( 10 ^ 100 ) ) = 10 ^ ( ( 10 ^ 2 ) * ( 10 ^ 100 ) ) = 10 ^ ( 10 ^ 102 ) and this equals 10 ^ k so , k = 10 ^ 102 answer : C. Here is the formula divide(log(10), log(power(10, 100)))

subject: math_probability
question:
a bag contains 30 red jellybeans and 30 blue jellybeans . if 3 jellybeans are removed one at a time , at random and are not replaced , what is the probability that all 3 jellybeans removed from the bag are blue ?

Options:
A. 9 / 100
B. 2 / 19
C. 1 / 8
D. 1 / 20
E. 3 / 10
answer_text: "method - 1 10 red jellybeans and 10 blue jellybeans total outcomes = no . of ways to choose 3 jelly bean at random out of a total 20 jellybeans = 20 c 3 = 1140 favourable outcomes = no . of ways to choose 3 jelly bean such that they are all blue out of 10 blue = 10 c 3 = 120 probability = favourable outcomes / total outcomes = 10 c 3 / 20 c 3 probability = 120 / 1140 = 2 / 19 answer : option b method - 2 probability of first jelly bean to be blue = 10 / 20 [ total 10 blue out of total 20 jellybeans ] probability of second jelly bean to be blue = 9 / 19 [ total 9 blue remaining out of total 19 jellybeans remaining ] probability of third jelly bean to be blue = 8 / 18 [ total 8 blue remaining out of total 18 jellybeans remaining ] required probability = ( 10 / 20 ) * ( 9 / 19 ) * ( 8 / 18 ) = 1 / 20 answer : D. Here is the formula divide(choose(30, 3), choose(add(30, 30), 3))

subject: math_general
question:
what is the sum of the multiples of 4 between 63 and 151 inclusive ?

Options:
A. 2240
B. 2250
C. 2310
D. 2330
E. 2332
answer_text: answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(divide(add(subtract(151, const_3), add(63, const_2)), const_2), add(divide(subtract(subtract(151, const_3), add(63, const_2)), 4), const_1))

subject: math_gain
question:
on a certain road 10 % of the motorists exceed the posted speed limit and receive speeding tickets , but 60 % of the motorists who exceed the posted speed limit do not receive speeding tickets . what percent of the motorists on the road exceed the posted speed limit ?

Options:
A. 10.5 %
B. 12.5 %
C. 15 %
D. 22 %
E. 25 %
answer_text: Here is the formula divide(const_100, multiply(multiply(divide(10, const_100), divide(60, const_100)), const_100))

subject: math_other
question:
if the ratio of apples to bananas is 4 to 3 and the ratio of bananas to cucumbers is 1 to 3 , what is the ratio of apples to cucumbers ?

Options:
A. 4 : 9
B. 4 : 3
C. 3 : 7
D. 2 : 5
E. 1 : 6
answer_text: "the ratio of bananas to cucumbers is 1 to 3 which equals 3 to 9 . the ratio of apples to bananas to cucumbers is 4 to 3 to 9 . the answer : A. Here is the formula divide(divide(4, 3), 3)

subject: math_general
question:
car dealership x , the total profit from sales increased by 12 percent over the previous years , while the number of cars sold decreased by 12 percent over the previous years . approximately what was the average percent increase in profit per car over the previous year .

Options:
A. 18 %
B. 20 %
C. 22 %
D. 27.27 %
E. 35 %
answer_text: "let profit be x and cars sold be y originally profit / car = x / y now it is 1.12 x / 0.88 y = 112 / 88 ( x / y ) increase in profit per car = ( ( 24 / 88 ) ( x / y ) ) / ( x / y ) * 100 = 27.27 % answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(divide(subtract(divide(add(const_100, 12), subtract(const_10, const_3)), divide(const_100, const_10)), divide(const_100, const_10)), const_100)

subject: math_general
question:
a group of students decided to collect as many paise from each member of group as is the number of members . if the total collection amounts to rs . 46.24 , the number of the member is the group is :

Options:
A. 57
B. 68
C. 77
D. 87
E. 97
answer_text: "explanation : money collected = ( 46.24 x 100 ) paise = 4624 paise . ∴ number of members = √ ( 4624 ) = 68 . answer : B. Here is the formula sqrt(multiply(46.24, const_100))

subject: math_general
question:
arnold and danny are two twin brothers that are celebrating their birthday . the product of their ages today is smaller by 15 from the product of their ages a year from today . what is their age today ?

Options:
A. 2 .
B. 4 .
C. 5 .
D. 7 .
E. 9 .
answer_text: "ad = ( a + 1 ) ( d + 1 ) - 15 0 = a + d - 14 a + d = 14 a = d ( as they are twin brothers ) a = d = 7 d answer : D.  Here is the formula divide(subtract(15, const_1), const_2)

subject: math_general
question:
for how many unique pairs of nonnegative integers { a , b } is the equation a ^ 2 - b ^ 2 = 99 true ?

Options:
A. 1
B. 3
C. 5
D. 7
E. 9
answer_text: "answer c ( a + b ) ( a - b ) = 99 3 cases for ( a + b ) , ( a - b ) 99 , 1 33 , 3 11 , 9 answer : B. Here is the formula divide(log(99), log(add(const_4, const_1)))

subject: math_general
question:
how many positive integers less than 100 are there such that they are multiples of 8 or multiples of 7 but not both ?

Options:
A. 21
B. 22
C. 25
D. 24
E. 31
answer_text: answer : D. Here is the formula divide(factorial(subtract(add(const_4, 8), const_1)), multiply(factorial(8), factorial(subtract(const_4, const_1))))

subject: math_general
question:
when x is multiplied by 2 , the result is 19 more than the result of subtracting x from 26 . what is the value of x ?

Options:
A. - 4
B. - 2
C. 15
D. 13
E. 22
answer_text: option : C. Here is the formula divide(add(26, 19), add(2, const_1))

subject: math_general
question:
if - 3 x + 5 y = 48 and 3 x - 2 y = 6 , what is the product of x and y ?

Options:
A. 252
B. 428
C. 464 .
D. 200
E. 642
answer_text: "given - 3 x + 5 y = 48 - - - eq 1 3 x - 2 y = 6 - - eq 2 sum both eqns we get 3 y = 54 = > y = 18 sub 2 y in eq 2 = > 3 x - 36 = 6 . = > x = 14 now xy = 14 * 18 = 252 option : A. Here is the formula multiply(divide(add(6, multiply(divide(add(48, 6), 2), 2)), 3), divide(add(48, 6), 2))

subject: math_physics
question:
a can give b 60 meters start and c 200 meters start in a kilometer race . how much start can b give c in a kilometer race ?

Options:
A. 148.94
B. 148.13
C. 148.22
D. 111.0
E. 111.12
answer_text: "a runs 1000 m while b runs 940 m and c runs 800 m . the number of meters that c runs when b runs 1000 m , = ( 1000 * 800 ) / 940 = 851.06 m . b can give c = 1000 - 851.06 = 148.94 m . answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(multiply(const_100, const_10), divide(multiply(multiply(const_100, const_10), subtract(multiply(const_100, const_10), 200)), subtract(multiply(const_100, const_10), 60)))

subject: math_physics
question:
kim finds a 6 - meter tree branch and marks it off in thirds and fifths . she then breaks the branch along all the markings and removes one piece of every distinct length . what fraction of the original branch remains ?

Options:
A. 7 / 5
B. 1 / 2
C. 8 / 15
D. 2 / 5
E. 3 / 5
answer_text: "3 pieces of 1 / 5 length and two piece each of 1 / 15 and 2 / 15 lengths . removing one piece each from pieces of each kind of lengths the all that will remain will be 2 pieces of 1 / 5 i . e 2 / 5 , 1 piece of 1 / 15 , and 1 piece of 2 / 15 which gives us 2 / 5 + 1 / 15 + 2 / 15 - - - - - > 3 / 5 answer : E. Here is the formula subtract(const_1, add(add(divide(6, multiply(add(const_2, 6), 6)), divide(const_2, multiply(add(const_2, 6), 6))), divide(const_1, multiply(add(const_2, 6), 6))))

subject: math_other
question:
a jar contains a mixture of ab in the ratio 3 : 2 . when 20 l of mixture is replaced with liquid b , ratio becomes 2 : 3 . how many liters of liquid a was present in mixture initially .

Options:
A. 12
B. 15
C. 16
D. 20
E. 36
answer_text: "20 litres of mixture that is replaced will contain 12 litres of a and 8 litres of b ( as a : b = 3 : 2 ) let the initial volume of the mixture be 3 k + 2 k = 5 k so by condition , [ 3 k - 12 ] / [ 2 k - 8 + 20 ] = 2 / 3 = > 9 k - 36 = 4 k - 16 + 40 = > 5 k = 60 solve for k which is k = 12 so initial volume of liquid a = 3 k = 36 litres answer : E. Here is the formula multiply(divide(multiply(add(multiply(3, 2), multiply(2, 2)), divide(20, subtract(multiply(3, 2), 2))), add(3, 2)), 3)

question:
alan buys 4 tvs , a 26 inch , a 28 inch , a 30 inch , and a 32 inch , for his new house . each tv costs $ 200 more than the size below it . alan spends a total of $ 3,600 . how much would he have spent if he had bought only the 28 inch and 30 inch tvs ?

subject: math_general
question:
the average of marks obtained by 120 boys was 38 . if the average of marks of passed boys was 39 and that of failed boys was 15 , the number of boys who passed the examination is ?

Options:
A. 100
B. 110
C. 115
D. 125
E. 140
answer_text: "let the number of boys who passed = x . then , 39 x x + 15 x ( 120 - x ) = 120 x 38 24 x = 4560 - 1800 = > x = 2760 / 24 x = 115 . hence , the number of boys passed = 115 . answer : C. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(38, 120), multiply(120, 15)), subtract(39, 15))

subject: math_physics
question:
john and beth each drove from smallville to crown city by different routes . john drove an an average speed of 40 miles per hour and completed the trip in 30 minutes . beth ' s route was 5 miles longer , and it took her 20 minutes more than john to complete the trip . how many miles per hour was beth ' s average speed on this trip ?

Options:
A. 24
B. 30
C. 48
D. 54
E. 75
answer_text: speed = distance / time distance for john = speed * time = 40 * 1 / 2 = 20 miles distance for beth = distance for john + 5 = 20 + 5 = 25 miles time taken by beth = time taken by john + ( 1 / 3 hour ) = 1 / 2 + 1 / 3 = 5 / 6 speed of beth = d / t = 25 / ( 5 / 6 ) = 25 * 6 / 5 = 30 miles per hour hence , b is the answeranswer : .Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(40, divide(30, const_60)), 5), divide(add(30, 20), const_60))

subject: math_other
question:
what is the greatest positive integer n such that 3 ^ n is a factor of 36 ^ 100 ?

Options:
A. 100
B. 200
C. 300
D. 600
E. 900
answer_text: "prime factorization out is the way to go here ! 36 ^ 100 3 ^ 2 times 2 ^ 2 and both to the power of 100 [ ( 3 ^ 2 ) * ( 2 ^ 2 ) ] ^ 100 giving you the beautifully simplistic answer of 3 ^ 200 and 2 ^ 200 ans is 200 answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(subtract(36, 100), 100)

subject: math_general
question:
the sum of the first n positive perfect squares , where n is a positive integer , is given by the formula n ^ 3 / 3 + c * n ^ 2 + n / 6 , where c is a constant . what is the sum of the first 17 positive perfect squares ?

Options:
A. 1,010
B. 1,164
C. 1,240
D. 1,316
E. 1,785
answer_text: "first we need to find the constant ' c ' . the easiest way to find this is for the sum of the first two perfect squares for 1 and 2 = 1 and 4 respectively . hence lhs = 1 + 4 and plug n = 2 for rhs and simplify to get c = 1 / 2 . plug values of n = 17 and c = 1 / 2 into the equation and simplify to get the answer : E. Here is the formula divide(divide(multiply(multiply(17, add(17, const_1)), add(multiply(17, 2), const_1)), 6), divide(multiply(multiply(17, add(17, const_1)), add(multiply(17, 2), const_1)), 6))

question:

answer_text: "let x be the height of triangle a and y be the height of triangle of b . since triangles are similar , ratio of area of a and b is in the ratio of x ^ 2 / y ^ 2 therefore , ( x ^ 2 / y ^ 2 ) = 2023 / 1792 ( x ^ 2 / y ^ 2 ) = ( 17 * 17 * 7 ) / ( 16 * 16 * 7 ) ( x ^ 2 / y ^ 2 ) = 17 ^ 2 / 16 ^ 2 x / y = 17 / 16 ans = b you need to take a hint from given options to find factors of 2013 and 2527answer : .Here is the formula sqrt(divide(2023, 1792))

answer_text: "explanation : d = 120 m + 120 m = 240 m rs = 85 + 65 = 150 * 5 / 18 = 417 / 10 t = 420 * 10 / 417 = 10.07 sec answer : B. Here is the formula multiply(const_3600, divide(divide(add(120, 120), const_1000), add(85, 65)))

subject: math_gain
question:
john invests $ x at the semi - annual constant compounded rate of 2 percent and also does $ 15,000 at the quarterly constant compounded rate of 4 percent . if the interests are the same after 1 year , what is the value of x ? ?

Options:
A. 20000
B. 30000
C. 40000
D. 30301.5
E. 50000
answer_text: "a = p ( 1 + r / n ) ^ nt a = total amount accrued p = principal deposited r = rate of interest in decimal form n = number of times per year , interest compounded t = time in number of years . . x ( 1 + 0.02 / 2 ) ^ 2 - x = 15,000 ( 1 + 0.04 / 4 ) ^ 4 - 15,000 [ when the principal is subtracted from the total amount accrued , the resulting difference is the interest portion and question states interests are equal ) = > x [ ( 1.01 ) ^ 2 - 1 ] = 15,000 [ ( 1.01 ) ^ 4 - 1 ] = > x [ ( 1.01 ) ^ 2 - 1 ] = 15,000 [ ( 1.01 ) ^ 2 + 1 ] [ ( 1.01 ) ^ 2 - 1 ] - - > using a ^ 2 - b ^ 2 = a + b x a - b formula and cancel common expression on both sides = > x = 15,000 ( 1.0201 + 1 ) = 30301.5 hence answer : D. Here is the formula divide(subtract(multiply(multiply(multiply(4, const_100), const_100), power(add(1, divide(divide(4, const_100), 4)), 4)), multiply(multiply(4, const_100), const_100)), subtract(power(add(1, divide(divide(2, const_100), 2)), 2), 1))

question:
a train covers a distance in 50 min , if it runs at a speed of 48 kmph on an average . the speed at which the train must run to reduce the time of journey to 40 min will be .

answer_text: time = 50 / 60 hr = 5 / 6 hr speed = 48 mph distance = s * t = 48 * 5 / 6 = 40 km time = 40 / 60 hr = 2 / 3 hr new speed = 40 * 3 / 2 kmph = 60 kmph answer : A. Here is the formula divide(multiply(48, divide(50, const_60)), divide(40, const_60))

subject: math_general
question:
what could be the range of a set consisting of odd multiples of 9 ?

Options:
A. 21
B. 24
C. 35
D. 72
E. 70
answer_text: "range = the difference between the greatest and the smallest numbers in the sequence . our sequence is odd and is a multiple of 7 . every number in that sequence can be represented like this : 9 * ( 2 n + 1 ) where n is any positive integer . range = 9 * ( 2 m + 1 ) - 9 * ( 2 n + 1 ) = 9 * 2 * ( m - n ) = 18 * ( m - n ) . m , n - any positive integers the answer must be divisible by 18 , which is only 72 . the correct answer : D. Here is the formula multiply(9, const_4)

subject: math_gain
question:
the compound interest earned by sunil on a certain amount at the end of two years at the rate of 10 % p . a . was rs . 420 . find the total amount that sunil got back at the end of two years in the form of principal plus interest earned .

Options:
A. rs . 2530
B. rs . 2430
C. rs . 2420
D. rs . 2410
E. rs . 2440
answer_text: "let the sum be rs . p p { [ 1 + 10 / 100 ] 2 - 1 } = 420 p ( 10 / 100 ) ( 2 + 10 / 100 ) = 420 [ a 2 - b 2 = ( a - b ) ( a + b ) ] p = 420 / ( 0.1 ) ( 2.1 ) = 2000 . amount = 2000 + 420 = rs . 2420 answer : C. Here is the formula add(divide(420, subtract(power(add(const_1, divide(10, const_100)), const_2), const_1)), 420)

subject: math_physics
question:
sandy walked 20 meters towards south . then sandy turned to her left and walked 20 meters . she then turned to her left and walked 20 meters . she then turned to her right and walked 25 meters . what distance is she from the starting point and in which direction ?

subject: math_general
question:
the weight of every type a widget is the same , the weight of every type b widget is the same , and the weight of every type c widget is the same . if the weight of 7 type a widgets is equal to the weight of 4 type b widgets , and the weight of 3 type b widgets is equal to the weight of 7 type c widgets . what is the ratio of the total weight of 1 type a widget and 1 type b widget , to the total weight of 1 type b widget and 1 type c widget ?

Options:
A. 5 : 4
B. 7 : 6
C. 9 : 8
D. 11 : 10
E. 13 : 12
answer_text: "3 b = 7 c and so b = 7 c / 3 7 a = 4 b and so a = 4 b / 7 = 4 c / 3 a + b = 4 c / 3 + 7 c / 3 = 11 c / 3 b + c = 7 c / 3 + c = 10 c / 3 the ratio of a + b : b + c = 11 : 10 the answer : D. Here is the formula divide(add(1, divide(7, 4)), add(divide(7, 4), divide(3, 4)))

subject: math_general
question:
a man can swim in still water at 3 km / h , but takes twice as long to swim upstream than downstream . the speed of the stream is ?

C. 1.1
D. 1.5
E. 1
answer_text: "m = 3 s = x ds = 3 + x us = 3 + x 3 + x = ( 3 - x ) 2 3 + x = 6 - 2 x 3 x = 3 x = 1 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(3, const_3)

question:
a man gains 30 % by selling an article for a certain price . if he sells it at double the price , the percentage of profit will be .

Options:
A. 130 %
B. 140 %
C. 150 %
D. 260 %
E. 170 %
answer_text: "explanation : let the c . p . = x , then s . p . = ( 130 / 100 ) x = 13 x / 10 new s . p . = 2 ( 13 x / 10 ) = 26 x / 10 profit = 26 x / 10 - x = 26 x / 10 profit % = ( profit / c . p . ) * 100 = > ( 26 x / 10 ) * ( 1 / x ) * 100 = 260 % option : D. Here is the formula add(multiply(subtract(multiply(add(const_1, divide(30, const_100)), const_2), const_1), const_100), const_100)

subject: math_physics
question:
a train traveled the first d miles of its journey it an average speed of 50 miles per hour , the next d miles of its journey at an average speed of y miles per hour , and the final d miles of its journey at an average speed of 160 miles per hour . if the train ’ s average speed over the total distance was 96 miles per hour , what is the value of y ?

Options:
A. 68
B. 84
C. 90
D. 120
E. 160
answer_text: "average speed = total distance traveled / total time taken 3 d / d / 50 + d / y + d / 160 = 96 solving for d and y , 15 y = 11 y + 480 3 y = 480 y = 160 answer : E. Here is the formula divide(add(multiply(multiply(const_4, const_2), const_10), multiply(const_100, const_4)), subtract(divide(multiply(add(multiply(multiply(const_4, const_2), const_10), multiply(const_100, const_4)), const_3), 96), add(multiply(const_4, const_2), const_3)))

subject: math_physics
question:
2 persons can finish a job in 8 days . first person alone can finish the work in 24 days . how many days does the second person take to finish the job ?

Options:
A. 10 days
B. 12 days
C. 14 days
D. 16 days
E. 18 days
answer_text: 2 persons can do work in 1 day = 1 / 8 first person can do work in 1 day = 1 / 24 second person can do work in 1 day = 1 / 8 - 1 / 24 = 1 / 12 so second person can finish work in 12 days answer : B. Here is the formula inverse(subtract(divide(const_1, 8), divide(const_1, 24)))

subject: math_physics
question:
a cistern is filled by pipe a in 12 hours and the full cistern can be leaked out by an exhaust pipe b in 18 hours . if both the pipes are opened , in what time the cistern is full ?

B. 60 hrs
C. 36 hrs
D. 80 hrs
E. 90 hrs
answer_text: "time taken to full the cistern = ( 1 / 12 - 1 / 18 ) hrs = 1 / 36 = 36 hrs answer : C. Here is the formula divide(const_1, subtract(divide(const_1, 12), divide(const_1, 18)))

subject: math_general
question:
of the 100 employees at company x , 80 are full - time , and 100 have worked at company x for at least a year . there are 20 employees at company x who aren ’ t full - time and haven ’ t worked at company x for at least a year . how many full - time employees of company x have worked at the company for at least a year ?

Options:
A. 20
B. 30
C. 50
D. 80
E. 100
answer_text: "full time employee who have not worked for at least one year = a full time employee who have worked for at least one year = b non full time employee who have worked for at least one year = c non full time employee who have not worked for at least one year = d a + b + c + d = 150 a + b = 80 i . e . c + d = 70 b + c = 100 i . e . a + d = 50 d = 20 i . e . c = 70 - 20 = 50 i . e . b = 100 - 50 = 50 i . e . a = 80 - 50 = 30 b = 20 answer : A. Here is the formula subtract(subtract(100, 80), 20)

subject: math_other
question:
